translated: Emiwendo egyo waggulu giraga nti SARS-CoV-2 erina obusobozi bwa waggulu okusaasaana okusinga MERS-CoV ne SARS-CoV, naye tetta nnyo okusinga ebibiri ebisembayo.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Noolwekyo, kizibu nnyo okukkakkanya ekizibu kya SARS-CoV-2 okusinga ekya MERS-CoV ne SARS-CoV.
translated: Bwe kityo, kizibu nnyo okufuga ekirwadde kya SARS-CoV-2 okusinga ekya MERS-CoV ne SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: Abantu abalwalira okumu batera okubeera mu maka gamu oba mu lukuŋŋaana lumu oba mu kidduka kimu nga ku lyato.
translated: Okutandika mu bibinja kutera okubaawo mu maka ge gamu oba okuva mu kukuŋŋaana oba mmotoka y’emu ng’emmeeri egenda okulambula.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: Abalwadde ab’engeri eno baba baatambula okuva oba nga baabeerako mu Wuhan oba ebifo ebirala ebyalimu obulwadde oba nga baaliko n’abantu abaalina akawuka oba abalwadde wiiki bbiri nga tebannafuna bulwadde.
translated: Abalwadde batera okuba n’ebyafaayo by’okutambula oba okubeera mu Wuhan oba ebitundu ebirala ebikoseddwa oba okukwatagana n’abantu oba abalwadde abalina akawuka mu wiiki bbiri eziyise nga tebannatandika.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: Wabula, kitegeezeddwa nti abantu basobola okubeera n’akawuka naye ne batalaga bubonero okumala ekiseera ekisukka wiiki ebbiri era n’abalwadde abawonye ne basiibulwa mu malwaliro nabo basobola okuddamu okubeera n’akawuka, nga kino kiraga obwetaavu bw’okwongera ku kiseera kya kalantiini.
translated: Wabula kitegeezeddwa nti abantu basobola okutambuza akawuka kano nga tebalina bubonero busukka wiiki bbiri ate abalwadde abawonye abasiibulwa mu malwaliro basobola okuddamu okutambuza akawuka kano, ekiweereza alamu okwongera ku budde bw’okubeera mu kalantiini.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: Abalwadde baba n’omuwendo ogwa bulijjo oba ogukendedde ogw’obutaffaali bw’omu mu musaayi obweru mu musaayi ogutambula (peripheral white blood cells) (naddala lymphocytes) mu kiseera ekisooka.
translated: Abalwadde balina obutoffaali obweru obw’okumpi (naddala obutoffaali obuyitibwa lymphocytes) obwa bulijjo oba obukendedde mu kiseera ekisookerwako.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Okugeza, lymphopenia awamu ne white blood cell count < 4×109/L nga mw’otwalidde ne lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, ne aspartate aminotransferase ayongezeddwa ne viremia byasangibwa mu balwadde ba COVID-19 abawera 1,099 COVID-19.
translated: Okugeza, lymphopenia nga omuwendo gw’obutoffaali obweru < 4×109/L omuli n’omuwendo gw’obutoffaali obuyitibwa lymphocyte < 1×109/L, n’okulinnya kw’emiwendo gya aspartate aminotransferase ne viremia byasangiddwa mu balwadde ba COVID-19 1,099.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: Omuwendo gwa enzyme z’ekibumba ne myoglobin gwalinnyisibwa mu musaayi gw’abalwadde abamu, era ne C-reactive protein ne erythrocyte sedimentation nabyo byalinnya mu musaayi gw’abalwadde abasinga.
translated: Emiwendo gy’enziyiza z’ekibumba n’ebinywa ne myoglobin zeeyongera mu musaayi gw’abalwadde abamu, era C-reactive protein ne erythrocyte sedimentation ne zeeyongera mu musaayi gw’abalwadde abasinga obungi.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: Mu balwadde abaali obubi ennyo, omuwendo gwa D-dimer, ng’eno fibrin degradation product ebeera mu musaayi, yeeyongera, n’omuwendo gwa lymphocyte ne gukendeera.
translated: Mu balwadde abalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi, omuwendo gwa D-dimer, ekintu ekivunda fibrin ekiri mu musaayi, gwali waggulu, era omuwendo gw’obutoffaali obukola omusaayi gwakendeera mpolampola.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: Waliwo obuzibu obulabwa mu kifuba mu balwadde ba COVID-19 abasinga obungi era nga kino kigendera wamu n’obuzibu mu mawuggwe gaabwe (bilateral patchy shadows oba ground glass opacity).
translated: Obutabeera bwa bulijjo mu kukuba ebifaananyi mu kifuba busangibwa mu balwadde ba COVID-19 abasinga obungi era nga bulabika mu bisiikirize ebiyitibwa bilateral patchy shadows oba ground glass opacity mu mawuggwe.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Abalwadde batera okufuna lubyamira atali wa bulijjo, okukosebwa okw’amangu mu mawuggwe, n’obuzibu mu kkubo ly’omukka ogussibwa (acute respiratory distress syndrome, ARDS).
translated: Abalwadde batera okufuna ekifuba ekitali kya bulijjo, obuvune obw’amaanyi mu mawuggwe, n’obulwadde bw’okusannyalala ennyo (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: ARDS bw’ebaawo, wabaawo okuzimba n’okufuna amazzi amangi, n’ennyama n’ebikka ebiwundu ekireetawo obuzibu mu kuwaanyisiganya kw’omukka.
translated: ARDS bw’ebaawo, okuzimba okutafugibwa, okukuŋŋaanyizibwa kw’amazzi, n’okuzimba ebiwuziwuzi ebigenda mu maaso bikosa nnyo okuwanyisiganya ggaasi.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: Pneumocytes ez’ekika I ne II (type-I and type-II pneumocytes) zikendeeza omuwendo gwa surfactant ne zongeza okunyigirizibwa kungulu, ekyo ne kikendeeza obusobozi bw’amawuggwe okugaziwa ne kyongera emikisa gy’amawuggwe okulemererwa.
translated: Obutakola bulungi bwa pneumocytes ez’ekika kya I n’ekika kya II kikendeeza ku mutindo gw’ekirungo ekikola ku ttaka era kyongera okusika omuguwa ku ngulu, bwe kityo ne kikendeeza ku busobozi bw’amawuggwe okugaziwa n’okwongera ku bulabe bw’okugwa kw’amawuggwe.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: Noolwekyo, ebyazuulibwa ebikyasinze okubeera ebibi mu kukebera ekifuba bitera okuba nga byenkanankana n’embeera y’obulwadde ekyasinze okubeera embi.
translated: N’olwekyo, ebizuuliddwa ebisinga obubi mu kukebera mu kifuba bitera okukwatagana n’obunene bw’obulwadde obusinga okuba obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Mu Gwokubiri nga 18, 2020, okwekenneenya obulwadde bwa COVID-19 okwasooka mu ggezeserezo kwalaga okuyubuka kwa pneumocytes, okukolebwa kw’olububi lwa hyaline, n’okwatika kw’olususu, ne multinucleated syncytial cells mu mawuggwe g’omulwadde eyafa obulwadde buno, nga kino kifaanana n’okwekenneenya abalwadde abalina obuwuka ne ARDS era nga kifaanana n’eky’abalwadde ba SARS ne MERS.
translated: Nga February 18, 2020, okwekenneenya obulwadde bwa COVID-19 okwasooka kwalaga okukendeera kw’obutoffaali bw’omubiri, okutondebwa kw’olususu lwa hyaline, n’okuyingira kw’obutoffaali obuyitibwa interstitial lymphocyte, n’obutoffaali obuyitibwa multinucleated syncytial cells mu mawuggwe g’omulwadde eyafa obulwadde buno, nga kikwatagana n’obulwadde bwa... obulwadde bw’akawuka ne ARDS era nga bufaananako n’obw’abalwadde ba SARS ne MERS.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: Okuzuula RNA ya SARS-CoV-2 okuyita mu reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) kyakozesebwa ng’enkola eyasinga mu kukebera COVID-19.
translated: Okuzuula SARS-CoV-2 RNA nga bayita mu reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) kye kyakozesebwa ng’omusingi omukulu ogw’okuzuula ekirwadde kya COVID-19.

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: Wabula, olw’okuba nga waliwo bangi abazuulwa nti tebalina kawuka so nga bakalina, ekiyinza okusajjula ekizibu ky’obulwadde, obubonero bw’embeera y’obulamu bwatandika okukozesebwa mu kukebera (nga tebakyesigama ku RT-PCR yekka) mu China mu Gwokubiri nga 13, 2020.
translated: Wabula olw’omuwendo omunene ogw’obulimba-negative, oguyinza okwanguya ssennyiga ono, obubonero bw’obujjanjabi bwatandika okukozesebwa okuzuula obulwadde (nga tebukyasinziira ku RT-PCR yokka) mu China nga February 13, 2020.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: Embeera y’emu era yaliwo ne ku kukebera SARS.
translated: Embeera efaananako bwetyo nayo yagwawo n’okuzuula obulwadde bwa SARS.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: Noolwekyo, okugatta ebyafaayo by’obuwadde, obubonero, okukebera kw’omu ggezeserezo, n’okukuba ekifaananyi kikulu era kisaanye okukolebwa okusobola okuzuula obulungi obulwadde.
translated: N’olwekyo, okugatta ebyafaayo by’obulwadde, okweyoleka mu bujjanjabi, okukeberebwa mu laboratory, n’ebizuuliddwa mu by’amasannyalaze kyetaagisa era kyetaagisa nnyo okusobola okuzuula obulungi.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: Mu Gwokubiri nga 14, 2020, Feng Zhang group yannyonnyola enkola y’okukozesa akakodyo CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique okuzuula SARS-CoV-2, nga kano kazuula obutundutundu bwa SARS-CoV-2 RNA ku 20 × 10-18 mol/L okutuuka ku 200 × 10-18 mol/L (kkopi 10-100 buli microliter y’ekikeberwa) nga bakozesa akati (dipstick) mu kiseera ekitaweza ddakiika asatu awatali kwetaaga kupima bintu bingi.
translated: Nga February 14, 2020, ekibinja kya Feng Zhang kyannyonnyola enkola y’okukozesa enkola ya SHERLOCK eyesigamiziddwa ku CRISPR okuzuula SARS-CoV-2, ezuula ebitundu bya SARS-CoV-2 RNA ebikoleddwa ku 20 × 10-18 mol/L okutuuka ku 200 × 10-18 mol/L (kopi 10-100 buli microliter y’ebiyingizibwa) ng’okozesa dipstick mu ssaawa ezitakka wansi wa emu nga tekyetaagisa bikozesebwa mu bujjuvu.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: Kisuubirwa nti akakodyo kano akapya kasobola okuyamba ennyo mu kukebera singa kaba kakasiddwa mu sampolo ezikeberwa mu mageserezo.
translated: Tusuubira nti enkola empya esobola okwongera nnyo ku buwulize n’obulungi singa ekakasibwa mu sampuli z’obujjanjabi.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: Olw’obutabaawo bumanyirivu ku kawuka ka CoV akabadde tekamanyiddwa, abasawo okusinga basobola kulabirira bulabirizi balwadde ba COVID-19, nga bwe bagezaako eddagala ery’enjawulo eryali likozeseddwako oba nga lyalagirwako emabega mu kujjanjaba obuwuka bwa CoV obulala nga SARS-CoV ne MERS-CoV n’obulwadde bw’obuwuka obulala (Omweso ​(Omweso2).2).
translated: Olw’obutaba na bumanyirivu ku CoV empya, abasawo okusinga basobola okuwa obujjanjabi obuwagira abalwadde ba COVID-19, ate nga bagezaako obujjanjabi obw’enjawulo obubadde bukozesebwa oba obuteeseddwako emabegako okujjanjaba CoVs endala nga SARS-CoV ne MERS- CoV n’endwadde endala ez’akawuka (Table (Table2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: Eddagala lino mulimu erikozesebwa mu kiseera kino n’eryo eriyinza okujjanjaba obuwuka, erikendeeza ku busibage, steroids, omusaayi (plasma) okuva ku bantu abawonye, eddagala ly’Ekichina, n’okubudaabudibwa.
translated: Enzijanjaba zino mulimu obujjanjabi obuliwo kati n’obuyinza okukolebwa n’eddagala eriweweeza ku kawuka, eddagala eriziyiza obusimu obuziyiza endwadde, eddagala eriyitibwa steroids, plasma okuva mu balwadde abawonye, eddagala ly’Abachina, n’obuyambi bw’eby’omwoyo.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: Ne plasma okuva ku bantu abawonye naye yateesebwa okukozesebwa ng’eddagala.
translated: Ne plasma okuva mu balwadde abawonye kyateesebwako okukozesebwa okujjanjaba.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: Kampuni ezikola eddagala zikola butaweera okukola antibodies n’eddagala erigema akawuka kano.
translated: Kkampuni ezikola eddagala zivuganya okukola eddagala eriziyiza akawuka kano n’okugema akawuka kano.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 kasinga kulumba mawuggwe mu kusooka era nga kirabika oluvannyuma ne kalyoka kalumba ebitundu ebirala ebirina ACE2, omwo nga mwe muli omuyungo gw’ebyenda (gastrointestinal system) n’ensigo.
translated: SARS-CoV-2 esinga kulumba mawuggwe mu ntandikwa era osanga era elumba, ku ddaala ettono, ebitundu ebirala ebiraga ACE2, gamba ng’enkola y’omu lubuto n’ensigo.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: Wadde nga guli bwegutyo, obuzibu bw’okulemererwa okussa kye kizibu ekisinga mu balwadde era kye kisinga okuviirako okufa.
translated: Wadde kiri kityo, okussa obubi n’okulemererwa bye bisinga okutiisa abalwadde era kye kisinga okutta.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: Noolwekyo, ebyuma ebiyamba mu kussa bikulu nnyo mu kukola ku buzibu bw’okussa n’okutaasa obulamu era nga kino kizingiramu ebintu nga general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, ne invasive mechanical ventilation okusinziira ku bungi bw’obulwadde.
translated: Bwe kityo, obuyambi bw’okussa bukulu nnyo okumalawo obubonero n’okutaasa obulamu era nga mulimu obujjanjabi bwa oxygen mu bulambalamba, oxygen akulukuta ennyo, empewo etali ya kuyingirira, n’okuyingiza empewo ey’ebyuma ebiyingira okusinziira ku buzibu bw’obulwadde.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: Abalwadde abalina obuzibu obw’amaanyi mu kussa balina okuyambibwako ne extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), nga y’enkola ekozesebwa mu kujjanjaba ababa balemereddwa ddala okussa ekiyinza okubaviirako okufa.
translated: Abalwadde abalina obubonero obw’amaanyi mu kussa balina okuwagirwa n’enkola ya extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), enkola ekyusiddwa ey’okuyita mu mutima n’amawuggwe ekozesebwa mu kujjanjaba okulemererwa kw’omutima oba okussa okuyinza okutta obulamu.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: Ekirala, okukuuma ekigero kya electrolyte, okwewala n’okujjanjaba akawuka akalala akayinza okulumba omulwadde n’akawuka okusaasaanira omubiri, n’okukuuma ebitundu by’omubiri ebikulu ne bisigala nga bikola nabyo bikulu nnyo mu balwadde ba SARS-CoV-2.
translated: Okugatta ku ekyo, okukuuma bbalansi y’amasannyalaze, okuziyiza n’okujjanjaba yinfekisoni ey’okubiri n’okusannyalala kw’amazzi amakyafu, n’okukuuma emirimu gy’ebitundu ebikulu nabyo byetaagisa nnyo eri abalwadde ba SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Kibadde kimanyiddwa nti cytokine storm ava ku busibage okukola ekisusse (overreaction of the immune system) mu balwadde ba SARS ne MERS.
translated: Kimanyiddwa nti omuyaga gwa cytokine guva ku kukola ekisusse kw’abaserikale b’omubiri mu balwadde ba SARS ne MERS.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: Cytokine storm kwe kwanukula kw’omubiri okulimu okuzimba olw’okufulumya cytokines ez’enjawulo omuli TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, ne MCP-1.
translated: Cytokine storm ngeri ya systemic inflammatory response eraga okufulumya omuddirirwa gwa cytokines omuli TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, ne MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: Cytokines zino zireetera obutaffaali obulwanyisa endwadde okufulumya molekyu ennyingi nga zino ze zisinga okuviirako ARDS n’ebitundu by’omubiri eby’enjawulo okulemererwa.
translated: Cytokines zino zireetera obutoffaali bw’abaserikale okufulumya omuwendo omunene ennyo ogwa free radicals nga zino ze zisinga okuvaako ARDS n’okulemererwa kw’ebitundu ebingi.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: Okukendeeza ku busibage kikulu mu kujjanjaba cytokine storms, naddala mu balwadde abali obubi.
translated: Okuziyiza obusimu bw’omubiri kyetaagisa nnyo mu kujjanjaba omuyaga gwa cytokine naddala mu balwadde ab’amaanyi.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: Corticosteroids ne tocilizumab, ng’eno anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, zikozeseddwa okujjanjaba cytokine storm.
translated: Corticosteroids ne tocilizumab, anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, zikozesebwa okujjanjaba omuyaga gwa cytokine.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: Enzijanjaba ya cytokine storm endala ey’okukendeeza ku busibage mwemuli okutuukanya T cell-directed immune response; okuggalira IFN-γ, IL-1, ne TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; ne HDAC inhibitors.
translated: Enzijanjaba endala eziziyiza obusimu obuziyiza endwadde ku kibuyaga ya cytokine mulimu okukyusakyusa mu kuddamu kw’abaserikale b’omubiri okulung’amibwa obutoffaali bwa T; okuziyiza IFN-γ, IL-1, ne TNF; Okuziyiza JAK; eddagala lya blinatumomab; ekiziyiza obubonero bwa cytokine 4; n’ebiziyiza HDAC.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Steroids, nga zikozesebbwa okukendeeza ku busibage, zaakozesebwa nnyo mu kujjanjaba SARS okukendeeza ku kukosebwa kw’okuzimba.
translated: Steroids, nga immunosuppressants, zaakozesebwa nnyo mu kujjanjaba SARS okukendeeza ku buzibu bw’okwonooneka kw’okuzimba.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Wabula, steroids bwe zikozesebwa mu bungi tezaayamba ku bulabe obutuusibwa ku mawuggwe mu balwadde ba SARS ne COVID-19.
translated: Wabula eddagala eriweweeza ku bulwadde bwa steroid ku miwendo emingi tegyali gya mugaso eri obuvune obw’amaanyi mu mawuggwe mu balwadde ba SARS ne COVID-19.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: Mpozzi ate, ziyinza okuviirako obukosefu (side effects) obw’amaanyi, naddala avascular osteonecrosis, ekiyinza okukosa ebyo ebisuubirwa okuvaamu.
translated: Wabula, ziyinza okuleeta ebizibu eby’amaanyi naddala okuzimba amagumba mu misuwa, ekikosa ennyo enteekateeka y’okuteebereza.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Newankubadde guli gutyo, kiteeseddwa nti corticosteroids akozesebwe mu balwadde ba COVID-19 abayi ennyo mu doozi entonotono.
translated: Wadde kiri kityo, emisomo emimpi egy’eddagala lya corticosteroids ku ddoozi entono oba ey’ekigero gibadde gisemba okukozesebwa n’obwegendereza ku balwadde ba COVID-19 abali mu mbeera embi.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: Mu kiseera ky’okuwandiikiramu olupapula luno, tewali ddagala lyakakasiddwa kuwonya kawuka kano.
translated: Mu kiseera kino nga bino biwandiikibwa, tewali ddagala likola bulungi eritta akawuka kakakasiddwa.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: Wabula, okuweebwa remdesivir ng’ayisibwa mu misuwa, ng’eno nucleotide analog, kyazuulibwa nga kyakola ku mulwadde wa COVID-19 Omumerika.
translated: Wabula okussa mu misuwa nga kirimu remdesivir, ekirungo kya nucleotide analog, kizuuliddwa nti kikola bulungi mu mulwadde Omumerika alina COVID-19.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: Remdesivir ddagala lya buwuka ppya nga lyakolebwa Gilead nga mu kusooka lyakozesebwa mu kujjanjaba endwadde ezireetebwa obuwuka bwa Ebola ne Marlburg.
translated: Remdesivir ddagala ddene eritta akawuka eryakolebwa kkampuni ya Gilead mu kusooka okujjanjaba endwadde ezireetebwa akawuka ka Ebola ne Marlburg.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: Oluvannyuma, remdesivir era kyazuulibwa ng’asobola okujjanjaba obuwuka obulala obulina single stranded RNA omuli MERS ne SARS.
translated: Oluvannyuma, remdesivir era yalaga nti kisoboka okuziyiza obuwuka obulala obwa RNA obw’omuguwa gumu omuli akawuka ka MERS ne SARS.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: Nga beesigama ku bino, aba Gilead baawa China eddagala lino okuligezesa ku bantu abalina SARS-CoV-2, era ebinaavaamu birindiriddwa n’amaddu mangi.
translated: Okusinziira ku bino, Gilead ewadde China ekirungo kino okukola okugezesa emirundi ebiri ku bantu abalina obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2, era ebinaavaamu bisuubirwa nnyo.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: Ekirala, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, ne ribavirin nalyo liteeseddwa ng’eddagala eriyinza okujjanjaba abalwadde abalina obuzibu obw’amaanyi mu kussa.
translated: Okugatta ku ekyo, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, ne ribavirin bibadde biteesebwako ng’obujjanjabi obuyinza okuweebwa abalwadde abalina obubonero obw’amaanyi obw’okussa.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: Ekiddukano, okusiikuuka emmeeme, okusesema, okukosebwa ekibumba, n’obuzibu obulala obw’amaanyi busobola okujjawo nga lopinavir/ritonavir agattiddwa n’eddagala eddala.
translated: Ekiddukano, okuziyira, okusiiyibwa, okwonooneka kw’ekibumba, n’ebizibu ebirala bisobola okubaawo oluvannyuma lw’obujjanjabi obw’okugatta ne lopinavir/ritonavir.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: Entabagana y’eddagala lino n’eddagala eddala nga likozeseddwa ku balwadde esaanye okulondoolwa n’obwegendereza.
translated: Enkolagana y’obujjanjabi buno n’eddagala eddala erikozesebwa mu balwadde erina okulondoolebwa n’obwegendereza.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: Plasma okuva mu balwadde abawonye n’okukola zi antibody
translated: Plasma okuva mu balwadde abawonye n’okukola antibody

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: Okuggya omusaayi ku bantu abawonye obulwadde obusiigibwa okusobola okujjanjaba abalwadde abalala abalina obulwadde bwebumu obwo oba okutaasa abantu abalamu obutafuna bulwadde obwo kibaddewo okumala ekiseera.
translated: Okukunganya omusaayi okuva mu balwadde abawona obulwadde obusiigibwa okujjanjaba abalwadde abalala abatawaanyizibwa obulwadde bwe bumu oba okukuuma abantu abalamu obutakwatibwa bulwadde buno kubaddewo ebyafaayo bingi.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: Mu butuufu, abantu abawonye obulwadde batera okuba ne antibody nnyingi ezisobola okulwanyisa obulwadde obwo mu musaayi gwabwe.
translated: Mazima ddala, abalwadde abawonye batera okuba n’obutoffaali obuziyiza obuwuka obuleeta endwadde bungi nnyo mu musaayi gwabwe.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: Antibodies buba butaffaali obukolebwa B lymphocytes okulwanyisa obuwuka n’ebintu ebirala ebitalina kubeera mu mubiri era bukenga molekyu ez’enjawulo eziba mu buwuka ne bubunafuya butereevu.
translated: Antibodies ye immunoglobulin (Ig) ekolebwa B lymphocytes okulwanyisa obuwuka obuleeta endwadde n’ebintu ebirala eby’ebweru era zitegeera molekyu ez’enjawulo mu buwuka obuleeta endwadde ne zizifuula ezitaliimu butereevu.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: Nga basinziira ku kino, plasma yaggyibwa mu musaayi gw’ekibinja ky’abalwadde abaawona COVID-19 n’akubwa mu balwadde 10 abaali obubi ennyo.
translated: Okusinziira ku kino, plasma yakung’aanyiziddwa mu musaayi gw’ekibinja ky’abalwadde abawonye ekirwadde kya COVID-19 ne bagikuba empiso mu balwadde 10 abaali abalwadde ennyo.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: Embeera yaabwe yalongooka mu ssaawa 24, era n’okuzimba ne kukendeera n’omuwendo gw’akawuka ne gukendeera era n’entambula y’empewo mu musaayi n’etereera.
translated: Obubonero bwabwe bwatereera mu ssaawa 24, nga buwerekerwako okuzimba okukendeera n’obungi bw’akawuka n’okulongoosa omukka gwa oxygen mu musaayi.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: Wabula, walina okubaawo okwekakasa n’okutangaaza okusobola okuyisa enkola yonna okukozesebwa ku bantu abangi ng’enkola eyo tennaba kukulaakulanyizibwa.
translated: Naye, okukakasa n’okunnyonnyola kyetaagisa okuteesa ku nkola ey’okukozesa mu bunene nga obujjanjabi obw’enjawulo tebunnaba kukolebwa.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: Ekirala, olw’ebyo ebiva mu kukozesa eddagala, ebibi ebyekuusa ku plasma birina okusooka okutunuulirwa.
translated: Okugatta ku ekyo, okusinziira ku bujjanjabi obuva mu kujjanjaba, ebimu ku bizibu ebikwatagana ne plasma bisaana okulowoozebwako n’obwegendereza.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: Okugeza, antibodies zisobola okuviirako obusibage okweyongera ennyo ne kireetawo cytokine release syndrome, nga kino kivaamu obutwa obw’obulabe ennyo.
translated: Okugeza, obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde busobola okusitula ennyo abaserikale b’omubiri ne buleeta obulwadde bwa cytokine release syndrome, obuyinza okutta obulamu.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: Antibodies ezibeera mu musaayi zitera kubeera ntono, ate ng’obwetaavu bwa plasma bubeera bungi okusobola okujjanjaba abantu abalwadde ennyo.
translated: Ebiseera ebisinga obungi bw’obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde mu musaayi buba butono, era obwetaavu bwa plasma buba bungi okujjanjaba abalwadde abali mu mbeera embi.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: Kizibu okukulaakulanya n’okufulumya antibody mu bwangu ezimala okulwanyisa ekizibu ky’obulwadde obuli mu nsi yonna.
translated: Kizibu okukola n’okufulumya obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde obw’enjawulo mu bwangu obumala okulwanyisa ssennyiga ow’ensi yonna.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: Noolwekyo, ekiba kisoboka kwe kwawula B cells okuva mu bantu abawonye ne tumanya koodi z’endagabutonde za antibody ezirwanyisa obulwadde oba okukebera ne tulaba antibody ezirwanyisa obulwadde puloteni z’akawuka enkulu.
translated: Bwe kityo, kikulu nnyo era kya mugaso okwawula obutoffaali bwa B okuva mu balwadde abawonye n’okuzuula enkodi z’obuzaale eziwandiika obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde obukola oba okukebera obuziyiza obukola obulungi ku puloteyina ezikulu ez’akawuka.

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: Mu ngeri eno, tusobola okwongera ku bungi bwa antibody ezikolebwa.
translated: Mu ngeri eno, tusobola bulungi okutumbula okukola kw’obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: TCM akozeseddwa okujjanjaba endwadde eziwerako mu China okumala enkumi n’enkumi z’emyaka.
translated: TCM ebadde ekozesebwa okujjanjaba endwadde ez’enjawulo mu China okumala enkumi n’enkumi z’emyaka.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: Wabula, obukozi bwe bwesigama nnyo ku kugatta ebirungo eby’enjawulo mu ddagala ebikyukakyuka okusinziira ku kiba kizuuliddwa ku bulwadde okusinziira ku binnyonnyola (theory) TCM.
translated: Naye, ebivaamu byayo okusinga byesigamye ku kugatta ebitundu ebingi mu nkola eyawukana okusinziira ku kuzuula obulwadde nga kwesigamiziddwa ku ndowooza za TCM.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: Ebirungo ebikola ebisinga tebimanyiddwa oba tebitegeerekeka bulungi olw’okuba nga kizibu okukenenulamu ebirungo ebyo ne bikakasibwa oba ebibikola.
translated: Ebitundu ebisinga ebikola bisigala nga tebimanyiddwa oba tebitegeerekeka bulungi kuba kizibu okuggyamu n’okukakasa ebitundu ng’ebyo oba okugatta kwabyo okulungi.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: Mu kiseera kino, olw’okuba nga tewali ddagala limanyiddwa kujjanjaba COVID-19, TCM lye limu ku ddagala erisinga okukozesebwa mu kujjanjaba abalwadde abalina obubonero obutonotono oba abo abawonye emitendera emingiko.
translated: Mu kiseera kino, olw’obutaba na bujjanjabi bulungi era obw’enjawulo ku COVID-19, TCM efuuse emu ku bujjanjabi obukulu obw’enjawulo eri abalwadde abalina obubonero obutono oba obw’ekigero oba eri abo abawonye okuva mu mitendera egy’amaanyi.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Okugeza, kapiso za Shu Feng Jie Du n’eza Lian Hua Qing Wen zaazuulibwa nga zikola bulungi ku kujjanjaba COVID-19.
translated: Okugeza kkapu za Shu Feng Jie Du ne kkapu za Lian Hua Qing Wen zazuuliddwa nga zikola bulungi mu kujjanjaba COVID-19.

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: Abalwadde bangi baawona COVID-19 province eziwerako mu China nga bajjanjabwa ne TCM mu bitundu 87% eby’abalwadde, omuli Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), ne Hunan (50%), so nga mu Hubei province, eyakozesa TCM mu bitundu nga 30% byokka eby’abalwadde bwa COVID-19, okuwona gye kwasinga okubeera wansi (13%).
translated: Emiwendo egy’okuwona egy’oku ntikko mu kujjanjaba abalwadde ba COVID-19 gyalabiddwa mu masaza agawerako mu China agaakozesa TCM mu balwadde baabwe 87%, omuli Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), ne Hunan (50%), so nga Hubei province, eyakozesa TCM mu balwadde baayo aba COVID-19 nga 30% bokka, ye yasinga okuwona (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: Wabula, okugeraageranya kuno si kwa bwenkanya olw’okuba nga waliwo ensonga endala nnyingi ng’omuwendo n’embeera y’abalwadde ezirina okussibwa mu kwekaliriza.
translated: Wabula kino kugeraageranya kwa maanyi nnyo kubanga ebintu ebirala bingi ebikosa abalwadde ng’omuwendo n’obuzibu bw’abalwadde birina okuteekebwa mu kwekenneenya.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: Mu Gwokubiri nga 18, 2020, Boli Zhang ne bakozi banne baafulumya ebyava mu kunoonyereza nga bageraageranya okujjanjabisa eddagala ly’ekizungu (western medicine) lyokka n’obujjanjabi obugattiddwa nga mulimu eddagala ly’ekizingu ne TCM.
translated: Nga February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang ne banne baafulumya okunoonyereza okugeraageranya obujjanjabi bw’eddagala ly’amawanga g’obugwanjuba (WM) lyokka n’obujjanjabi obw’okugatta WM ne TCM.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: Baakizuula nti ebiseera ebyetaagisa ebbugumu ly’omubiri okuddawo, obubonero okubula, n’okubeera ku kitanda byali bimpi nnyo mu kibinja eky’eddagala ly’ekizungu+TCM okusinga mu kibinja eky’eddagala ly’ekizungu lyokka.
translated: Baakizuula nti ebiseera ebyetaagisa okuddamu ebbugumu ly’omubiri, obubonero okubula, n’okuweebwa ekitanda mu ddwaaliro byali bimpi nnyo mu ngeri eyeewuunyisa mu kibinja kya WM+TCM okusinga mu kibinja kya WM yokka.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: Ekisinga okusanyusa, okusajjuka kw’obubonero (okuva ku kubeera obutonotono okufuuka obw’amaanyi ennyo) kwali kutono nnyo mu kibinja ky’eddagala ly’ekizungu+TCM okusinga mu kibinja ky’eddagala ly’ekizungu lyokka (7.4% bw’ogeraageranya ne 46.2%) ate era okufa kwali kutono mu kibinja ky’eddagala ly’ekizungu+TCM okusinga mu kibinja ky’eddagala ly’ekizungu lyokka (8.8% bw’ogeraageranya ne 39%).
translated: Ekisinga okwewuunyisa, omuwendo gw’obubonero obweyongera (okuva ku kitangaala okutuuka ku buzibu) gwali wansi nnyo mu kibinja kya WM+TCM okusinga ku kibinja kya WM yokka (7.4% okusinziira ku 46.2%) era okufa kwali wansi mu kibinja kya WM+TCM okusinga WM yokka ekibinja (8.8% okusinziira ku 39%).

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: Weewaawo guli bwegutyo, obukozi n’obulungi bwa TCM bukyetaaga okugezesa okulimu ensonga endala nga kukolebwa ku balwadde abasingako ne mu bifo ebisingako.
translated: Wadde kiri kityo, obulungi n’obukuumi bwa TCM bikyalindiridde okugezesebwa okusingawo okufugibwa obulungi ku mitendera eminene ne mu bifo ebisingawo.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: Era kyandinyumye nnyo okunnyonnyola ebikolebwa n’okutangaaza ku bikolo bya TCM ebijjanjaba oba ebibikola bwe kiba nga kisoboka.
translated: Era kyandibadde kya njawulo okulaga enkola y’ebikolwa n’okunnyonnyola ebitundu ebikola obulungi eby’obujjanjabi bwa TCM oba okugatta kwabwo bwe kiba kisoboka.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: Abalwadde abateeberezebwa oba abakakasiddwa okuba ne COVID-19 batera okuba n’okutya okungi okw’obulwadde buno obusiigibwa ennyo era obw’obulabe, n’abantu abateereddwa mu kalantiini nabo bafuna ekiwuubaalo, ettuulawamu, n’obusungu.
translated: Abalwadde abateeberezebwa oba abakakasiddwa COVID-19 basinga kutya nnyo obulwadde buno obusiigibwa ennyo era n’okufa, era n’abantu abali mu kalantiini nabo bafuna obukoowu, obwereere, n’obusungu.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: Okwongereza ku ekyo, obubonero bw’obulwadde okugeza omusujja, okubulwa omukka mu mubiri, n’okukolola awamu n’obuzibu obw’amaanyi obuva ku ddagala ng’okubulwa otulo ebireetebwa corticosteroids bisobola okwongera ku kweraliikirira n’okutabuka omutwe.
translated: Ekirala, obubonero bw’obulwadde buno ng’omusujja, obutaba na mukka gwa mukka, n’okusesema wamu n’ebizibu ebiva mu bujjanjabi ng’obuteebaka obuva ku ddagala lya corticosteroids bisobola okuvaako okweraliikirira okusingawo n’okunyigirizibwa mu birowoozo.

sourceString: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
targetString: Mu biseera ebyasooka nga SARS yaakabalukawo, waaliwo endwadde nnyingi ezeekuusa ku mutwe omuli okwennyika ebirowoozo okutatadde, okweraliikirira, okutya ennyo, okupakunkana, okulowooza ebitaliiyo, obutassaayo mwoyo, n’okwetta.
translated: Mu mutendera ogusooka ogw’obulwadde bwa SARS, endwadde ez’enjawulo ez’eby’omutwe omuli okwennyamira okutambula obutasalako, okweraliikirira, okutya, okucamuka mu birowoozo, obubonero bw’eby’omutwe, okuwuguka, n’okutuuka n’okwetta byaloopebwa.

sourceString: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
targetString: Okunoonya abantu ababaddeko n’omulwadde n’okubassa mu kalantiini okw’obuwaze, ng’ekimu ku bikolebwa mu kulwanyisa COVID-19, kisobola okuleetera abantu okweyongera okweraliikirira n’okuwulira ng’abalina omusango olw’ebiva mu bulwadde buno obusiigibwa, kalantiini, n’okusosolwa kw’ab’omu maka gaabwe ne mikwano gyabwe.
translated: Okulondoola abantu okukwatagana n’okuteekebwa mu kalantiini okukakasibwa, ng’ekimu ku bigenda okukolebwa mu by’obulamu bw’abantu ku kirwadde kya COVID-19, kiyinza okuleetera abantu okweraliikirira n’okwesalira omusango olw’ebikosa obulwadde buno, kalantiini, n’okuvumwavumwa ku famire zaabwe n’emikwano.

sourceString: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
targetString: Noolwekyo, obulabirizi mu mbeera z’emitwe busaanye okuweebwa abalwadde ba COVID-19, abateeberezebwa okuba naye, n’abantu ababeera nabo awamu n’abantu bonna ababwetaaga.
translated: Bwe kityo, obujjanjabi bw’obwongo bulina okuweebwa abalwadde ba COVID-19, abantu abateeberezebwa, n’abantu abakwatagana nabo wamu n’abantu bonna abali mu bwetaavu.

sourceString: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
targetString: Obuyambi mu by’ebirowoozo bulina okubaamu okuteekawo tiimu z’abasawo mu bintu eby’enjawulo ebikwata ku mitwe, okutegeeza abantu mu budde era mu ngeri etegeerekeka ku bikwata ku SARS-CoV-2 n’enteekateeka z’okujjanjaba n’okukozesa ebyuma bikalimagezi okwewala okusembereragana.
translated: Obuwagizi bw’eby’omwoyo bulina okubeeramu okussaawo ttiimu z’ebyobulamu bw’obwongo ez’enjawulo, empuliziganya entegeerekeka nga buli kiseera era entuufu efuna ebipya ebikwata ku kirwadde kya SARS-CoV-2 n’enteekateeka z’obujjanjabi n’okukozesa ebyuma eby’ekikugu n’okukozesa okwewala okukwatagana okw’oku lusegere ne bannaabwe.

sourceString: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
targetString: Eddagala erigema lya mugaso mu kutaataaganya entambula y’akawuka okuva mu nsolo mwe kabeera ne mu bantu abalwadde okudda mu bintu ebiyinza okukatambuza era litera okukolera awamu n’eddagala erijjanjaba obuwuka mu kulwanyisa obulwadde obuleetebwa obuwuka obuba bubaluseewo.
translated: Eddagala erigema eddungi lyetaagisa nnyo okutaataaganya olujegere lw’okusiigibwa okuva mu tterekero ly’ebisolo n’abantu abalina akawuka okutuuka mu bakyaza abayinza okukwatibwa era emirundi mingi likwatagana n’obujjanjabi bw’eddagala eriweweeza ku kawuka mu kufuga endwadde ezireetebwa akawuka akavaayo.

sourceString: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
targetString: Waliwo kaweefube akoleddwa okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema eryesigamiziddwa ku S protein okukola antibody empangaazi era ez’amaanyi ezisannyalaza ne/oba obusibage obulwanyisa SARS-CoV.
translated: Kaweefube akoleddwa okukola eddagala eriweweeza ku puloteyina ya S okukola obutoffaali obuziyiza obulwadde obumala ebbanga eddene era ery’amaanyi n’/oba obutafaali obuziyiza obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
targetString: Eddagala erigema erikolebwa mu buwuka bwennyini lyekalirizibwa mu nsolo ku SARS.
translated: Eddagala erigema obulamu (live-attenuated vaccines) lyekenneenyeddwa mu bikolwa by’ebisolo ku SARS.

sourceString: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
targetString: Wabula, enkola y’eddagala erigema lino mu bantu abakadde ne mu lethal-challenge models n’enkola yaalyo mu kutangira obuwuka mu nsolo erina okumala okukakasibwa nga terinnakolwako kunoonyereza kwa kisawo.
translated: Wabula, obulungi bw’okugema kuno mu mubiri (in vivo efficacy) mu bantu abakadde n’ebikozesebwa mu kusoomoozebwa okutta n’obukuumi bwabyo okuva ku bulwadde bwa zoonotic virus tebinnaba kuzuulibwa nga okunoonyereza okw’obujjanjabi tekunnatandikibwawo.

sourceString: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
targetString: Kino kirabika okuba nga kiri bwekityo kubanga SARS yafa emyaka 17 egiyise era tewali yali azzeemu kumufuna okuva olwo.
translated: Kino kirabika kiva ku kuba nti SARS yafa emyaka 17 egiyise era okuva olwo tewali mulwadde mupya.

sourceString: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
targetString: Okwawukanako n’ekyo, waliwo abantu abatera okufuna MERS mu Middle East era n’asaasaanira ebitundu ebirala olw’ensolo z’abeeramu ezibeera mu bitundu ebyo.
translated: Okwawukana ku ekyo, emisango egy’enjawulo n’ebibinja bya MERS bikyagenda mu maaso n’okubeerawo mu Middle East era ne bisaasaana mu bitundu ebirala olw’okusigala kw’ensonda z’ebisolo mu bitundu ebirimu endwadde.

sourceString: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
targetString: Eddagala erigema MERS lyakolebwa nga bakozesa akawuka akanafuyiziddwa, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, obutaffaali obwefaanaanyiriza akawuka ne recombinant protein subunits era lyagezesebwa mu nsolo.
translated: Enkola z’okugema zikoleddwa ku MERS nga bakozesa akawuka akatakola, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, obutundutundu obulinga akawuka ne recombinant protein subunits era ebimu byekenneenyezebwa mu bikolwa by’ebisolo.

sourceString: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
targetString: Okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema SARS-CoV-2 mu bantu ab’obusibage obutono kyetaagibwa nnyo era mu bwangu okusobola okulwanyisa ekizibu ekiriwo.
translated: Okukola eddagala erigema SARS-CoV-2 eritali lya bulabe era erikola obulungi eri abantu abatalina baserikale ba mubiri mulimu gwa mangu era mukulu nnyo mu kufuga ekirwadde kino ekigenda mu maaso.

sourceString: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
targetString: Wabula, kisoomooza okuvvuunuka obuzibu buno olw’ekiseera ekinene (emyezi nga 18) ekyetaagisa okulikulaakulanya n’okukyukakyuka kwa CoVs.
translated: Wabula, kizibu okuvvuunuka obuzibu olw’ekiseera ekiwanvu (nga wakati w’emyezi 18) ekyetaagisa okukola eddagala erigema n’enjawulo ez’amaanyi eza CoVs.

sourceString: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
targetString: Olw’okubeera obulwadde obupya, enneeyisa ya COVID-19 enzijuvu yaakatandika okweyoleka mu nkumi z’abalwadde.
translated: Ng’obulwadde obupya, COVID-19 yaakatandiika okweyoleka mu bujjanjabi bwayo obujjuvu mu nkumi n’enkumi z’abalwadde.

sourceString: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
targetString: Mu mbeera ezisinga, abalwadde basobola okuwona empolampola awatali kusigala na bubonero.
translated: Emirundi egisinga, abalwadde basobola okuwona mpolampola nga tebalina bivaamu.

sourceString: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
targetString: Wabula, nga bweguli ku SARS ne MERS, abalwadde ba COVID-19 batera okulwala ennyo n’okufa.
translated: Wabula okufaananako ne SARS ne MERS, COVID-19 nayo ekwatagana n’endwadde n’okufa okungi mu balwadde abalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
targetString: Noolwekyo, okuteebereza obuzibu obuyinza okuleetebwa obulwadde kikulu eri ebitongole byobujjanjabi okuteekateeka obuweereza bwabwe, naddala mu bifo ebitatuukamu bulungi buweereza.
translated: N’olwekyo, okuzimba enkola y’okuteebereza obulwadde buno kyetaagisa nnyo ebitongole by’ebyobulamu okukulembeza obuweereza bwabyo naddala mu bitundu ebitaliimu by’obugagga.

sourceString: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
targetString: Nga twesigama ku kunoonyereza kw’ekisawo okwakakolebwa, ensonga zino ziyinza okuba nga zeekuusa ku buzibu obuyinza okutuuka ku balwadde ba COVID-19 (Omweso ​(Omweso33):
translated: Okusinziira ku kunoonyereza okukoleddwa okutuusa kati, ensonga zino wammanga ziyinza okukosa oba okukwatagana n’okuteebereza kw’abalwadde ba COVID-19 (Table (Table33):

sourceString: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
targetString: Obukulu: Obukulu ye nsonga eyasinga obukulu mu kuteebereza obuzibu obuyinza okutuuka ku balwadde ba SARS, era nga kino kituufu ne ku COVID-19.
translated: Emyaka: Emyaka gye gyasinga obukulu mu kuteebereza obulwadde bwa SARS, nga kino nakyo kituufu ku COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
targetString: COVID-19 yasinga kukwata bantu ba myaka 30-65 ng’ebitundu 47.7% eby’abalwadde abo basussa emyaka 50 mu kunoonyereza ku bantu 8,866 nga bwe kiragiddwa waggulu.
translated: COVID-19 yasinga kugwa ku myaka 30-65 nga 47.7% ku balwadde abo baali basukka emyaka 50 mu kunoonyereza okwakolebwa ku balwadde 8,866 nga bwe kyayogeddwa waggulu.

sourceString: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Abalwadde abaali beetaaga obujjanjabi obw’amaanyi okusinga baalina endwadde endala ze baasangibwa nazo era baali bakulu nnyo okusinga abo abataalina (ku myaka nga 66 bw’ogeraageranya ne 51), nga kitegeeza nti obukulu nsonga nkulu mu kuteebereza obuzibu obuyinza okutuuka ku balwadde ba COVID-19.
translated: Abalwadde abeetaaga okulabirirwa okw’amaanyi baali basinga okuba n’endwadde ezikwatagana n’ebizibu ebisookerwako era nga bakulu nnyo okusinga abo abaali tebeetaaga (ku myaka gya wakati egy’emyaka 66 okusinziira ku 51), ekiraga nti emyaka gye gitegeeza ebinaava mu balwadde ba COVID-19.

sourceString: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
targetString: Ekikula: SARS-CoV-2 akutte abasajja bangi okusinga abakazi (0.31/100,000 bw’ogeraageranya ne 0.27/100,000), nga bwe kiragiddwa waggulu.
translated: Okwegatta: SARS-CoV-2 efunye abasajja bangi okusinga abakazi (0.31/100,000 okusinziira ku 0.27/100,000), nga bwe kyayogeddwa waggulu.

sourceString: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
targetString: Endwadde n’obuzibu obulala: Abalwadde ba COVID-19 abeetaaga obujjanjabi obw’amaanyi baba n’emikisa mingi egy’okufuna obuvune ku mutima (acute cardiac injury) ne arrhythmia.
translated: Comorbidities and complications: Abalwadde ba COVID-19 abeetaaga okulabirira ennyo batera okufuna obuvune obw’amaanyi mu mutima n’obutatambula bulungi.

sourceString: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
targetString: Obuzibu ku mutima era ye yali ensonga enkulu eyaviirangako okufa mu balwadde ba SARS.
translated: Ebintu ebiva ku mutima nabyo bye byasinga okufa mu balwadde ba SARS.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kyazuulibwa nti SARS-CoV-2 era asobola okwekwata ku ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, ekiyinza okuleetera ekibumba obutakola bulungi mu balwadde ba COVID-19.
translated: Kigambibwa nti SARS-CoV-2 era esobola okwesiba ku ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, ekiyinza okuvaako ekibumba obutakola bulungi mu balwadde ba COVID-19.

sourceString: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
targetString: Kikulu okumanya nti obukulu n’endwadde endala bikwatagana nnyo era buli kimu kiyinza okubaako engeri gye kikosa ekirala.
translated: Kinajjukirwa nti emyaka n’obulwadde obusirikitu bikwatagana nnyo era biyinza okutaataaganya.

sourceString: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
targetString: Ebizuulibwa mu mageserezo ebitali bya bulijjo: Omuwendo gwa C-reactive protein (CRP) mu musaayi gulaga obunyiinyiitivu bw’okuzimba oba okukosebwa kw’ennyama era eragiddwa ng’obuzibu obuyinza okutuuka ku balwadde, ekibaawo ng’eddagala likola, n’okuwonera ddala.
translated: Ebizuuliddwa mu laboratory ebitali bya bulijjo: Omutindo gwa C-reactive protein (CRP) mu musaayi gulaga obuzibu bw’okuzimba oba obuvune bw’ebitundu era kiteeseddwa okuba nga kye kiyinza okuteebereza obulwadde, okuddamu ku bujjanjabi, n’okuwona okusembayo.

sourceString: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
targetString: Akakwate wakati w’omuwendo gwa CRP n’obunyiinyiitivu n’obuzibu obuyinza okutuuka ku balwadde ba COVID-19 nako koogeddwako.
translated: Enkolagana y’omutindo gwa CRP n’obuzibu n’okuteebereza COVID-19 nayo eteeseddwa.

sourceString: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
targetString: Ekirala, okweyongera kwa lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), ne creatine kinase (CK) nabyo biyinza okuyamba mu kuteebereza ebiyinza okuvaamu.
translated: Okugatta ku ekyo, okulinnya kwa lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), ne creatine kinase (CK) nabyo biyinza okuyamba okulagula ebinaavaamu.

sourceString: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
targetString: Enzyme zino zeeyolekera mu bungi mu bitundu eby’enjawulo, naddala mu mutima n’ekibumba, era zifulumizibwa nga waliwo ekikoseddwa.
translated: Enziyiza zino zeeyoleka nnyo mu bitundu by’omubiri ebingi naddala mu mutima n’ekibumba, era zifulumizibwa mu kiseera ky’okwonooneka kw’ebitundu by’omubiri.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: Noolwekyo, ze zitera okulaga obuzibu obuba butuuse ku mutima oba ekibumba.
translated: Bwe kityo, bubonero bwa kinnansi obulaga obutakola bulungi mu mutima oba ekibumba.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: Obubonero bw’ekisawo obukulu: Okukuba ekifaananyi mu kifuba n’okulondoola obubonero okumala ekiseera bisaana okukolebwa awamu n’ensonga endala okusobola okuteebereza obuzibu obunaaleetebwa COVID-19.
translated: Obubonero obukulu obw’obujjanjabi: Okukuba ebifaananyi mu kifuba n’okukulaakulana kw’obubonero bw’obujjanjabi mu kiseera ekigere bisaana okulowoozebwako awamu n’ensonga endala okulagula ebivaamu n’ebizibu ebiyinza okuva mu COVID-19.

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Okukozesa steroids: Nga bwe kyannyonnyoddwa waggulu, steroids zikkakkanya ku busibage era zikozesebwa nnyo mu kuyamba ku kujjanjaba obulwadde obusiigibwa okukendeeza ku bunyiinyiitivu bw’obuvune bw’okuzimba.
translated: Okukozesa eddagala eriweweeza ku bulwadde: Nga bwe kyayogeddwa waggulu, eddagala eriweweeza ku busimu obuziyiza endwadde eritera okukozesebwa ng’eddagala eriweweeza ku ndwadde ezisiigibwa okukendeeza ku buzibu bw’okwonooneka kw’okuzimba.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: Olw’okuba nga doozi ennene eya corticosteroids yakozesebwa nnyo mu balwadde ba SARS abayi, abalwadde abaawona bangi baafuna okusannyalala kw’amagumba (avascular osteonecrosis) ne basigala n’obulemu okumala ekiseera ekiwanvu n’omutindo gw’obulamu omubi.
translated: Okuva eddagala eriyitibwa corticosteroids erya waggulu bwe lyakozesebwa ennyo mu balwadde ba SARS ab’amaanyi, bangi ku bawonawo baalina obulwadde bw’amagumba agatali mazzi (avascular osteonecrosis) nga balina obulemu obw’obulamu bwonna n’omutindo gw’obulamu omubi.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Noolwekyo, bwe kiba kyetaagisizza, steroids zisaanye okukozesebwa mu doozi entono era okumala ekiseera kitono mu balwadde ba COVID-19.
translated: Bwe kityo, bwe kiba kyetaagisa, eddagala eriweweeza ku bulwadde bwa COVID-19 lirina okukozesebwa ku ddoozi entono ate okumala akaseera katono mu balwadde ba COVID-19.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: Obuzibu bw’obwongo: Nga kinnyonnyoddwa waggulu, mu kiseera ky’okubalukawo kwa COVID-19 abalwadde bangi banyigiriziddwa nnyo mu bwongo olw’okumala ebiseera bingi mu kalantiini n’okuba nga tebamanyi kiddirira era balabye ab’eŋŋanda zaabwe ne balwadde bannaabwe nga bafa.
translated: Situleesi y’obwongo: Nga bwe kyayogeddwa waggulu, mu kiseera kino ekirwadde kya COVID-19 abalwadde bangi bafunye situleesi ey’ekitalo kuba batera okugumira ebbanga eddene nga bali mu kalantiini n’obutali bukakafu obuyitiridde era ne balaba okufa kw’ab’omu maka gaabwe ab’oku lusegere n’abalwadde bannaabwe.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: Abalwadde bano bateekwa okubudaabudibwa n’okuwagirwa okumala ekiseera okubayamba okuwona okunyigirizibwa kuno n’okudda mu bulamu obwa bulijjo.
translated: Kikulu nnyo okuwa amagezi ku by‟omwoyo n‟obuyambi obw‟ekiseera ekiwanvu okuyamba abalwadde bano okudda engulu okuva mu situleesi n‟okudda mu bulamu obwa bulijjo.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: Okusinziira ku kunoonyereza okwakolebwa ku bikwata ku bantu, COVID-19 alabika okuba n’obubonero obwawukana ne SARS.
translated: Okusinziira ku kunoonyereza ku bungi bw’abantu okutuusa kati, COVID-19 alabika alina ebintu eby’enjawulo ebikwata ku ndwadde okuva ku SARS.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko eky’okuba nti yeekubisiza mu kitundu ky’omussizo ekya wansi, SARS-CoV-2 asobola bulungi okwekubisiza mu kitundu ky’omussizo ekya waggulu n’ataleetawo bubonero obutono oba n’ataleetawobubonero mu biseera ebisooka nga yaakakwata omuntu, nga kino kifaanana ne ku buwuka bwa CoVs obulala obuleeta ssenyiga owa bulijjo.
translated: Ng’oggyeeko okukoppa mu nkola y’okussa eya wansi, SARS-CoV-2 esobola bulungi okukoppa mu nkola y’okussa eya waggulu era ereeta obubonero obutono oba obutabaawo mu mutendera ogusooka ogw’okukwatibwa, okufaananako ne CoV endala ezireeta omusujja ogwa bulijjo.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: Noolwekyo, abalwadde mu kiseera ekisooka oba mu kiseera ng’akawuka tekanneeyoleka basobola okufulumya omuwendo gw’akawuka mungi mu mirimu gyabwe egya buli lunaku, ne kizibuwaza omulimu gw’okulwanyisa obulwadde.
translated: N’olwekyo, abalwadde abakwatibwa akawuka mu kiseera ekisooka oba mu kiseera ky’okufumbirwa basobola okuvaamu akawuka akangi mu biseera by’emirimu gya buli lunaku, ekivaako obuzibu bungi mu kufuga ssennyiga ono.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: Wabula, okusaasaanya SARS-CoV kwalowoozebwa nti kwalingawo ng’abalwadde bayi nnyo, so ng’okusaasaana tekwali kungi mu biseera ebisooka.
translated: Wabula okusiigibwa kwa SARS-CoV kwatwalibwa ng’abalwadde balwadde nnyo, so ng’ate okusaasaana okusinga tekwabaawo ku mutendera ogusooka.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: Noolwekyo, ekizibu kya COVID-19 ekiriwo mu kiseera kino kya maanyi nnyo era kizibu okulwanyisa okusinga ku kizibu kya SARS.
translated: Bwe kityo, ekirwadde kya COVID-19 ekiriwo kati kya maanyi nnyo era kizibu okufuga okusinga ekirwadde kya SARS.

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kaweefube wa maanyi agenda mu maaso mu China omuli okuggalawo Wuhan n’ebibuga ebyetooloddewo n’okussa mu kalantiini kyenkana abantu bonna nga balowooza okutaataaganya ensaasaana ya SARS-CoV-2.
translated: Mu kiseera kino kaweefube munene agenda mu maaso mu China omuli okuggala Wuhan n’ebibuga ebiriraanyewo n’okussa mu kalantiini kumpi abantu bonna nga basuubira okutaataaganya okusaasaanya obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: Newankubadde ebikolwa bino bibadde bikosa nnyo ebyenfuna n’ebitongole by’eggwanga ebirala, omuwendo gw’abalwadde abapya gukendeera, ekiraga nti ekizibu kigenda kikendeera.
translated: Wadde ebikolwa bino bibadde byonoona nnyo ebyenfuna n’ebitundu by’eggwanga ebirala, omuwendo gw’abalwadde abapya gukendeera, ekiraga nti ekirwadde kino kikendedde.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: Okuteebereza okusinga obulungi kuli nti ekizibu kijja kuggwaawo mu Gwokusatu era nti okukendeera kujja kumala emyezi 3-4.
translated: Okubalirira okusinga okulina essuubi kwe kuba nti ekirwadde kino kigenda kukoma mu March ate omutendera gw’okukka wansi gugenda kumala emyezi 3-4.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: Wabula, abakugu abalala tebalina ssuubi lino.
translated: Kyokka, abakugu abalala abamu tebalina ssuubi eryo.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: Paul Hunter, ne banne, baateebereza nti COVID-19, gy’alabika ng’asiigibwa nnyo okusinga SARS, tajja kuggwaawo mu 2020.
translated: Paul Hunter, et al., bateebereza nti COVID-19, erabika ng’ekwata nnyo okusinga SARS, tegenda kukoma mu 2020.

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: Ira Longini, ne banne, baazuula engeri y’okuteebereza ebinaava mu kizibu ky’obulwadde era ne bateebereza nti SARS-CoV-2 ayinza okukwata ebitundu bibiri-byakusatu eby’abantu b’omu nsi yonna.
translated: Ira Longini, et al., baatandikawo enkola ey’okulagula ebinaava mu ssennyiga ono era ne bagamba nti SARS-CoV-2 eyinza okukwata ebitundu bibiri ku bisatu eby’abantu mu nsi yonna.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: Ekibinja ky’Abakanada kyalaga nti SARS-CoV-2 yazuulibwa mu balwadde abaawona ne bava mu ddwaliro wiiki 2 emabega, ekiraga nti akawuka kano akaakazuulibwa kayinza okuba nga kabeera kakomawo nga ssenyiga.
translated: Ekibinja ky’e Canada kyategeezezza nti SARS-CoV-2 yazuulibwa mu bitundu byombi eby’okusiiga abalwadde mu mid-turbinate ne throat swabs z’abalwadde abawona ne bava mu ddwaaliro wiiki 2 emabega, ekiraga nti akawuka kano akaakazuulibwa kayinza okufuuka cyclical episode okufaananako ne influenza.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: Wabula, obubonero obuzzaamu essuubi bulabiseeko e China okusinziira ku muwendo gw’abalwadde abapya okukendeera, ekiraga nti enkola eziriwo ziyinza okuba nga zikola.
translated: Wabula obubonero obusuubiza bubaddewo mu China okusinziira ku muwendo gw’abalwadde abapya ogukendedde, ekiraga nti obukodyo obuliwo kati bwandiba nga bwakola.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: Mu kusooka Ebola yateeberezebwa nti yali wa kukwata abantu abawera akakadde kamu era atte abantu emitwalo ataano.
translated: Ebola yasooka kuteebereza nti egenda kuleeta abantu abawera obukadde nga kitundu kya bukadde be bafa.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
targetString: Wabula, olw’okugoberera obulungi enkola ya kalantiini n’okweyawula, obulwadde buno busobodde okulwanyisibwa.
translated: Wabula nga bayita mu kalantiini enkakali n’okwekutula ku balala, okukkakkana ng’obulwadde buno bufugiddwa.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
targetString: Kisoboka, nga bwe kyali ku SARS-CoV, nti akawuka ka SARS-CoV-2 kayinza okunafuwa mu ngeri gye kakwatamu abantu n’oluvannyuma ne kaggwaawo oba ne kanafuwa ne kabeerawo bulungi n’abantu.
translated: Kisoboka, okufaananako ne SARS-CoV, nti SARS-CoV-2 eyinza okunafuwa mu kusiigibwa era okukkakkana ng’efudde oba okufuuka akawuka akatali ka bulwadde bungi nga kabeera wamu n’abantu.

sourceString: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
targetString: Okugeraageranya obulwadde bwa COVID-19 n’obwa SARS n’obwa MERS kulagiddwa wammanga (Ekifaananyi. ​(Ekifaananyi.55).
translated: Okugerageranya ekirwadde kya COVID-19 n’ekya SARS ne MERS kuweereddwa wansi (Fig. (Fig.55).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 asiigibwa nnyo okuyita mu kukolola oba okwasimula, era oboolyawo n’okuyita mu kukwata ku bintu ebiriko akawuka.
translated: SARS-CoV-2 asiigibwa nnyo okuyita mu kusesema oba okusesema, era nga kiyinzika n’okukwatagana obutereevu n’ebintu ebirimu akawuka kano.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
targetString: Akawuka kano era kaazuulibwa ne mu bubi, ekiraga nti kiyinza era okusoboka okusiiga akawuka kano ng’omuntu alidde obubi.
translated: Akawuka kano era kasangiddwa mu musulo, ekireeta omukisa omupya ogw’okusaasaana okuva mu musulo okudda mu kamwa.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwakolebwa gye buvuddeko katono ku balwadde 138 kwalaga nti abalwadde ebitundu 41% akawuka baakaggya mu malwaliro, omuli n’abalwadde 17 abaasangibwa n’endwadde endala n’abasawo 40.
translated: Okunoonyereza okwakakolebwa ku balwadde 138 kwalaga nti ebitundu 41% ku balwadde bano bayinza okuba nga baava ku bulwadde obuva mu malwaliro, nga kuliko abalwadde 17 abaali n’endwadde endala ezaaliwo emabega n’abajjanjabi 40.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: Noolwekyo, walina okubaawo okwegendereza kungi okusobola okutaasa abantu, naddala abasawo, ababudaabuzi, ab’awaka, ab’oku mirimu, n’abantu ababa bayimiridde obuyimirizi okumpi n’abalwadde oba abantu abalina akawuka.
translated: Bwe kityo, okwegendereza okw’amaanyi kulina okukozesebwa okukuuma abantu, naddala abakola ku by’obulamu, abakola ku nsonga z’abantu, ab’omu maka gaabwe, bannaabwe, era n’abatunuulizi abakwatagana n’abalwadde oba abantu abalina obulwadde buno.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: Enkola esooka eyinza okukozesebwa okukendeeza ku buzibu bw’okufuna akawuka kwe kwambala obukookolo ku maaso (face masks); okukozesa obukookolo obukozesebwa mu kulongoosa n’obwa N95 (series # 1860s) bwombi kiyamba okukendeeza ensaasaana y’obuwuka.
translated: Enkola esooka ey’okwekuuma eyinza okukozesebwa okukendeeza ku bulabe bw’okukwatibwa obulwadde kwe kuyita mu kwambala masiki mu maaso; byombi okukozesa masiki z’okulongoosa ne masiki z’okussa eza N95 (series # 1860s) biyamba okufuga okusaasaana kwa akawuka.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: Obuukokolo obukozesebwa mu kulongoosa buziyiza ebintu ng’amalusu g’omuntu ayinza okuba n’akawuka okutambulira mu mpewo oba okusigala ku bintu ebirala, we biyinza okutuusizibwa ku bantu abalala.
translated: Masiki za ffeesi ezilongoosebwa zitangira amatondo g’amazzi agava mu muntu ayinza okuba n’akawuka okutambula mu bbanga oba okunywerera ku bintu, gye gayinza okuyisibwa mu balala.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: Wabula, obukookolo bwa N95 (series # 1860s) bwe bwokka obusobola okulemesa omuntu okuyingiza obuwuka obwenkana 10 ku 80 nm, ng’obuwuka ebitundu 5% byokka bye bisobola okuyitiramu ddala; SARS-CoV-2 yenkana ne SARS-CoV mu bunene era bwonna bwenkana 85 nm.
translated: Wabula masiki za N95 (series # 1860s) zokka ze zisobola okukuuma obutassa virions entono nga 10 ku 80 nm, nga 5% zokka ku virions ze zisobola okuyingira ddala; SARS-CoV-2 efaananako ne SARS-CoV mu bunene era zombi ziri nga 85 nm.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: Olw’okuba ng’akawuka kasobola okuyita ne mu bukookolo obukozesebwa ku kulongoosa obutaano nga bussiddwa wamu, abasawo abasemberera abalwadde bateekwa okwambala obukookolo bwa N95 (series # 1860s) so si obwo obukozesebwa mu kulongoosa.
translated: Okuva obutundutundu bwe busobola okuyingira ne masiki ttaano ez’okulongoosa nga zitumbiddwa wamu, abakola ku by’obulamu abakwatagana obutereevu n’abalwadde balina okwambala masiki za N95 (series # 1860s) naye si masiki za kulongoosa.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: Okwongereza ku bukookolo, abasawo balina okwambala amaganduula okwongera okukendeeza ku kusemberera obuwuka.
translated: Ng’oggyeeko masiki, abakola ku by’obulamu balina okwambala gomesi ezituukira ddala ku ‘isolation’ okusobola okwongera okukendeeza ku kukwatagana ne akawuka.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: Obuwuka era busobola okukwata omuntu nga buyita mu maaso.
translated: Virus era zisobola okusiiga omuntu ssekinnoomu nga ziyita mu maaso.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: Mu Janwali nga 22, 2020, omusawo yafuna SARS-CoV-2 newankubadde nga yali ayambadde akakookolo ka N95; akawuka kayinza okuba nga kaayingira omubiri gwe nga kayita mu maaso ge agaali gazimbye.
translated: Nga January 22, 2020, omusawo yakwatibwa obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2 wadde nga yayambadde masiki ya N95; akawuka kano kayinza okuba nga kaayingira mu mubiri gwe nga kayita mu maaso ge agazimba.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: Noolwekyo, abasawo era basaanye okwambala ebibikka amaaso ebitangaala oba ebigaalubindi nga bakola ku balwadde.
translated: Bwe kityo, abajjanjabi nabo balina okwambala engabo oba endabirwamu ezitangaala mu maaso nga bakola n’abalwadde.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: Ku bantu aba bulijjo mu bitundu ebirimu oba ebiyinza okubaamu obuwuka, kyandibadde kirungi buli muntu okunaaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni emirundi mingi okusinga ku bwe bakola bulijjo, okugezaako okubeera munda nga beekuumira mu kalantiini n’okukendeeza ku nsisinkano n’abantu abayinza okuba n’akawuka.
translated: Ku bantu bonna mu bitundu ebikoseddwa oba ebiyinza okukosebwa, kirungi nnyo buli muntu okunaaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni ezitta obuwuka emirundi mingi okusinga bulijjo, agezeeko okubeera mu nnyumba okwesiba mu kalantiini n’okussa ekkomo ku kukwatagana n’abantu abayinza okukwatibwa.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: Ebbanga erya fuuti essatu litwalibwa okuba nga limala omuntu okwesuula omulwadde.
translated: Ffuuti ssatu zitwalibwa ng’ebanga erisaanira abantu okubeera ewala n’omulwadde.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ebikolwa bino nkola nnungi mu kukendeeza ku mikisa gy’okufuna awamu n’okusaasaanya akawuka.
translated: Ebikolwa bino nkola nnungi okukendeeza ku bulabe bw’okukwatibwa obulwadde nga kw’otadde n’okutangira okusaasaana kw’akawuka kano.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: Newankubadde nga SARS-CoV-2 yajja ng’akawuka akapya mu bantu, engeri gye kafaanana ennyo SARS-CoV nga bwe kyalagibwa nga 7 Janwali 2020 kyandibadde kiwa China essomo lya maanyi okusinziira ku by’ejjukira ku kubalukawo kwa SARS mu 2003.
translated: Wadde nga SARS-CoV-2 yajja ng’akawuka akapya eri ensi y’abantu, okufaanagana kwayo okw’amaanyi ne SARS-CoV nga bwe kwategeezebwa nga 7 January 2020 kwandibadde kuleeta okulabula okw’amaanyi eri China okusinziira ku kujjukira kwe okw’amaanyi ku kirwadde kya SARS mu 2003.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: Wabula, okutuukira ddala nga 19 Janwali 2020 omukulu wa Center of Disease Control mu Wuhan yali akyagumya bannansi ng’agamba nti akawuka kano akapya kaali tekasiigibwa nnyo era nga tekatambula nnyo kuva ku muntu kudda ku mulala era nti obulwadde buno tebwali buzibu kwewalwa na kulwanyisa.
translated: Wabula okutuusa nga 19 January 2020 dayirekita w’ekitongole ekivunaanyizibwa ku kulwanyisa endwadde ekya Center of Disease Control of Wuhan lwe yabudaabuda bannansi ng’agamba nti akawuka ka novel kalina okusiigibwa okutono n’okuzaala okutono okuva ku muntu okudda ku muntu era nti si kizibu okuziyiza n’okuziyiza obulwadde buno .
