translated: Waliwo emikisa mingi CoVs zino ez’ebisolo gye zikula ne ziddamu okugatta, ekivaamu okuvaayo kwa CoV empya ezisinga okusaasaana ne/oba okutta mu bantu mu biseera eby’omu maaso.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Empisa y’okulya ensolo ez’omu nsiko mu bifo ebimu mu China erina okusuulibwa okukendeeza ku nkwatagana eteetaagisa wakati w’abantu n’ensolo.
translated: Obuwangwa bw’okulya ebisolo by’omu nsiko mu bifo ebimu mu China busaana okulekebwawo okukendeeza ku kukwatagana okuteetaagisa wakati w’abantu n’ebisolo.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Nga tuli mu katyabaga ka SARS, MERS ne COVID-19, okweteekateeka okusingako obulungi n’enteekateeka ey’okubyaŋŋanga zirina okubeerawo.
translated: Olw’ebizibu ebituuse ku SARS, MERS ne COVID-19, enteekateeka ennungi ey’okwetegekera n’okuddamu esaana okuteekebwawo.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Mu butuufu, obuwuka bungi bubaddewo mu nsi okumala ebbanga ddene ddala.
translated: Mu butuufu, akawuka kangi kabaddewo ku nsi okumala ebbanga ddene nnyo.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Bubeera mu bifo byabwo eby’obutonde okutuusa lwe walabikawo omukisa ne bubuukayo okugenda ewalala.
translated: Zisigala mu bifo byabwe eby’obutonde okutuusa nga waliwo omukisa gw’okuyiwa.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Newankubadde ng’obuwundo bulina obukole bungi obubusobozesa okusaasaanya obuwuka, omukisa gw’abantu okukwatagana n’obuwundo n’ebika ebirala eby’omu nsiko gusobola okukendeezebwa abantu bwe bategeezebwa okwewala okubisemberera.
translated: Wadde ng’enkwale zirina ebintu bingi ebiyamba okusaasaana kw’akawuka, omukisa gw’abantu okubeera n’enkwale n’ebika by’ebisolo ebirala eby’omu nsiko guyinza okukendeera singa abantu basomesebwa okubeera ewala.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Okwekaliriza entakera kwetaagisa mu nsolo eziringa abantu olw’okutegeera enkula ya CoVs mu ngeri esingako wamu n’ebyo ebibeerako obuwuka ebyobutonde ebijja okulabika nga bya mugaso mu kuziyiza okusaasaanya endwadde okuva ku nsolo-okudda-mu-bantu wamu ne nawookeera ow’omu maaso.
translated: Okulondoola obutasalako mu binyonyi ebiyonka kyetaagisa okutegeera obulungi embeera y’obutonde bwa CoVs n’ebizikyaza mu butonde, ekijja okulaga nti kya mugaso mu kuziyiza okusaasaana okuva mu bisolo okudda mu bantu n’okubalukawo mu biseera eby’omu maaso.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Mu kufundikira, engeri esinga obulungi ey’okuziyiza obuwuka obuva ku nsolo okudda mu bantu be bantu okuva ku bintu eby’obutonde ebibeerako obuwuka obusaasaanya endwadde okuva ku nsolo okudda mu bantu.
translated: Okumaliriza, engeri esinga okukola obulungi ey’okuziyiza obulwadde bw’akawuka (viral zoonosis) kwe kubeera wala n’ebifo eby’obutonde eby’ebifo eby’obutonde eby’obuwuka obuleeta endwadde z’ebisolo.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Waliwo ebintu bingi ebitannaba kutegeerekeka ku nsibuko y’obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2 obuva mu nsolo okudda mu bantu.
translated: Ebitundu ebiwerako mu puzzle y’ensibuko ya zoonotic eya SARS-CoV-2 bikyabula.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Okusookera ddala, oba ng’obuwundo busaasaanya akawuka akasibukamu SARS-CoV-2 mu pangolin, kiba kisaana okulaba embeera obuwundo ne pangolin mwe bigabanira okubeerana mu bifo gye bibeera.
translated: Ekisooka, singa enkwale zitambuza akawuka ka bajjajjaabwe aka SARS-CoV-2 eri pangolins, kijja kuba kya njawulo okulaba mu mbeera ki enkwale ne pangolins mwe ziyinza okugabana ekifo kye kimu eky’obutonde.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Ekyokubiri, oba ng’obuwundo buzannya ekifo ky’okusaasaanya obulwadde obutereevu mu bantu, olwo nno engeri abantu gye bakwataganamu n’obuwundo erina okufiibwako.
translated: Ekyokubiri, singa enkwale zikola kinene nnyo mu kutambuza abantu, engeri abantu gye bakwataganamu n’enkwale erina okuzuulibwa.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Ekyokusatu, ensolo eringa omuntu bw’eba nga y’ekola nga ekibeerako obuwuka ekitasaasaanya ekituufu, engeri gye kitabaganamu n’ebika ebirala omuli n’abantu, obuwundo ne pangolin erina okutangaazibwa.
translated: Ekyokusatu, singa ekisolo ekiyonka eky’okusatu kikola ng’omugenyi omutuufu ow’omu makkati, engeri gye kikwataganamu n’ebika eby’enjawulo omuli abantu, enkwale ne pangolins erina okunnyonnyolwa.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Ekisembayo, olw’okubanga ensolo nnyingi eziringa abantu omwo nga mwe muli n’ez’awaka ziyinza okuba nga zikwatibwa mangu SARS-CoV-2, okwekaliriza n’okugezesa kw’obulwadde byombi birina okukolebwa.
translated: N’ekisembayo, olw’okuba ebisolo ebiyonka bingi omuli n’ebisolo by’awaka biyinza okukwatibwa obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2, okulondoola n’okugezesa okusiiga byombi bisaana okukolebwa.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Singa kanaaba kawundo, pangolin oba ensolo endala eringa omuntu, kisuubirwa nti SARS-CoV-2 oba obuwuka obulala obusibukako obulwadde nga kumpi bufaanagana bujja kuzuulibwa mu kibeerako obuwuka obwo eky’obutonde eyo gye bujja.
translated: Singa eba enkwale, pangolin oba ekisolo ekirala ekiyonka, kisuubirwa nti SARS-CoV-2 oba akawuka kaayo ak’abazadde kumpi akafaanagana kajja kuzuulibwa mu bazikyaza ab’obutonde mu biseera eby’omu maaso.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Okunoonyereza entakera ku nsonga eno kujja kutangaaza omugendo gw’enkula ya SARS-CoV-2 mu nsolo, omuli n’ebivaamu eby’omugaso mu kutangira n’okuziyiza COVID-19 mu bantu.
translated: Okunoonyereza okugenda mu maaso mu kitundu kino kujja kulambulula ekkubo ly’enkulaakulana ya SARS-CoV-2 mu bisolo, nga lirina ebikulu ebikwata ku kuziyiza n’okulwanyisa COVID-19 mu bantu.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Okutuukanya ebisinziirwako okukakasa omulwadde “ateeberezebwa” ne “akakasiddwa” okubeera ne COVID-19 kyetaagisa
translated: Okuzza obuggya emitendera gy’okuzuula COVID-19 “suspected case” ne “confirmed case” kyetaagisa

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Nga 6 Ogwokubiri 2020, tiimu yaffe yali efulumizza ebigobererwa eby’amangu mu kukebera n’okujjanjaba abantu abalina 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV), era ng’ebigobererwa bino byali biraga obumanyirivu bwaffe n’okulaga engeri y’okulwanyisaamu obulungi nawookeera ono mu nsi yonna.
translated: Nga 6 February 2020, ttiimu yaffe yali efulumizza ebiragiro eby’amangu eby’okubuulirira ku kuzuula n’okujjanjaba obulwadde bwa 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV), era enkola eno yatuwa obumanyirivu bwaffe era n’ekola bulungi okujuliza okulwanyisa ekirwadde kino mu nsi yonna.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Wabula, obulwadde bwa coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) bulwadde bupya, bye tubumanyiiko bigenda byeyongera okusinziira ku bizuulibwa mu kunoonyereza okugenda mu maaso n’ebiyitibwamu mu kujjanjaba; noolwekyo, enkebera n’enzijanjaba nabyo bigenda bikyusibwamu.
translated: Wabula obulwadde bwa coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) bulwadde bupya, okumanyisa n’okumanya kwaffe kweyongera mpolampola okusinziira ku bizuuliddwa mu kunoonyereza okugenda mu maaso n’obumanyirivu mu nkola y’obujjanjabi; n’olwekyo, enkola z’okuzuula n’okujjanjaba nazo zitereezebwa buli kiseera.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Mu bbaluwa eno, twayanukula ekibuuzo kimu ku bigobererwa byaffe era ne tuwa ebigobererwa ebisinga obupya mu kusalawo “ateeberezebwa” ne “akakasiddwa” okusinziira ku bigobererwa ebikyasembyeyo mu Kukebera n’Okujjanjaba CoVID-19 (Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version)) ebyayisibwa National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
translated: Mu bbaluwa eno, twaddamu okuteesa kumu ku ndagiriro yaffe era ne tuwa emisingi emipya egy’okuzuula “omulwadde ateeberezebwa” ne “omulwadde akakasiddwa” okusinziira ku ndagiriro ezisembyeyo ez’okuzuula n’okujjanjaba COVID-19 (enkyusa ey’omusanvu) eyafulumizibwa akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga wa ggwanga lya China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Mu Deesemba 2019, 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) yaleetawo obulwadde, kati mu butongole obwatuumibwa coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) era n’akawuka ne katuumibwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
translated: Mu December wa 2019, akawuka ka 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) kaleetawo ekirwadde kino, nga kati mu butongole kituumiddwa erinnya lya coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) era akawuka kano katuumiddwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV- 2019). 2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Nga 11 Ogwokusatu 2020, WHO yalangirira nti COVID-19 kizibu kya byabulamu mu nsi yonna.
translated: Nga 11 March 2020, WHO yalaga COVID-19 nga ssennyiga omukambwe.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: Okusobola okulwanyisa SARS-CoV-2, tiimu yaffe ekulaakulanyizza ebigobererwa eby’amangu nga byafulumizibwa ku yintaneeti mu Military Medical Research nga 06 Ogwokubiri 2020.
translated: Okusobola okulwanyisa obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2, ttiimu yaffe ekoze enkola ey’okuwabula amangu era nga efulumiziddwa ku mutimbagano mu Military Medical Research nga 06 February 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Byettaniddwa nnyo okuva lwe byafulumizibwa.
translated: Okuva lwe kyafulumizibwa kisikiriza nnyo abantu.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Wabula kisaanye okwetegerezebwa nti COVID-19 bulwadde bupya, bye tubumanyiiko bigenda byeyongera okusinziira ku bizuulibwa mu kunoonyereza okugenda mu maaso n’ebiyitibwamu mu kujjanjaba; noolwekyo, enkebera n’enzijanjaba nabyo bigenda bikyusibwamu.
translated: Weetegereze wabula nti COVID-19 bulwadde bupya, okumanyisa n’okumanya kwaffe kweyongera mpolampola okusinziira ku bizuuliddwa mu kunoonyereza okugenda mu maaso n’obumanyirivu mu nkola y’obujjanjabi; n’olwekyo, enkola z’okuzuula n’okujjanjaba nazo zitereezebwa buli kiseera.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Okugeza Ebigobererwa mu Kukebera n’Okujjanjaba CoVID-19 ebyayisibwa National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), wakati wa 16 Janwali 2020 ne 3 Ogwokusatu 2020, yaakafulumya enfulumya musanvu mulamba ng’embeera ezimu zikyukidde ddala.
translated: Okugeza enkola y’okuzuula n’okujjanjaba COVID-19 eyafulumiziddwa akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga aka People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), wakati wa 16 January 2020 okutuuka nga 3 March 2020, efulumizza a omugatte gwa bitabo musanvu nga n’ensonga ezimu zikyusiddwa nnyo.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Ebigobererwa byaffe byayogerwako Zhou ne banne, baateesa enkola ennyangu ey’okwekenneenya nga basinziira ku bye bazudde mu kujjanjaba mu ddwaliro.
translated: Kati enkola yaffe yafuna okuteesa okuva mu Zhou et al., baaleeta ekiteeso eky’okuteeba eky’enjawulo nga basinziira ku bumanyirivu bwabwe mu bujjanjabi.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Omulimu gwabwe gwayongera obukakafu ku bigobererwa byaffe era boogera ne ku kizibu kino ekiri mu nsi yonna.
translated: Omulimu gwabwe gwayongera obujulizi obupya ku ndagiriro yaffe era era gukola ebiwandiiko eby’omuwendo ku ssennyiga ono mu nsi yonna.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Omulimu gwabwe omulungi tugukkiriza era tubeebaza.
translated: Tuwagira omulimu gwabwe ogw’amaanyi era ne twebaza.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Wabula, omulimu gwabwe nagwo gwetaaga okuzzibwa obuggya okusinziira ku Bigobererwa mu Kukebera n’Okujjanjaba COVID-19 ebipya (Olufulumya owomusanvu) n’okunoonyereza okupya.
translated: Wabula n’emirimu gyabwe gyetaaga okutereezebwa okusinziira ku ndagiriro ezisembyeyo okukebera n’okujjanjaba COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) n’okunoonyereza gye buvuddeko.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Okusinziira ku lufulumya olwomusanvu (3 Ogwokusatu 2020), okukakasa omulwadde ateeberezebwa kyeetaagisa okugatta ekimu ku bigobererwa ebikwata ku byafaayo by’obulwadde n’ebigobererwa bibiri eby’ekisawo mu ddwaliro okusobola okukola okusalawo okw’enkomeredde, oba kyetaagisa okutuukiriza ebigobererwa bisatu eby’ekisawo mu ddwaliro singa waba tewali bikwata byafaayo bya bulwadde bitegeerekeka:
translated: Okusinziira ku nkyusa ey’omusanvu (3 March 2020), okukakasa omulwadde ateeberezebwa okwetaaga okugatta ekintu kyonna ekimu eky’ebifaananyi by’ebyafaayo by’endwadde n’ebintu bibiri eby’okwolesebwa kw’obujjanjabi okukola okwekenneenya okujjuvu, oba yeetaaga okutuukiriza ebintu bisatu eby’okwolesebwa kw’obujjanjabi bwe kiba nga tekitegeerekeka bulungi ebyafaayo by’endwadde ezisaasaana:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Ebyafaayo by’obulwadde: (1) okuba ng’omuntu yagendako oba yabeerako mu kibuga Wuhan n’ebitundu ebyetooloddewo, oba ebitundu ebirala ewaazuulwa abalwadde ba COVID-19 mu nnaku 14 ng’obubonero tebunneeyoleka; (2) okuba ng’omuntu yasemberera abantu abalina SARS-CoV-2 (mu kukebera kwa positive nucleic acid test); (3) okuba ng’omuntu yasemberera abalwadde b’omusujja oba abalina obuzibu bw’okussa okuva mu kibuga Wuhan n’ebitundu ebiriraanyeewo, oba ebitundu ebirala ewaazuulibwa abalwadde ba COVID-19 mu nnaku 14 ng’obubonero tebunneeyoleka; (4) okuba ng’omuntu yasemberera abalwadde abakakasiddwa (abalwadde ≥ 2 abalina omusujja ne/oba obuzibu mu kussa baazuulwa mu wiiki 2 mu bifo ebifunda, ng’awaka, woofiisi, ebibiina ku ssomero, n’ebirala).
translated: Ebyafaayo by’obulwadde: (1) ebyafaayo by’okutambula oba okubeera mu kibuga Wuhan n’ebitundu ebiriraanyewo, oba ebitundu ebirala omuli abalwadde ba COVID-19 mu nnaku 14 ezisembyeyo ng’obubonero tebunnatandika; (2) ebyafaayo by’okukwatagana n’abalwadde abakwatibwa SARS-CoV-2 (nga balina okukeberebwa kwa nucleic acid); (3) ebyafaayo by’okukwatagana n’abalwadde abalina omusujja oba obubonero bw’okussa okuva mu kibuga Wuhan n’ebitundu ebiriraanyewo, oba ebitundu ebirala COVID-19 gye yali ategeezeddwa mu nnaku 14 ezisembyeyo ng’obubonero tebunnatandika; (4) ebyafaayo by‟okukwatagana n‟ekibinja ky‟abalwadde abakakasibwa (≥ abalwadde 2 abalina omusujja ne/oba obubonero bw‟okussa byagwawo mu wiiki 2 mu bitundu ebitono, gamba ng‟awaka, ofiisi, ekibiina ky‟essomero, n‟ebirala).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Obubonero bw’ekisawo: (1) omusujja ne/ oba obuzibu mu kussa; (2) n’obubonero bw’okukubwa ekifaananyi obulaga okukosebwa COVID-19; (3) omuwendo gw’obutaffaali obulwanyisa endwadde (white blood cells) obulaga omuwendo gwa lymphocyte omulungi, oba ogukendedde mu kiseera ekisooka.
translated: Okwolesebwa mu bujjanjabi: (1) omusujja ne/oba obubonero bw’okussa; (2) nga balina ebifaananyi ebikwata ku bulwadde bwa COVID-19; (3) omuwendo gw’obutoffaali obweru gwonna nga gulaga omuwendo gw’obutoffaali obukola omusaayi ogwa bulijjo, okukendeera oba okukendeera mu mutendera gw’okutandika nga bukyali.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Okukakasa omulwadde kulina kukolebwa ku mulwadde ateeberezebwa ng’aliko obukakafu bw’obulwadde oba okukeberwa amazzi g’omubiri nga bwe kiragiddwa wammanga: (1) ng’okukebera kwa PCR okw’embagirawo kulaze nti omuntu alina SARS-CoV-2; (2) nga viral whole genome sequencing eraze okufaanana okw’amaanyi n’obuwuka bwa coronaavirus obupya; (3) ng’okukebera amazzi g’omu mubiri kulaze nti omuntu alina IgM antibody ne IgG antibody zennyini ezirwanyisa SARS-CoV-2; oba okukyuka kwa lgG antibody za SARS-CoV-2 zennyini okuva ku negative okudda ku positive, oba titer rising ez’emirundi ≥4 mu kiseera ky’okuwona okusinga ku ezo ez’omu kiseera ky’okubeera obubi.
translated: Okuzuula omulwadde akakasiddwa kulina okusinziira ku mulwadde ateeberezebwa okuba n’ekintu kyonna ekimu eky’obujulizi obw’obulwadde oba obw’omusaayi nga bwe kiri wansi: (1) okukeberebwa mu kiseera ekituufu ekya PCR nga kizuuliddwa nga kirimu SARS-CoV-2; (2) ensengeka y’ensengekera y’obutonde (viral whole genome sequencing) eraga obumu obw’amaanyi ku coronaviruses empya ezimanyiddwa; (3) nga balina ekirungo ekiziyiza obulwadde bwa IgM ekitongole n’ekiziyiza kya IgG eri SARS-CoV-2 mu kukebera serum; oba enkyukakyuka mu SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody okuva ku negativu okudda ku positive, oba titer okulinnya emirundi ≥4 mu mutendera gw’okudda engulu waggulu w’ekyo mu mutendera ogw’amangu.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Tulaba nti okukebera kwa PCR okw’embagirawo okuzuula nucleic acid mu mussizo oba omusaayi kwagattibwa ku lufulumya olwokubiri (18 Janwali 2020) n’olw’okusatu (22 Janwali 2020).
translated: Tuyinza okulaba nti okukebera kwa PCR mu kiseera ekituufu okuzuula asidi wa nucleic mu nkola y’okussa oba omusaayi kwayongerwa mu nkyusa eyookubiri (18 January 2020) n’ey’okusatu (22 January 2020).

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: Okuzuula obulwadde mu sampolo y’omusaayi kwagattibwa ku nfulumya olwokuna (27 Janwali 2020) n’olwokutaano (8 Ogwokubiri 2020); ate obukakafu bw’okukebera amazzi g’omu mubiri bwagattibwa ku lufulumya olwomusanvu.
translated: Okuzuula obulwadde ku musaayi kwayongerwa ku mulundi ogw’okuna (27 January 2020) n’ogw’okutaano (8 February 2020); n’oluvannyuma obujulizi obw’ekika kya serological ne bongerwa ku nkyusa ey’omusanvu.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Okukyusaamu kuno kwesigamizibwa ku mirimu gy’abanoonyereza okugezaako okufuna ekintu ekiyinza okukenga obulungi nucleic acid olw’okukebera okw’amangu, awamu ne sampolo okuva mu mussizo omuli sampolo z’omusaayi, nga kino kyayongera ku busobozi bw’okufuna ebikeberwa eby’enjawulo, era ne kiwagira eky’okubeera ne antibody zennyini ng’ekimu ku bisinziirwako okukakasa omulwadde.
translated: Enkyukakyuka zino nga zeesigamiziddwa ku banoonyereza baagenda mu maaso n’okukola nti okunoonya ekitabo ekisinga obulungi eky’okuzuula asidi wa nucleic okuzuula amangu, wamu ne sampuli okuva mu nkola y’okussa omuli n’okutwala omusaayi, ekyayongera ku kubeerawo kw’ebika eby’enjawulo, era ne biwagira okuleeta ekivaamu ekituufu eky’obutafaali obuziyiza endwadde mu misingi egyakakasibwa.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko ekyo, waliwo obukakafu obulala bungi obutujjukiza okwegendereza abalwadde abalaga n’abatalaga bubonero mu ngeri etali ya bulijjo.
translated: Ng’oggyeeko ekyo, waliwo obujulizi obugenda bweyongera obutujjukiza okwegendereza n’abalwadde abatalina bubonero bwa bulijjo n’abatalina bubonero.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Noolwekyo, ekipande kya Zhou ne banne kisaanye okuzzibwa obuggya, kubanga kyalaga omuntu atalina bubonero bwa bulwadde nga “alina emikisa emitono (low risk)”.
translated: N’olwekyo, ekipande ky’okutambula kwa Zhou et al. balina okutereezebwa, nga bwe baagabanya omuntu atalina bubonero bwa bujjanjabi nga “akabi akatono”.

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Enkebera eno (score system) era yeetaaga okukakasibwa mu kujjanjaba okulala mu malwaliro ne mu kunoonyereza okulala.
translated: Enkola y’obubonero nayo yeetaaga okukakasibwa mu nkola endala ey’obujjanjabi n’okunoonyereza.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Mu kuwumbawumba, tusuubira nti obukakafu obulala obulabikirawo bujja kulabikawo era tusaba abasomi okubwogerako.
translated: Okumaliriza, tusuubira obujulizi obulala obutereevu obujja era tusaba abasomi okuwa endowooza zaabwe.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Mu kumanya “ateeberezebwa” ne “akakasiddwa”, tuteesa eky’okulondoola n’okugondera ebiragiro ebikyasembyeyo eby’amawanga gaawe.
translated: Ku kuzuula “suspected case” ne “confirmed case”, tuteesa okulondoola n’okugondera ebiragiro ebipya eby’amawanga gaabwe.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Tiimu yaffe ejja kuzza obuggya mu budde ebigobererwa byaffe okusobola okuyambako.
translated: Ttiimu yaffe era ejja kuzza obuggya mu budde enkola yaffe okusobola okuwa obuyambi.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Bangladesh etegeezezza nti abantu bataanu abalala bafudde olwa COVID-19, nga gwe muwendo omunene ogusinga ku bafa buli lunaku
translated: Bangladesh etegeezezza nti abantu bataano abaakafa olw’ekirwadde kya COVID-19, nga kino kisinga buli lunaku

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Eggulo, Bangladesh yakakasizza nti abantu bataano abalala baafudde olwa COVID-19 ku lunaku olwo.
translated: Olunaku lw’eggulo, Bangladesh ezudde nti abantu bataano abaakafa COVID-19 ku lunaku luno.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Guno gwe muwendo ogusingayo obunene mu lunaku abafudde olw’akawuka kano.
translated: Guno gwe muwendo ogusinga okufa mu lunaku lumu olw’akawuka kano.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: We bwatuukidde eggulo, Ekitongole kya Bangladesh Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) kyawandiise abalwadde 114 ate abawonye 33 nga bo bali waka.
translated: We bwazibidde eggulo, ekitongole kya Bangladesh ekivunaanyizibwa ku ndwadde, IEDCR kyategeezezza nti omuwendo gw’abalwadde abawandiikiddwa kuliko abalwadde 114 abakola n’abawonye 33 nga basigadde waka.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Omugatte gw’abantu 17 abafudde.
translated: Abantu 17 be baakafa.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Mu mawulire agaaweereddwa ku yintaneeti, omukungu wa IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, yagambye nti abaafudde baabaddemu abasajja bana n’omukyala omu.
translated: Mu lukung’aana lw’amawulire ku yintaneeti, dayirekita wa IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora yagambye nti abafudde kuliko abasajja bana n’omukazi omu.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: Okusinziira ku Dr Meerjady, abaafudde ababiri baabadde n’emyaka egisukka mu 60, ababiri nga bali wakati wa 51 ne 60, ate omu ng’ali wakati wa 41-50 egy’obukulu.
translated: Okusinziira ku Dr Meerjady, abalwadde babiri baali ba myaka egisukka mu 60, babiri bali wakati w’emyaka 51 ne 60, ate omu yabadde wa myaka 41-50.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Era yagambye nti ababiri ku bantu abo bava Dhaka.
translated: Ono era agambye nti babiri ku battiddwa bava Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: Nga 11 Ogwokusatu, Ekitongole kya World Health Organization (WHO) kyalangirira COVID-19 ng’ekizibu eky’awamu mu nsi (pandemic).
translated: Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna (WHO) kyalangirira COVID-19 nga ssennyiga omukambwe nga March 11.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Omukungu mu ddwaliro yategeeza Anadolu Agency, nga kitongole ky’amawulire, nti omu ku baafa ye yali Jalal Saifur Rahman, omukungu wa Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, eyali ajjanjabibwa mu Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
translated: Omukungu w’eddwaliro lino yategeezezza Anadolu Agency, omukutu gw’amawulire mu kitundu kino nti omu ku bafudde ye Jalal Saifur Rahman, dayirekita w’akakiiko akalwanyisa enguzi mu Bengali, eyalabirirwa mu ddwaaliro lya Kuwait Maitree.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: Ku Lwomukaaga, Minista w’Ebyentambula mu Bangladeshi Obaidul Quader bwe yabadde ng’ayisa ekirango ekyalabikidde mu viidiyo yagambye nti entambula yonna ey’olukale egenda kuyimirizibwa okumala ebbanga ggwanvuko okusinga bwe baasooka okutegeka, okutuusa ku Lwomukaaga oluddako.
translated: Ku Lwomukaaga, mu kulangirira akatambi ku yintaneeti, minisita w’entambula y’oku nguudo n’ebibanda mu Bangladesh, Obaidul Quader yategeezezza nti entambula y’olukale egenda kuggalwa okumala ebbanga erisinga bwe lyasooka okutegekebwa, okutuusa ku Lwomukaaga luno olujja.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Okuyimiriza entambula y’olukale kwali kutandise nga 26 Ogwokusatu era nga kwali kutegekeddwa kukoma nga 4 Ogwokuna.
translated: Okuggala kuno okw’entambula ey’olukale kwali kwasooka kutandika nga March 26 era nga kwali kutegekeddwa kukoma ku Lwomukaaga nga April 4.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Entambula y’ebyamaguzi ebikulu -- eddagala, amafuta n’emmere - yo yali ekyakkirizibwa.
translated: Okutambuza ebintu ebikulu -- eby'obujjanjabi, amafuta n'emmere -- kyali kikyakkirizibwa.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Abalwadde ba COVID-19 abaasooka mu Bangladesh baalabika nga 8 Ogwokusatu, nga baali bantu babiri abadda mu ggwanga eryo nga bava Italy ate n’omukyala w’omu ku bantu abo.
translated: Emisango egyasooka okuwandiikibwa egy’okukwatibwa COVID-19 mu Bangladesh gyali nga March 8, mu bantu babiri abaakomyewo okuva e Italy era nga naye mukyala w’omu ku bo.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Nga 19 Ogwokusatu 19, abasatu abo baali bamaze okuwona.
translated: We bwazibidde nga March 19, bano abasatu baali bamaze okuwona.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 yasussa abantu abalwadde akakadde kamu mu nsi yonna
translated: SARS-CoV-2 esukkulumye ku bukadde bumu mu nsi yonna

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: Ku Lwokuna, omugatte gw’abalwadde ba SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus baasusse akakadde akamu mu nsi yonna nga bwe kyalagiddwa mu bubaka bwa Johns Hopkins University.
translated: Ku Lwokuna, omuwendo gw’abalwadde abakwatibwa ekirwadde kya SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus gusukka obukadde bumu mu nsi yonna, ebiwandiiko bya Johns Hopkins University bwe byalaze.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Waakiri abantu emitwalo 52 baagambibwa okuba nga bafudde COVID-19, obulwadde obuleetebwa coronavirus.
translated: Abantu emitwalo 52 abafudde beekuusa ku COVID-19, obulwadde obuva ku coronavirus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Kino kyatuukibwako ku lunaku lwe lumu Malawi lwe yakakasa omulwadde waayo asooka ate mu kiseera kye kimu Zambia n’efunayo omuntu omu afa olwa coronavirus.
translated: Enkizo eno yatuuse ku lunaku lwe lumu Malawi lwe yakakasizza nti esoose okukwatibwa akawuka ka coronavirus ate Zambia n’esooka okufa olwa coronavirus.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: North Korea yo yagambye nti ku Lwokuna y’emu ku nsi ezaali zikyasigadde nga tezinnalumbibwa bulwadde bwa coronavirus.
translated: North Korea etegeezezza nti, we bwazibidde ku Lwokuna, lye limu ku mawanga amatono agasigadde nga tegaliiko bulwadde bwa coronavirus.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Ku lunaku lw’eggulo Ekibiina ky’Ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna (World Health Organization) kyategeezezza nti waabaddewo abalwadde 1,051,635 omuli abalwadde 79,332 abaafunise mu bbanga lya ssaawa 24 obutasukka ssaawa nnya ez’oku makya, mu mbala y’essaawa eya Central European Time (0800 UTC) nga 4 Ogwokuna.
translated: We bwazibidde eggulo, ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna kyategeezezza nti abantu 1,051,635 be bakakasiddwa nti balina obulwadde buno, nga kuliko 79,332 mu ssaawa abiri mu nnya ezaasoose ku ssaawa 10 ez’oku makya mu budde bwa Central European Time (0800 UTC) nga April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: Mu United States, abalwadde abasukka mu 244,000 be baategeezebwa ate ng’abafudde bali waakiri 5,900.
translated: Mu Amerika, abantu abasoba mu mitwalo 244 be baakwatiddwa akawuka ka coronavirus, nga kino kyekuusa ku kufa kw’abantu abatakka wansi wa 5,900.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: CBS News kyajulizza Johns Hopkins University ne kigamba nti, mu US mwalimu abantu abasukka 1,000 abaafudde ku Lwokusatu nga bafudde lwa bulwadde bwa coronavirus.
translated: CBS News yategeezezza ng’ejuliza ebiwandiiko bya Johns Hopkins University, abantu abasoba mu 1,000 abafudde mu Amerika ku Lwokusatu nga bavudde ku bulwadde bwa coronavirus.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Mu nsi yonna, amawanga gaalangirira ebirina okukolebwa ebikakali olw’okuziyiza obulwadde obutasaasaana.
translated: Okwetoloola ensi yonna, amawanga galangiridde enkola enkakali okuziyiza obulwadde buno okusaasaana.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Ku Lwokuna, Sergei Sobyanin, meeya wa Moscow, yayongezzaayo omuggalo gw’ekibuga okutuusa nga 1 Ogwokutaano.
translated: Ku Lwokuna, Meeya wa Moscow, Sergei Sobyanin, yayongeddeyo omuggalo gw’ekibuga okutuuka nga May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Mu ggwanga lyonna, Pulezidenti Vladimir Putin yalangirira nti Abarasha bajja kusasulwa wadde nga tebagenda ku mirimu gyabwe okutuusa nga 30 Ogwokuna.
translated: Mu ggwanga lyonna, Pulezidenti Vladimir Putin yalangiridde nti Bannarussia bagenda kusigala nga basasulwa nga tebagenda kukola okutuusa nga April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Paliyamenti ya Portugal yakuba akalulu akongezaayo akaseera k’obwerende ka nnaku 15; abasinga obungi 215 baakawagira, kkumi ne batakuba ate omuntu omu n’atakiwagira.
translated: Palamenti ya Portugal yakuba akalulu okwongezaayo embeera ey’akabenje mu ggwanga ennaku 15; akalulu kaayitiddwa n’obululu 215 obwawagira, kkumi ne butawagira, n’obululu bumu obuwakanya.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: Saudi Arabia yayongezaayo ekiseera kya kaafiyu mu bibuga ebitukuvu ebya Mecca ne Medina nga kimala olunaku lulamba; mu kusooka, kaafiyu yaliwo wakati wa ssaawa 9 ez’olweggulo ne 12 ez’oku makya.
translated: Saudi Arabia yayongezzaayo kaafiyu mu bibuga ebitukuvu okuli Mecca ne Madina okumala olunaku lwonna; emabegako, kaafiyu yali ekola wakati w’essaawa 3 ez’ekiro ne 6 ez’oku makya

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Thailand yateekateeka kaafiyu wakati w’essaawa 4 ez’ekiro ne 10 ez’ekiro.
translated: Thailand yateekateeka okussa mu nkola kaafiyu wakati w’essaawa 10 ez’olweggulo n’essaawa 4 ez’oku makya

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Gavana wa Ohio, Mike DeWine, yalangirira nti ekitundu ekyo kyongezzaayo ekiseera ky’okubeera ewaka okutuuka nga 1 Ogwokutaano.
translated: Gavana wa Ohio, Mike DeWine yalangiridde nti essaza lino lyongezaayo ekiragiro ky’okusigala awaka okutuusa nga May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Amaduuka g’omu Australia gassa ekkomo ku muwendo gw’ebikookooma omuntu by’alina okugula omulundi ogumu
translated: Amaduuka mu Australia gakendeeza ku kkomo ku mpapula za kaabuyonjo buli nkolagana

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: Ku Ssande ne ku Lwomukaaga olweggulo, amaduuka g’omu Australia agabuna eggwanga lyonna, Woolworths ne Coles bassa ekkomo lyabwe ku bigulibwa ku bikookooma ng’omuntu agula obuganda bubiri oba kamu wonna mu ggwanga mu maduuka ago gombiriri.
translated: Ku Ssande n’Olwomukaaga akawungeezi, amaduuka ga Australia aga Woolworths ne Coles gakendeezezza ku bukwakkulizo bwago obw’okugula kaabuyonjo okutuuka ku ppaaka bbiri ne emu buli nkolagana mu maduuka gonna ku mutendera gw’eggwanga.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: ALDI nayo yassaawo ekkomo lya kaganda kamu ku Lwokusooka.
translated: ALDI era yaleese ekkomo ku paaka emu, ku Mmande.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Okukugira kuno kwalagibwa ng’obubaka eri abantu ku miko gya Facebook egy’amakampuni ago.
translated: Obukwakkulizo buno bwateekebwa ng’obubaka ku mikutu gy’okugula ssente, ne ku mikutu gya Facebook egy’enjegere.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Abaguzi baagambibwa okubeera nga beeterekera olw’okutya COVID-19 ng’abantu kibeetaagisizza okweyawula.
translated: Kigambibwa nti abaguzi baabadde batereka ebintu olw’okutya COVID-19 singa abantu beetaaga okweyawula.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: Ku Lwokusatu, Woolworths nayo yassa ekkomo ku kugula ebikookooma ebigulibwa ne biweerezebwa ewaka ng’omuntu afuna akaganda kamu buli lunaku.
translated: Ku Lwokusatu, Woolworths era yassa ekkomo ku kugula kaabuyonjo okuzituusa awaka ku paaka emu buli order.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Enkyukakyuka zino zigoberera okukugira okwasooka okw’akaganda ak’obuna ku buli lugula okwaleetebwa Woolworths ne Coles nga 4 ne 5 Ogwokusatu mu makampuni gombi mu ngoberegana eyo.
translated: Enkyukakyuka zino zaddiridde obukwakkulizo obwasooka obwa ‘four-pack per transaction’ obwaleetebwawo kkampuni ya Woolworths ne Coles nga March 4 ne 5.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Mu kiwandiiko kya Coles ekya nga 8 Ogwokusatu, yategeeza nti okukugira okw’akaganda ak’ebina, "amaduuka mangi gamazaawo mu ssaawa emu yokka we babireetera", era ne bagamba nti obwetaavu obwo “tebubangawo”, so ng’ate yo ALDI, bwe yawandiika ku Facebook ku Lwokubiri yagamba nti kyali "tekisuubirwa".
translated: Coles, mu kiwandiiko kye yafulumizza nga March 8 ku mikutu gy’amawulire, yategeezezza nti ng’envumbo ku paaka nnya ebaddewo, “amaduuka mangi gakyatunda mu ssaawa emu nga gatuuse”, era n’ayise obwetaavu “obutabangawo”, ate ALDI, mu kiwandiiko kye yafulumizza ku mukutu gwa Facebook ku... Lwakubiri, yakiyise "ekitali kisuubirwa".

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Obutunzi “bwalinnyira ddala waggulu” mu wiiki ewedde okusinziira ku mwogezi wa Woolworths.
translated: Okutunda kweyongedde nnyo wiiki ewedde okusinziira ku mwogezi wa Woolworths.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Edduuka lya Costco mu Canberra nalyo lyakugira omuwendo ogukkirizibwa ku buganda bubiri mu wiiki ewedde.
translated: Store ya Costco e Canberra nayo yassa ekkomo ku ssente ezikkirizibwa ku pack bbiri wiiki ewedde.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Okusobola okukendeeza ku bbula, Coles yasaba ababaweereza bakole obuganda obuneneko era ne bongeza ne ku mirundi gye babaweereza, Woolworths yalagira eyongerwe ku bye yalina, ate ALDI yaleeta ebirala nga bwe yateekateeka ku Lwokusatu olw’enjawulo bituuke nga bukyali.
translated: Okwongera okukendeeza ku bbula lino, Coles yalagira package ennene okuva mu basuubuzi n’okwongera ku mirundi gy’okuzituusa, Woolworths yalagira sitooka ez’enjawulo, ate ALDI n’ekola sitokisi z’omukolo ogw’enjawulo ogwategekebwa ku Lwokusatu nga bukyali.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman, omukungu atwala ekibiina ky’abatunzi ba lejjalejja ekya Australian Retailers Association, yagamba nti aba lejjalejja bagezaako okwongeza ku bye batereka okutunda naye okukugira kw’abakulembeze b’ekitundu ku bungi bw’emmotoka ezireeta kwabakaluubiriza.
translated: Russell Zimmerman, akulira ekibiina ekigatta abasuubuzi mu Australia, yagamba nti abasuubuzi bagezaako okusonda sitoowa, naye obukwakkulizo bw’olukiiko lw’ekitundu ku biseera loole we zinaatuusa kizibuwalira.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Asuubira okulinnyisa omuwendo gw’ensimbi ezikozesebwa, ng’ababaweereza bwe bagezaako okutuukana n’obwetaavu obuliwo ate n’ennaku ez’enjawulo entono.
translated: Asuubira nti ssente z’okufulumya zigenda zirinnya, ng’abagaba ebintu bagezaako okutuukiriza obwetaavu, n’eby’enjawulo ebitono.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: Ku Lwokubiri, ALDI yalangirira nti nga bagoberera okufulumya ebiterekebwa okutundibwa amangu, amaduuka agamu tegasobola kukola kya njawulo kya Lwakusatu.
translated: Ku Lwokubiri, ALDI yalangiridde nti oluvannyuma lw’okufulumya sitooka nga bukyali, amaduuka agamu tegasobola kuddukanya nkola ya njawulo ku Lwokusatu.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Mu alipoota ya News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, omukugu mu kutunda ebya lejjalejja okuva mu Queensland University of Technology, yagamba nti amaduuka galeeta eby’okutunda buli kiro.
translated: Mu lipoota ya News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, omukugu mu by’amaguzi okuva mu Queensland University of Technology yagambye nti amaduuka gano gajjuza sitooka buli kiro.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Yagamba nti ebikookooma biba binene, ekireetera ebiterekebwa mu maduuka okutundibwa okubeera ebitono mu muwendo, ne kiba nti bwe bitundibwa ne biggwaawo, amasa agasigala nga makalu gaba mangi ne kireetawo okuwulira nti waliwo ebbula.
translated: Yategeezezza nti kaabuyonjo kintu kinene nnyo, ekivaako sitokisi okubeera entono mu muwendo, era bwe ziggwaawo, zireka ebifo ebinene eby’oku ssowaani nga njereere, ne kikaluba okuwulira ng’ebbula.

sourceString: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic" said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman yagamba mu mawulire ga ABC News nti "Coles ne Woolworths balowooza [nti] bwe waba nga waliwo ebintu bingi mu masa, ebyamaguzi ng’obuganda bw’ebikookooma n’ebinaaba mu ngalo [bigulibwa] ne bibaawo mu bungi, okupakuka kuyinza okukendeezebwa " .
translated: "Coles ne Woolworths balina endowooza [nti] singa waaliwo ebintu bingi ku shelf, singa ekintu nga toilet rolls ne sanitiser bisobola [okugulibwa] era nga biriwo mu bungi, osanga wandikendeezezza ku bunkenke" Russell Zimmerman bwe yategeezezza buli ABC Amawulire.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Omu ku bakozi b’ebikookooma ateerya mu ntama yagamba ku Lwokusatu nti ebikookooma byali biweddewo.
translated: Kkampuni ekola empapula za kaabuyonjo ezikozesebwa okuddamu okukozesebwa, Who Gives a Crap yategeezezza ku Lwokusatu oluwedde nti zigenda kuggwaamu sitoowa.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: Kimberly-Clark, abakola Ebikookooma, ne Solaris Paper abakola Sorbent, bakkaatiriza nti baali bakola 24/7 okulaba nti bavuganya n’obwetaavu, okusinziira ku alipoota ya News.com.au.
translated: Kimberly-Clark ekola Kleenex Toilet Tissue, ne Solaris Paper ekola Sorbent, baakikkaatirizza nti bakola 24/7 okukuuma ebyuma bino okusinziira ku lipoota ya News.com.au.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Omukutu gwa yintanenti Domain.com, ogutunda ettaka n’ebizimbe baagamba nti waliwo abatunzi abagaba ebikookooma eby’obwereere ku muwanguzi asooka ow’oku nnyondo mu Melbourne, nga waliwo obutunzi bw’oku nnyondo obutono olw’okuba nti abaguzi baalina obudde okuwummula ku nkomerero ya wiiki eyali empanvu omuli n’Olunaku lw’Abakozi.
translated: Omukutu gwa Domain.com ogukola ku by’amayumba, gwategeezezza nti abamu ku batunzi b’ebizimbe baawaayo kaabuyonjo ya bwereere eri eyasooka okugula ku ffulaayi mu kibuga Melbourne, ffulaayi bwe yabadde ntono olw’abaguzi okufuna obudde obw’okuwummula ku wiikendi empanvu ey’olunaku lw’abakozi.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Mu mawuilre g’oku Lwokuna ku NT News, olupapula olufulumira mu Darwin buli lunaku, mwalimu akatabo akasonsekebwamu nga ka miko munaana nga kalina kuggyibwamu ne kakozesebwa ng’ebikookooma.
translated: Ekitabo kya NT News ekyafulumira ku Lwokuna, ekikubibwa buli lunaku mu Darwin, kyalimu ekiwandiiko eky’emiko munaana nga kigendereddwamu okutemebwa ne kikozesebwa nga kaabuyonjo.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Amaduuka mu kusooka gaagaana okussaawo ekkomo, okusinziira ku alipoota okuva mu ABC Australia nga 3 Ogwokusatu nga muno baagamba nti baali tebateekateeka kussa kkomo ku bigulibwa.
translated: Amaduuka gano mu kusooka gaali tegayagala kussaawo bukwakkulizo okusinziira ku lipoota okuva mu ABC Australia nga March 3 mwe baategeezezza nti tebalina nteekateeka yonna ya kussaawo bukwakkulizo ku kugula ebintu bino.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman yayongeddeko nti ebyamaguzi nabyo biri ku ttunzi omwo nga mwe muli obukookolo, ebinaaba mu ngalo, emmere enkalu, ssabbuuni w’omu ngalo n’obuwunga.
translated: Russell Zimmerman yagasseeko nti ebintu ebirala nabyo byetaagibwa nnyo omuli masiki, sanitiser, ebintu ebikalu, eby’okunaaba mu ngalo n’obuwunga.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Mu ngeri y’emu, ebweru wa Australia, ekawungeezi ku Ssande Ssemaduuka w’oku yintaneeti Ocado yalabibwa ng’akugira okugula ebikookooma eby’ekika kya Andres ng’omuntu agula ebiri wakati wa 2 n’akaganda akalimu 12.
translated: Mu ngeri y’emu, ebweru wa Australia, ku Ssande akawungeezi, supamaketi y’e Bungereza eya Ocado ku yintaneeti yalabiddwako ng’ekoma ku kugula kaabuyonjo ya Andres ku paaka bbiri ezirimu emizingo 12.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: Ekitongole ky’Ebyobulamu eky’Ensi yonna (WHO) kirangirira COVID-19 ng’ekizibu ky’ensi yonna
translated: Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna kirangirira COVID-19 ssennyiga omukambwe

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Ku Lwokusatu, World Health Organization (WHO) yalangirira okubalukawo kwa COVID-19 — ng’endwadde ereetebwa akawuka akayitibwa coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — ng’ekizibu eky’ensi yonna.
translated: Ku Lwokusatu, ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna (WHO) kyalangirira nti ekirwadde kya COVID-19 ekigenda mu maaso — obulwadde obuva ku coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — nga ssennyiga omukambwe.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Newankubadde ng’ekigambo "ekizibu eky’ensi yonna" kitegeeza butegeeza engeri obulwadde gye busaasaanye, so si kutegeeza ngeri balwadde abamu gye bali ab’obulabe, WHO yalaga nti gavumenti zisaana okwesowalayo zibeeko kye zikola:
translated: Wadde ng'ekigambo "ssennyiga omukambwe" kitegeeza engeri obulwadde gye busaasaaniddemu yokka, so si ngeri obulwadde obw'enjawulo gye buli obw'obulabe, ekitongole ky'ebyobulamu ekya WHO kyalaba obwetaavu bw'okuvuga gavumenti okukola:

sourceString: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: "Ensi zonna zisobola okukyusa engeri ekizibu kino eky’ensi yonna gye kisaasaanamu.
translated: "Amawanga gonna gakyayinza okukyusa ekkubo lya ssenyiga ono."

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Singa ensi zikenga, zikebera, zijjanjaba, zaawula, zirondoola era ne zikunga abantu ku nsonga eno," bye bigambo by’Omukungu wa WHO, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus.
translated: Singa amawanga gazuula, okugezesa, okujjanjaba, okwawula, okulondoola n'okukunga abantu baabwe mu kuddamu," Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Dayirekita w'ekitongole ky'ebyobulamu bwe yategeezezza.

sourceString: "We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction."
targetString: "Tuwulira nga tukwatiddwako nnyo olw’engeri obulwadde buno gye busaasaanamu ate n’obulabe bwabwo era n’obuteefiirayo obuyitiridde."
translated: "Tweraliikirivu nnyo olw'emitendera egy'entiisa egy'okusaasaana n'obuzibu n'emitendera egy'entiisa egy'obutakola."

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: Okusinziira ku Dr. Tom Frieden eyali Ssenkulu w’Ekitongole kya America Ekirwanyisa Endwadde (CDC) yagamba nti ekizibu kino "kyali tekisuubirwa."
translated: Okusinziira ku Dr. Tom Frieden, eyali dayirekita w’ekitongole kya Amerika ekikola ku kulwanyisa endwadde, ssennyiga ono “tebangawo.”

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Yagamba, mu bigambo ebyafulumira ku CNN mu Gwokubiri nti, "ng’oggyeeko yegu, tewali kawuka kalala kalumba muyungiro gwa kussa kaali kalondoddwa okuva lwe kabalukawo okutuusa lwe kabuna wonna mu nsi."
translated: Yagambye nti, mu bigambo bye yafulumizza CNN mu February, "ng'oggyeeko ssennyiga, tewali kawuka kalala ka kussa kaalondoolebwa okuva lwe kaavaayo okutuuka ku kusaasaana mu nsi yonna obutasalako."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus naye yawa ekirowoozo kye kimu, n’agamba nti "tetulabangako ku kizubu kya nsi yonna kireetebwa kawuka ka coronavirus."
translated: Ghebreyesus yalaze endowooza efaananako bwetyo n'agamba nti "tetulabangako ssenyiga omukambwe oguvudde ku coronavirus."

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Yeeyongera okugamba nti, "era tetulabanga ku kizibu kya nsi yonna kisobola kuziyizibwa."
translated: Yayongeddeko nti, "era tetulabangako ssennyiga omukambwe asobola okufugibwa mu kiseera kye kimu."

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Ekifo ekipya eky’ekizibu ky’ensi yonna kyajja luvannyuma lwa kitongole kya WHO okusalawo mu Janwali okulangirira okubalukawo kw’obulwadde obwo ng’ekizibu ky’ebyobulamu mu bantu bonna ekikwatibwako ensi yonna.
translated: Embeera empya nga ssennyiga omukambwe kiddiridde ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu ekya WHO okusalawo mu January okulangirira ekirwadde kino ng’embeera ey’amangu ey’ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Ye omukulu w’ekitongole ki United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease, Dr. Anthony Fauci, yayogera ku kubalukawo kuno nga, "ekitabuusibwabuusibwa kyekino, kigenda kusajjuka."
translated: Dayirekita w’ekitongole kya Amerika ekikola ku bulwadde bwa allergy n’endwadde ezisiigibwa, Dr. Anthony Fauci, ku bulwadde buno yategeezezza nti, “omusingi, bugenda kweyongera okusajjuka.”

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Olwokuna we lwatuukira, Associated Press kyo kyategeeza nti waaliwo waakiri abalwadde ba COVOID-19 abawera 126,000 mu nsi yonna, nga mu bo 4,600 baafa.
translated: We bwazibidde ku Lwokuna, Associated Press yategezezza nti mu nsi yonna wabaddewo abalwadde ba COVID-19 abatakka wansi wa 126,000, ekyaviiriddeko abantu abasoba mu 4,600 okufa.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Ekizibu ky’ensi yonna ekya coronavirus 2019–20 kizibu ekigenda mu maaso eky’obulwadde bwa 2019 (COVID-19), ekireetebwa akawuka akalumba omuyungiro gw’okussa akayitibwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
translated: Obulwadde bwa coronavirus mu mwaka gwa 2019–20, obulwadde bwa coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19), obuva ku bulwadde bwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Ekizibu kino kyalabibwa mu Wuhan, China, mu Deesemba 2019, ne kirangirirwa ng’ekizibu ky’ebyobulamu mu bantu nga 30 Janwali 2020, ate ne kirabibwa ng’ekizibu ky’ensi yonna nga 11 Ogwokusatu 2020.
translated: Ekirwadde kino kyazuulibwa mu kibuga Wuhan ekya China mu December wa 2019, ne kirangirirwa ng’embeera ey’amangu ey’ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna nga 30 January 2020, era ne kimanyibwa nga ssennyiga omukambwe nga 11 March 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Nga 10 Ogwokuna 2020, abalwadde abakunukkiriza mu kakadde 1.61 aba COVID-19 bategeezeddwa mu mawanga ne mu bifo 210 era n’abantu nga 97,000 bafudde.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 10 April 2020, abantu nga obukadde 1.61 be baakakwatibwa COVID-19 mu mawanga n’ebitundu 210, ekiviiriddeko abantu nga 97,000 okufa.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Abantu nga 364,000 bawonye.
translated: Abantu nga 364,000 bebawonye.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Ekigero ky’abalwadde abafudde kiteeberezebwa okuba ebitundu 4% mu China, ate mu nsi yonna kiri ebitundu 13.04% mu Algeria ne .08% mu New Zealand.
translated: Omuwendo gw’abafa mu balwadde gubadde gubalirirwamu ebitundu 4% mu China, ate mu nsi yonna guli wakati wa 13.04% mu Algeria okutuuka ku .08% mu New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Obubonero obusinga okulabika buzingiramu olusujja, okukolola n’okubaka omukka.
translated: Obubonero obutera okulabika mulimu omusujja, okusesema n’okussa obubi.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Obuzibu bw’obulwadde buno buyinza okuzingiramu lubyamira n’obuzibu obw’amaanyi mu muyungiro gw’okussa.
translated: Ebizibu ebiyinza okuvaamu mulimu ekifuba n’obulwadde bw’okusannyalala ennyo.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Ekiseera okuva ku kukwatibwa obulwadde n’okulaga obubonero kiri awo nga mu nnaku ttaanu naye nga kiva ku nnaku bbiri okutuuka ku kkumi na nnya.
translated: Ekiseera okuva ku kukwatibwa okutuuka ku kutandika kw’obubonero kitera kuba nga kya nnaku ttaano, naye kiyinza okuva ku nnaku bbiri okutuuka ku kkumi n’ennya.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Tewali ddagala ligema limanyiddwa oba ddagala lirwanyisa kawuka kano mu bujjanjabi.
translated: Tewali ddagala limanyiddwa oba ddagala eritta akawuka.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Obujjanjabi obusookerwako bukola ku bubonero na kuyamba okutonotono. Ebisembebwa okukolebwa okwetangira obulwadde mulimu, okunaaba mu ngalo, okubikka ku mimwa ng’okolola, okwewa ebbanga okuva ku balala, okulondoola n’okweyawula oli bw’aba ng’alowooza nti obulwadde abulina.
translated: Obujjanjabi obusookerwako bwe bujjanjabi obulaga obubonero era obuwagira.Ebintu ebisemba okuziyiza mulimu okunaaba mu ngalo, okubikka akamwa ng’asesema, okubeera ewala n’abantu abalala, n’okulondoola n’okwekutula ku bantu abateebereza nti balina akawuka.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Aboobuyinza mu nsi yonna baanukudde nga bassaawo okukugira ku ntambula, kalantiini, kaafiyu, okwegendereza ku mirimu n’okuggalawo ebifo ebimu.
translated: Ab’obuyinza mu nsi yonna bazzeemu okussa mu nkola obukwakkulizo ku ntambula, kalantiini, kafyu, okulwanyisa obulabe ku mirimu, n’okuggala ebifo.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: Nawookeera ono ataataaganyizza ebyobulamu n’ebyenfuna y’abantu mu nsi yonna, okwongezaayo oba okusazaamu ebyemizannyo, emikolo gy’eddiini, emikolo gy’ebyobufuzi n’ebyobuwangwa, wamu n’okuleetawo ebbula ly’ebintu ebimu erivudde ku bantu okugula ebintu nga babuguutana.
translated: Ssenyiga ono avuddeko okutaataaganyizibwa okw’amaanyi mu by’enfuna n’ensi yonna, okwongezaayo oba okusazaamu emikolo gy’emizannyo, eddiini, ebyobufuzi n’ebyobuwangwa, n’ebbula ly’ebikozesebwa mu bantu bangi nga lyeyongedde okusajjuka olw’okugula ebintu mu bunkenke.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Amasomero ne yunivaasite byaggalawo ku mutendera gw’eggwanga lyonna oba mu bitundu mu mawanga 193, ne kikosa kumpi abayizi ebitundu 99.4 ku kikumi mu nsi yonna.
translated: Amasomero ne yunivasite biggaddwa mu ggwanga lyonna oba mu kitundu mu mawanga 193, nga kino kikosezza abayizi nga 99.4 ku buli 100 mu nsi yonna.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Obubaka obukyamu obukwata ku kawuka bubunye ku yintaneeti era wabaddewo emirundi gy’okulumbagana okw’obukyayi n’okusosola eri Abachaina, abantu abalala abava mu East ne Southeast Asia oba abo ababafaanana n’abalala abava mu bitundu omuli ennyo obulwadde bw’akawuka ako.
translated: Amawulire amakyamu agakwata ku kawuka kano gasaasaanidde ku mikutu gya yintaneeti, era wabaddewo ebikolwa eby’okukyawa abagwira n’okusosola abantu Abachina, abantu abalala abava mu buvanjuba n’obugwanjuba bw’obuvanjuba bwa Asia n’endabika, n’abalala okuva mu bitundu omuli abantu abangi abakwatibwa akawuka.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Olw’okuggalawo entambula n’amakolero amanene, wabaddewo okukendeera ku kwonoona kw’empewo n’okusaasaanya omukka omubi (carbon emissions).
translated: Olw’okukendeera kw’entambula n’okuggalwa kw’amakolero amanene, wabaddewo okukendeera kw’obucaafu bw’empewo n’omukka ogufuluma mu bbanga.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Abeebyobulamu mu Wuhan, China (ekibuga ekikulu ekya Hubei province) baategeeza nti waaliwo abantu batonotono abaalina yegu atamanyiddwako w’ava nga 31 Deesemba 2019, era okunoonyereza ne kutandika ku ntandikwa ya Janwali 2020.
translated: Ab’ebyobulamu mu kibuga Wuhan ekya China (ekibuga ekikulu eky’essaza ly’e Hubei) baategeeza nti ekibinja ky’abalwadde b’ekifuba nga tebamanyiddwa kivaako nga 31 December 2019, era okunoonyereza ne kutandikibwawo ku ntandikwa ya January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Abalwadde baalabibwa ng’abalina akakwate n’emmere y’omu nnyanja ey’e Huanan (Seafood Wholesale Market) awo nno akawuka kaalowoozebwa okuba nga kava mu nsolo ne kadda mu bantu.
translated: Emisango gino okusinga gyalina akakwate ku katale ka Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market era bwekityo akawuka kalowoozebwa nti kava mu zoonotic.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Akawuka akaaleeta okubalukawo kw’ekirwadde kayitibwa SARS-CoV-2, nga kawuka kapya akaakazuulibwa akafaananako n’obw’omu buwundo obuyitibwa bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, ne SARS-CoV. Omuntu eyasooka okweyolekerako obuboero yazuulibwa oluvannyuma nga yalwala nga 1 Deesemba 2019, ate ng’omuntu oyo teyazuulibwa nti yalina akakwate konna n’obutale omutundirwa ebintu ebibisi.
translated: Akawuka akaavaako ekirwadde kino kamanyiddwa nga SARS-CoV-2, akawuka akapya akazuuliddwa nga kakwatagana nnyo ne bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, ne SARS-CoV.Omuntu eyasooka okumanyibwa ng’alina obubonero oluvannyuma yazuulibwa nti yalwala nga 1 December 2019 , era omuntu oyo teyalina kakwate kalabika n’ekibinja ky’akatale akabisi oluvannyuma.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Ku balwadde abaasooka okutegeezebwa mu Deesemba 2019, ebitundu bibiri byakusatu ku bo baazuulibwa nga balina akakwate ku katale ako.
translated: Ku kibinja ky’emisango egyasooka okuloopebwa mu December wa 2019, ebitundu bibiri ku bisatu byazuulibwa nga birina akakwate n’akatale.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Nga 13 Ogwokusatu 2020, amawulire agataategeerekeka we gaava mu ggulire lya South China Morning Post gaategeeza nti omulwadde eyalwala emabega nga 17 Noovemba 2019, ow’emyaka 55 eyava mu Hubei province, ayinza okuba nga ye yasooka. Nga 26 Ogwokubiri 2020, WHO yategeeza ng’abalwadde abapya bwe bakendedde mu China naye ate amangu ddala ne beeyongera mu Italy, Iran, ne South Korea, omuwendo gw’abalwadde abapya abali ebweru wa China gwali gususse ku ogwo ogw’abalwadde abapya abali munda mu China omulundi ogusookedde ddala.
translated: Nga 13 March 2020, alipoota etakakasiddwa okuva mu South China Morning Post yalaga nti omusango ogwaddirira nga 17 November 2019, mu musajja ow’emyaka 55 okuva mu ssaza ly’e Hubei, guyinza okuba nga gwe gwasooka.Nga 26 February 2020, WHO bwe yategeezezza nti, nga kigambibwa nti abapya abakwatibwa abalwadde bakendedde mu China naye ne beeyongera mu bwangu mu Italy, Iran, ne South Korea, omuwendo gw’abalwadde abapya ebweru wa China gwali gusukka omuwendo gw’abalwadde abapya mu China omulundi ogusoose.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Kyandiba nga waaliwo obutayogera muwendo gw’abalwadde mutuufu naddala abo abalina obubonero obutali bwa maanyi.
translated: Wayinza okubaawo obutaloopa bungi nnyo ku balwadde naddala mu abo abalina obubonero obutono.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Nga 26 Ogwokubiri, abalwadde batono abaali bategeezeddwa mu bavubuka ab’emyaka 19 n’okukka wansi abakola ebitundu 2.4% eby’abalwadde mu nsi yonna. Omukulu w’abawi b’amagezi ag’ekinnassaayansi mu Bungereza, Patrick Vallance, yateebereza nti ebitundu 60% eby’abantu mu Bungereza bayinza okufuna akawuka ako ng’obusibage obw’amaanyi tebunnaba kufunibwa mu bantu.
translated: We bwatuukira nga 26 February, abavubuka batono nnyo abaali bazuuliddwa mu bavubuka, ng’abo abali wansi w’emyaka 19 be bakola ebitundu 2.4% ku balwadde mu nsi yonna.Omuwabuzi omukulu mu Bungereza ku bya ssaayansi, Patrick Vallance, yateebereza nti ebitundu 60% ku bantu b’e Bungereza baali beetaaga okukwatibwa akawuka nga tebannaba obutafaali obuziyiza endwadde mu kisibo obulungi bwandituukiddwako.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Abalwadde kitegeeza omuwendo gw’abantu abakebeddwa COVID-19, era okukebera ne kulaga nti balina akawuka okusinziira ku nseetuka entongole.
translated: Cases kitegeeza omuwendo gw’abantu abakebeddwa COVID-19, era nga bazuuliddwa nga bazuuliddwa nga balina obulwadde okusinziira ku nkola entongole.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Nga 23 Ogwokusatu, tewali ggwanga lyali likebedde bantu baalyo basussa bitundu 3%, ate amawanga mangi balina enkola ey’obutakebera abo abeeyolekerako obubonero obutali bwa maanyi, gamba nga Italy, Netherlands, Spain, ne Switzerland.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 23 March, tewali nsi yonna yali ekebedde bantu baayo abasukka mu 3%, era amawanga mangi gabadde n’enkola entongole obutakebera abo abalina obubonero obutono bwokka, nga Italy, Netherlands, Spain, ne Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwafulumizibwa nga 16 Ogwokusatu kwalaga nti China, okutuusa nga 23 Janwali, abalwadde abakunukkiriza ebitundu 86% baali tebannaba kukengebwa, era nti abalwadde abo abaali tebannaba kuwandiikibwa be baali basiiga abalala ebitundu 79% abaali bawandiikiddwa.
translated: Okunoonyereza okwafulumizibwa nga 16 March kwazuula nti mu China, okutuuka nga 23 January, abantu ababalirirwamu ebitundu 86% ku balwadde ba COVID-19 baali tebazuuliddwa, era nti obulwadde buno obutawandiikiddwa bwe bwali ensibuko y’obulwadde bwa 79% ku balwadde abawandiikiddwa.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Okwekaliriza okw’ebibalo okwafulumizibwa nga 30 Ogwokusatu kwateebereza nti omuwendo gw’abalwadde mu Italy gwali munene ddala okusinga ogwo ogwali gutegeezebwa.
translated: Okwekenenya kw’ebibalo okwafulumizibwa nga 30 March kwateebereza nti omuwendo gw’abantu abakwatibwa obulwadde buno mu Yitale gwali munene nnyo okusinga ku balwadde abaaloopebwa.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Okuteebereza okwasooka okw’ennamba esookerwako ezaalukanya (R0) eya COVID-19 gwali 1.4 okutuuka ku 2.4.
translated: Okubalirira okwasooka okw’omuwendo gw’okuzaala omukulu (R0) ku COVID-19 kwali 1.4 ku 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwafulumizibwa mu America ekitongole kya Center for Disease Control and Prevention kulaga nti ennamba eyo eyinza okuba 5.7.
translated: Okunoonyereza okwafulumiziddwa ekitongole kya Amerika ekivunaanyizibwa ku kulwanyisa endwadde (US Center for Disease Control and Prevention) kuzudde nti kiyinza okuba nga kya 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Abantu abasinga abalwala COVID-19 bawona.
translated: Abantu abalina COVID-19 abasinga bawona.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Eri abo abatawona, ekiseera okuva obubonero we butandikira okujja okutuuka okufa kiri wakati w’ennaku 6 okutuuka ku nnaku 41 naye ng’ezisinga mu bantu bonna ziri 14.
translated: Ku batakikola, obudde okuva ku kukula kw’obubonero okutuuka ku kufa bubadde wakati w’ennaku 6 ne 41, ng’esinga okubeerawo ennaku 14.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Nga 10 Ogwokuna 2020, abantu abakunukkiriza 97,000 bagambibwa nti baafa COVID-19.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 10 April 2020, abantu nga 97,000 be baakafa COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: Mu China, nga 5 Ogwokubiri abantu abaafa nga 80% baali mu abo abasussa emyaka 60, era ebitundu 75% baalina endwadde endala omuli obulwadde bw’omutima (cardiovascular diseases) ne sukaali. Emiwendo gy’abafu emitongole egya nawookeera wa COVID-19 okusinga ennyo gyogera ku baafa abaakeberwa nga balina COVID okusinziira ku nseetuka entongole.
translated: Mu China, we bwazibidde nga 5 February nga 80% ku bafudde baali mu abo abasukka emyaka 60, ate 75% baalina embeera z’ebyobulamu ezaaliwo edda omuli endwadde z’emisuwa ne sukaali.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested bazuuliddwa COVID okusinziira ku ndagaano entongole.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Omuwendo gw’abantu gwennyini abafa COVID-19 guyinza okuba wagguluko kubanga guyinza obutabeeramu bantu bafa nga tebakebeddwa - okugeza ewaka, mu maka g’abalabirira abakadde, n’ewalala.
translated: Omuwendo gw’abantu abatuufu abafa COVID-19 guyinza okuba omungi ennyo, kubanga guyinza obutazingiramu bantu abafa nga tebakebereddwa - okugeza awaka, mu maka g’abakadde, n’ebirala.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Obubaka obw’ekitundu okuva mu Italy bwazuula nti omuwendo gw’abafu ogusukkamu mu kiseera kya nawookeera gwasukka ogwo omutongole ogwa COVID n’ennamba eyeekubisaamu emirundi 4-5.
translated: Ebiwandiiko ebitonotono okuva mu Italy byazudde nti omuwendo gw’abafudde abasukkiridde mu kiseera kya ssennyiga omukambwe gwasukka omuwendo gw’abafudde COVID mu butongole n’emirundi 4-5x.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Omukyala ayogerera U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) yakkiriza nti "Tukimanyi nti [omuwendo gw’abafa] tegulaga bituufu", bino twabikakasa n’okubuuliriza abantu mu America. Obutalaba bituufu kitera okubaawo mu biseera bya nawookeera gamba nga 2009 H1N1 swine flu. Omuntu eyasooka okukakasibwa nti afudde yali mu Wuhan nga 9 Janwali 2020.
translated: Omwogezi w'ekitongole kya Amerika ekivunaanyizibwa ku kulwanyisa endwadde (CDC) yakkirizza nti "Tukimanyi nti [omuwendo gw'abafudde ogwategeezeddwa] gunyooma", ekiwandiiko ekikakasiddwa lipoota ez'olugero ez'okubala abantu abatono mu Amerika Okunyooma ng'okwo kutera okubaawo mu ssennyiga omukambwe, gamba nga the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.Eyasooka okukakasibwa nti yafa yali mu kibuga Wuhan nga 9 January 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Omuntu eyasooka okufa ebweru wa China yafa nga 1 Ogwokubiri mu Philippines, ate eyasooka okufa ebweru wa Asia yali mu France nga 14 Ogwokubiri.
translated: Okufa okwasooka ebweru wa China ku lukalu kwaliwo nga 1 February mu Philippines, ate okwasooka okufa ebweru wa Asia kwali mu Bufalansa nga 14 February.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Nga 28 Ogwokubiri, ebweru wa China, abantu abasukka mu 12 baafa mu buli limu ku mawanga gano, Iran, South Korea, ne Italy.
translated: We bwatuukira nga 28 February, ebweru wa China ku lukalu, buli omu yafa abantu abasukka mu kkumi mu Iran, South Korea ne Yitale.
