Waliwo ekika kya lubyamira atamanyiddwa kimuleeta eyalabibwa nga 26 Deesemba nga yajjanjabibwa omusawo Zhang Jixian mu Hubei Provincial Hospital, ng’ono yategeeza Wuhan Jianghan CDC nga 27 Deesemba.
translated: Bino byasinga kukwatagana n’akatale ka Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, nga nako katunda ebisolo ebiramu, era endowooza emu eri nti akawuka kano kaava mu kimu ku bisolo eby’ekika kino; oba, mu ngeri endala, erina ensibuko ya zoonotic.Ekibinja ky’ekifuba ekitamanyiddwa kivaako kyalabibwa nga 26 December era ne kijjanjabwa omusawo Zhang Jixian mu ddwaaliro ly’essaza ly’e Hubei, eyategeeza Wuhan Jianghan CDC nga 27 December.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Nga 30 Deesemba, ekibiina ky’abasawo mu ddwaliro ly’e Wuhan Central Hospital baatemya ku bannaabwe nti wandibaawo akawuka akeefaanaanyirizaako "SARS coronavirus".
translated: Nga 30 December, ekibinja ky'abasawo mu ddwaaliro lya Wuhan Central Hospital kyatemya bannaabwe ku "COVID-19 eringa eya SARS".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Munaana ku basawo abo, omwo nga mwe muli Li Wenliang, baanenyezebwa poliisi olw’okusaasaanya obulimba ate n’omulala Ai Fen, yanenyezebwa bakama be olw’okukuba omulanga.
translated: Munaana ku basawo bano okuli ne Li Wenliang, poliisi yababuulirira olw’okusaasaanya olugambo olw’obulimba, ate omulala Ai Fen n’aboggolera bakama be olw’okukuba alamu.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Akakiiko k’eddwaliro lya Wuhan Municipal Health Commission oluvannyuma kaafulumya ekimanyiso nga 31 Deesemba ne kategeeza WHO.
translated: Oluvannyuma akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu Munisipaali y’e Wuhan kaafulumya ekiwandiiko mu lujjudde nga 31 December ne kategeeza ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu ekya WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Abalwadde abawerako abaalina yegu atamanyiddwa baali bamaze okutegeezebwa aboobuyinza mu Wuhan okutandika okunoonyereza ku ntandikwa ya Janwali. Okubalukawo kw’obulwadde nga kwakatandika, omuwendo gw’abalwadde gwekubisaamu emirundi ebiri kumpi buli luvannyuma lwa nnaku musanvu n’ekitundu.
translated: Emisango gy’ekifuba egitamanyiddwa gyali gimaze okuloopebwa eri ab’ebyobulamu mu kibuga Wuhan okutandika okunoonyereza ku ntandikwa ya January.Mu biseera ebisooka nga obulwadde buno bubaluseewo, omuwendo gw’abalwadde gweyongera emirundi ebiri nga buli luvannyuma lwa nnaku musanvu n’ekitundu.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Ku ntandikwa ne mu makkati ga Janwali 2020, akawuka kaasaasaana mu bitundu bya China ebirala, ng’okusaasaana okwo kuyambibwako ebikujjuko by’omwaka gwa China Omupya ate n’engeri Wuhan gye kiri ekibuga ky’ebidduka ebingi n’ekifo ewawaanyisiriganyizibwa eggaali z’omukka.
translated: Ku ntandikwa n’omu makkati ga January 2020, akawuka kano kasaasaana mu masaza ga China amalala, nga kayambibwako okusenguka kw’Abachina mu mwaka omuggya ate Wuhan okubeera ekifo ekikulu eky’entambula n’okuwanyisiganya eggaali y’omukka ennene.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Nga 20 Janwali, China yategeeza nti erina abalwadde nga 140 abapya mu lunaku lumu, omwo nga mwe muli abantu babiri mu Beijing n’omulala omu mu Shenzhen.
translated: Nga 20 January, China yafuna abantu kumpi 140 mu lunaku lumu nga kuliko abantu babiri mu Beijing n’omu mu Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Oluvannyuma, obubaka obutongole bulaga nti abantu 6,174 baali bamaze okufuna obubonero olwa 20 Janwali 2020 we lwatuukira. Nga 26 Ogwokusatu, America yayisa China mu muwendo gw’abalwadde abakakasiddwa mu nsi yonna. Nga 9 Ogwokuna 2020 we lwatuukira, abalwadde abasukka mu 1.61 baali bamaze okulabibwa mu nsi yonna; abantu abasukka mu 97,000 baali bafudde ate ng’abantu 364,000 bawonye.
translated: Oluvannyuma ebiwandiiko ebitongole biraga nti abantu 6,174 baali bamaze okufuna obubonero nga 20 January 2020. We bwazibidde nga 26 March, Amerika esukkulumye ku China ne Yitale ng’esinga okuzuulibwa mu nsi yonna.We bwazibidde nga 9 April 2020, abantu abasoba mu bukadde 1.61 abalwadde bazze bakwatibwa mu nsi yonna; abantu abasoba mu 97,000 bebafudde ate abasoba mu 364,000 nebawona.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Amawanga n’ebitundu nga 200 gafunye waakiri omulwadde omu.
translated: Amawanga n’ebitundu nga 200 bye bibaddemu waakiri omulwadde omu.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Olwa nawookeera mu Bulaaya, ensi nnyingi mu kitundu kya Schengen zikugira abantu okutambula nga bwe baagala era zitaddewo obukwakkulizo ku nsalo zaazo.
translated: Olw’ekirwadde kya ssenyiga omukambwe mu Bulaaya, amawanga mangi mu kitundu kya Schengen gakugira abantu okutambula mu ddembe era ne bateekawo enkola y’okufuga ensalo.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Ebimu ku mawanga bye gakoze mulimu enkola ez’okutangira okusaasaana okugeza nga kalantiini (ekimanyiddwa nga ebiragiro by’okusigala ewaka, ebiragiro by’obutafuluma nnyumba, oba omuggalo) ne kaafiyu. Bwe zaawerera 2 Ogwokuna, abantu abakunukkiriza mu bukadde 300, oba ebitundu nga 90% ku bantu bonna nga bali ku muggalo egw’engeri emu mu America, abantu abasukka mu bukadde 50 baali ku muggalo mu Phillipines, abantu abali mu bukadde nga 59 baali ku muggalo mu South Afrika, n’abantu akawumbi 1.3 baali ku muggalo mu India.
translated: Ebikolwa by’eggwanga bibaddemu enkola z’okuziyiza abantu nga kalantiini (ezimanyiddwa nga ebiragiro by’okusigala awaka, ebiragiro by’okusula mu kifo, oba omuggalo) n’okussaawo kaafiyu.We bwazibidde nga 2 April, abantu kumpi obukadde 300, oba ebitundu nga 90% ku bantu, bali mu muggalo ogw’engeri emu mu Amerika, abantu abasoba mu bukadde 50 bali mu muggalo mu Philippines, abantu nga obukadde 59 bali mu muggalo mu South Africa, ate abantu akawumbi kamu n’obukadde 300 bali mu muggalo mu Buyindi.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Nga 26 Ogwokusatu, abantu akawumbi 1.7 mu nsi yonna baali ku muggalo ogw’engeri ez’enjawulo era nga omuwendo gweyongera okutuuka ku bantu obuwumbi 2.6 nga wayiseewo ennaku bbiri—kumpi ekitundu kimu kyakusatu ku bantu abali mu nsi yonna.
translated: Nga 26 March, abantu akawumbi kamu n’obukadde 700 mu nsi yonna baali wansi w’omuggalo ogw’engeri emu oba endala, ogwalinnya ne gutuuka ku bantu obuwumbi bubiri n’obukadde 600 oluvannyuma lw’ennaku bbiri —nga kimu kya kusatu eky’abantu b’ensi yonna.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Omulwadde eyasooka owa COVID-19 asuubirwa okuba nga yazuulwa nga 1 Deesemba 2019 mu Wuhan; waliwo alipoota emu eteekakasika eraga nti omulwadde eyasooka yaliwo nga 17 Noovemba.
translated: Omuntu eyasooka okuzuulibwa nga alina ekirwadde kya COVID-19 azuuliddwa nga 1 December 2019 mu kibuga Wuhan; lipoota emu etakakasiddwa eraga nti omulwadde eyasooka yaliwo nga 17 November.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Doctor Zhang Jixian yekkaanya akabinja k’abalwadde ba yegu atamanyiddwa kyamuleeta nga 26 Deesemba, oluvannyuma eddwaliro mw’akolera ne litegeeza aboobuyinza mu Wuhan Jianghan CDC nga 27 Deesemba.
translated: Omusawo Zhang Jixian yalaba ekibinja ky’abalwadde b’ekifuba nga tebamanyiddwa nsonga nga 26 December, eddwaaliro lye bwe lyategeeza Wuhan Jianghan CDC nga 27 December.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Okukebera kw’endagabutonde okwasooka ku sampolo z’abalwadde nga 27 Deesemba 2019 zaalaga nti zirimu akawuka ka coronavirus akalinga SARS.
translated: Okusooka okukeberebwa obuzaale ku sampuli z’abalwadde nga 27 December 2019 kwalaga nti waliwo akawuka ka coronavirus akalinga aka SARS.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Ekimanyiso eri abantu kyafulumizibwa eddwaliro lya Wuhan Municipal Health Commission nga 31 Deesemba.
translated: Ekiwandiiko mu lujjudde kyafulumizibwa akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu Munisipaali y’e Wuhan nga 31 December.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: Ekitongole kya WHO kyategeezebwa ku lunaku lwe lumu.
translated: Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu ekya WHO kyategeezeddwa ku lunaku lwe lumu.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Okumanyisa okwo bwe kwabaawo, abasawo mu Wuhan baalabulwa poliisi olw’okusaasaanya “olugambo lw’okubalukawo” kw’obulwadde.
translated: Nga okumanyisibwa kuno kugenda mu maaso, abasawo mu kibuga Wuhan poliisi yabalabuddwa olw'okusaasaanya "olugambo" ku bulwadde buno.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Akakiiko ka Chinese National Health Commission mu kusooka kaagamba nti tewali "bubaka bulambulukufu" bulaga nsaasaanya eva ku-muntu-ku-muntu.
translated: Akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga mu China kaasooka kugamba nti tewali “bujulizi bulambulukufu” bulaga nti obulwadde buno okuva mu bantu okudda mu bantu.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Janwali ng’aggwaako, gavumenti ya China yatandikawo kaweefube ow’amaanyi eyayogerwako Ssaabawandiisi w’Ekibiina kya Chinese Communist Party Xi Jinping nga "olutalo lw’abantu" okulwanyisa okusaasaana kw’akawuka.
translated: Ku nkomerero ya January, gavumenti ya China yatongoza kampeyini ey’amaanyi oluvannyuma omuwandiisi omukulu ow’ekibiina ky’abakomunisiti mu China, Xi Jinping kye yayogeddeko ng’olutalo lw’abantu okuziyiza okusaasaana kw’akawuka kano.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Mu kwogerwako nga “kalantiini ekyasinze mu bulamu bw’omuntu”, omuggalo kkuulaamalungi gwalangirirwa nga 23 Janwali okuyimiriza okutambula okugenda oba okuva mu Wuhan, era ne gwongezebwayo mu bibuga nga 15 mu Hubei, ne kikosa abantu nga obukadde 57.
translated: Mu kiseera kino ekibadde kyogerwako nga "kalantiini esinga obunene mu byafaayo by'omuntu", ekitongole ekirongoosa obuyonjo ekya ‘cordon sanitaire' kyalangirirwa nga 23 January nga kiyimiriza entambula okuyingira n'okufuluma Wuhan, ekyayongezebwayo okutuuka mu bibuga 15 byonna awamu mu Hubei, omugatte gwakosa obukadde nga 57 abantu.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Okukozesa emmotoka ez’obwannannyini kwagaanibwa mu kibuga.
translated: Okukozesa mmotoka z’obwannannyini kuwereddwa mu kibuga.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Ebikujjuko by’Omwaka gwa China Omupya (25 Janwali) byasazibwamu mu bifo ebiwerako.
translated: Ebikujjuko by’omwaka omuggya (25 January) eby’Abachina byasaziddwamu mu bifo bingi.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Aboobuyinza era baalangirira okuzimba kw’eddwaliro ery’ekiseera, Huoshenshan Hospital, eryamalirizibwa mu nnaku 10.
translated: Ab’obuyinza era balangiridde okuzimba eddwaaliro ery’ekiseera, Huoshenshan Hospital, eryamalirizibwa mu nnaku 10.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Eddwaliro eddala nalyo lyazimbibwa oluvannyuma nga liyitibwa, Leishenshan Hospital, likole ku balwadde abalala.
translated: Eddwaaliro eddala lyazimbibwa oluvannyuma, Leishenshan Hospital, okukola ku balwadde abalala.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko eddwaliro eddala eryazimbibwa, China era yakyusa ebifo ebirala 14 mu Wuhan, gamba nga ebifo ebituuza enkiiko n’ebisaawe by’omupiira n’ebifuulamu amalwaliro ag’ekiseera. Nga 26 Janwali, gavumenti yateekawo ebiragiro ebirala okulwanyisa okubalukawo kwa COVID-19, omwo nga mwe muli ebiwandiiko by’abatambuze ebyogera ku mbeera y’obulamu bwabwe n’okwongezaayo ebijaguzo by’oluwummula lwa Spring.
translated: Ng’oggyeeko amalwaliro amapya agaazimbibwa, China era yakyusa n’ebifo ebirala 14 mu kibuga Wuhan, gamba ng’ebifo enkuŋŋaana ennene n’ebisaawe, okubifuula amalwaliro ag’ekiseera.Nga 26 January, gavumenti yatandikawo enkola endala ez’okuziyiza ekirwadde kya COVID-19, omuli n’okufulumya ebirango by’ebyobulamu eri abatambuze n’okwongezaayo oluwummula lw’ekivvulu kya Spring Festival.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Yunivaasite n’amasomero okwetooloola eggwanga nabyo byaggalwa.
translated: Amatendekero n’amasomero okwetoloola eggwanga nabyo byaggaddwa.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Ebitundu bya Hong Kong ne Macau byateekawo ebiragiro bingi, naddala ku masomero ne yunivaasite.
translated: Ebitundu bya Hong Kong ne Macau byassaawo enkola eziwerako naddala ku bikwata ku masomero ne yunivasite.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Entegeka z’okukola emirimu omuntu nga tali ku mulimu zaakolebwa mu bitundu bya China bingi.
translated: Enkola z’okukola ewala zassibwawo mu bitundu bya China ebiwerako.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Okukugira ku kutambula kwakolebwa munda n’ebweru wa Hubei.
translated: Envumbo ku ntambula yassibwawo mu Hubei n’ebweru waayo.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Entambula y’olukale yakyusibwamu, n’ebifo by’obulambuzi eby’amakaddiyizo byaggalwawo okumala ekiseera.
translated: Entambula ey’olukale yakyusibwa, era ebifo eby’edda mu China yonna byaggalwawo okumala akaseera.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: Okukugira entambula y’abantu kwatandika okukolebwa mu bibuga bingi, era kiteeberezebwa nti abantu nga obukadde 760 (omuwendo ogusukka mu kitundu ky’abantu bonna) baafuna okukugirwa okw’engeri ez’enjawulo. Obulwadde bwe bwasaasaanira ensi yonna mu Gwokusatu, aboobuyinza mu China baateekawo ebyokugoberera ebikakali okuziyiza akawuka ate “okukaggya mu nsi” endala nga kagenda mu China.
translated: Okufuga entambula y’abantu kwakozesebwa mu bibuga bingi, era kiteeberezebwa nti abantu nga obukadde 760 (abasukka mu kitundu ky’abantu) baayolekagana n’okuziyizibwa okw’engeri emu oba endala.Oluvannyuma lw’ekirwadde kino okuyingira mu mutendera gwakyo ogw’ensi yonna mu March, ab’obuyinza mu China baakola enkola enkakali okutangira akawuka kano "okuyingiza" okuva mu mawanga amalala.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Okugeza, Beijing yateekawo kalantiini ow’obuwaze wa nnaku 14 ku bantu bonna abava mu nsi endala abaali bayingira mu China. Nga 23 Ogwokusatu, mu China munda baalinamu omuntu omu yekka eyali akwatiddwa obulwadde mu bbanga ery’ennaku ettaanu ezaakulembera era ng’ono yali mutambuze eyali akomyewo ng’agenda mu Guangzhou ng’ava mu Istanbul.
translated: Okugeza, Beijing etaddewo kalantiini ey’ekiragiro eri abatembeeyi bonna ab’ensi yonna abayingira ekibuga kino okumala ennaku 14.Nga 23 March, China ku lukalu omulwadde omu yekka gwe yasiigibwa mu ggwanga mu nnaku ttaano ezaali ziyise, mu mbeera eno ng’ayita mu mutambuze eyadda e Guangzhou okuva e Istanbul.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Nga 24 Ogwokusatu 2020, Ssaabaminista wa China Li Keqiang yategeeza nti okusaasaana kw’akawuka mu China munda kuzibikiddwa era okubalukawo kw’obulwadde kulwanyisiddwa mu China.
translated: Nga 24 March 2020, Ssaabaminisita wa China Li Keqiang yategeeza nti okusaasaana kw’abalwadde abasiigibwa mu ggwanga okusinga kuziyiziddwa era ekirwadde kino kifugiddwa mu China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Ku lunaku olwo lwennyini ebiragiro ebikugira okutambula ne babiddiriza mu Hubei, ng’oggyeeko Wuhan, oluvannyuma lw’emyezi ebiri nga bataddewo omuggalo. Minisitule ya China ekola ku nsonga z’ebweru yalangirira nga 26 Ogwokusatu 2020 nti visa z’okuyingira mu China oba olukusa lw’okukolerayo bijja kuyimirizibwa okuva nga 28 Ogwokusatu n’okweyongerayo nga teboogedde kiseera kiragiro kino lwe kirikoma.
translated: Ku lunaku lwe lumu obukwakkulizo ku ntambula bwakendeezebwa mu Hubei, ng’oggyeeko Wuhan, nga wayise emyezi ebiri bukya omuggalo guteekebwawo.Minisitule y’ensonga z’ebweru mu China yalangirira nga 26 March 2020 nti okuyingira abalina viza oba olukusa lw’okubeera mu nsi kwakuyimirizibwa okuva nga 28 March okudda waggulu, nga... tewali bikwata ku ddi enkola eno lw’eneekoma.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Abo abaagala okuyingira mu China kijja kubeetaagisa okusaba visas okuva ku bitebe bya China.
translated: Abaagala okuyingira China bagenda kusaba viza mu bitebe bya China oba mu bitongole bya China.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Gavumenti ya China yakubiriza aba bizinensi n’amakolera okuggulawo nga 30 Owokusatu, era n’eteekawo ebisikiriza eri amakampuni. Akakiiko k’eggwanga kaatandika na kuteekawo lunaku lwa kukungubaga mu ggwanga nga batandika n’okusirikamu kwa ddakiika 3 ku ssaawa 4 nga 4 Ogwokuna, nga kino kikwatagana n’Ebikujjuko bya Qingming, wabula gavumenti eya wakati yasaba amaka okuwaayo obubaka obukungubaga ku yintaneeti nga bagenderera obuteeriraana olw’okwewala okuddamu okusaasaanya obupya COVID-19.
translated: Gavumenti ya China yakubiriza bizinensi n’amakolero okuddamu okuggulawo nga 30 March, era n’ewa amakampuni enkola z’okusitula ssente.Olukiiko lw’eggwanga lwalangirira olunaku lw’okukungubaga okutandika n’okusirika kw’eggwanga okw’eddakiika ssatu nga ssaawa 10:00 nga 4 April, nga bwe kyali kikwatagana ne Qingming Festival, wadde nga gavumenti eya wakati yasabye amaka okussa ekitiibwa mu mutimbagano nga bakuuma ebanga ery’omubiri okusobola okwewala ekirwadde kya COVID-19 ekizzeemu.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: COVID-19 yakakasibwa nti atuuse mu South Korea nga 20 Janwali 2020 ng’ava mu China.
translated: COVID-19 yakakasibwa nti yasaasaana mu South Korea nga 20 January 2020 okuva e China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Ekitongole ky’eggwanga eky’ebyobulamu kyategeeza nti waaliwo okweyongera kw’abalwadde okw’amaanyi nga 20 Ogwokubiri, nga kigambibwa nti ekyo kyava ku lukuŋŋaana olwali mu Daegu olw’eddiini empya eyitibwa Ekkanisa ya Yesu ey’e Shincheonji (Shincheonji Church of Jesus).
translated: Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga kyategeezezza nti abantu abakakasibwa okweyongera ennyo nga 20 February, nga kino okusinga kyavudde ku kukungaana kw’ekibiina ky’eddiini ekipya ekimanyiddwa nga Shincheonji Church of Jesus mu kibuga Daegu.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Abagoberezi ba Shincheonji abaagenda e Daegu okuva mu Wuhan be bateeberezebwa okusibukako okubulakawo kw’obulwadde.
translated: Abagoberezi ba Shincheonji ababadde bakyalidde Daegu okuva e Wuhan bateeberezebwa okuba nga be baasibuka ekirwadde kino.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Nga 22 Ogwokubiri, mu bagoberezi b’ekkanisa 9,336, 1,261 oba ebitundu nga 13% baategeeza nti baalina obubonero bw’obulwadde. South Korea yalangiriria okulabula okusingayo okuba okw’amaanyi nga 23 Ogwokubiri 2020.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 22 February, mu bagoberezi b’ekkanisa eno 9,336, 1,261 oba nga 13% be baategeezezza nti balina obubonero.South Korea yalangirira okulindaala okusinga nga 23 February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Nga 28 Ogwokubiri, abalwadde abaakakasibwa abasukka mu 2,000 be baategeezebwa mu Korea ne balinnya okutuuka ku 3,150 nga 29 Ogwokubiri.
translated: Nga 28 February, abantu abasoba mu 2,000 abakakasibwa be baakwatibwa mu Korea, ne balinnya okutuuka ku 3,150 nga 29 February.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Enkambi z’amagye zonna mu South Korea zaateekebwa mu kalantiini oluvannyuma lw’okukebera okwalaga nti abasirikale basatu baakakasibwa nga balina akawuka.
translated: Enfo z’amagye za South Korea zonna zaateekebwa mu kalantiini oluvannyuma lw’okukeberebwa okukakasa nti abajaasi basatu bazuuliddwamu akawuka kano.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Enteekateeka z’entambula z’ennyonyi nazo zaakosebwa era bwe zityo ne zikyusibwa. South Korea yateekawo eteekateeka ezaatunuulirwa ng’ezisinga obugazi n’obulungi mu nsi yonna okusunsula abantu abalina akawuka, n’okwawula buli muntu alina akawuka nga bwe balondoola n’okuteeka mu kalantiini buli eyali akwataganyeeko n’omuntu oyo asangibwa n’akawuka.
translated: Enteekateeka z’ennyonyi nazo zaakosebwa n’olwekyo zaakyusibwa.South Korea yaleeta enteekateeka eyatwalibwa ng’esinga obunene era esinga okutegekebwa mu nsi yonna okukebera omuwendo gw’abantu oba akawuka kano, n’okwawula abantu bonna abalina akawuka nga kw’otadde n’okulondoola n’okuteeka mu kalantiini abo abaabatuukirira .

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Obukodyo bw’okusunsula bwalimu okweroopa okw’obuwaze oli ng’alina obubonero eri abo abaava mu mawanga amalala nga bakozesa app z’oku ssimu, okuvuga emmotoka n’ogenda mu kifo n’okeberwa akawuka ng’oweebwa ebivaamu enkeera, n’okwongeza ku busobozi bw’okukebera okusobozesa okukebera abantu 20,000 buli lunaku.
translated: Enkola z’okukebera zaalimu okukakatako okwewandiisa obubonero bw’abapya abatuuse mu nsi yonna nga bayita mu nkola y’oku ssimu, okukebera akawuka mu mmotoka ng’ebyavaamu bibaawo enkeera, n’okwongera ku busobozi bw’okukeberebwa okusobozesa abantu abawera 20,000 okwekebejjebwa buli lunaku.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Enteekateeka ya South Korea programme etwalibwa okuba nga yalimu obuwanguzi mu kulwanyisa okubalukawo kw’obulwadde wadde ng’ebibuga byonna tebaabiteeka mu kalantiini. Abantu b’omu South Korean mu kusooka beeyawulamu olw’engeri Pulezidenti Moon Jae-in gye yali akuttemu ensonga z’obulwadde.
translated: Enteekateeka ya South Korea etwalibwa okuba ey’obuwanguzi mu kufuga ekirwadde kino wadde nga teyassa bibuga byonna mu kalantiini.Mu kusooka abantu ba South Korea baawukanye ku ngeri Pulezidenti Moon Jae-in gye yakwatamu obuzibu buno.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Abakorea bangi baateeka emikono ku kiwandiiko nga basaba Moon ave mu buyinza nga bagamba nti gavumenti tekutte bulungi kubalukawo kwa bulwadde ate ng’abalala bawaana by’akoze.
translated: Bannakorea bangi baassa omukono ku mpaaba oba nga basaba Moon agobwe mu ntebe olw’ebyo bye bagamba nti gavumenti okukwata obubi ekirwadde kino, oba okutendereza engeri gye yazzeemu.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Nga 23 Ogwokusatu, kyategeezebwa nti South Korea ye yalina omuwendo gw’abalwadde abasinga obutono mu nsi okumala wiiki nnya.
translated: Nga 23 March, kyategeezebwa nti South Korea ye yasinga omuwendo gw’abalwadde abakwatibwa olunaku lumu mu wiiki nnya.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Nga 29 Ogwokusatu kyategeezebwa nti okutandika nga 1 Ogwokuna abantu bonna abatambula okuva mu mawanga amalala bajja kuteekebwa mu kalantiini okumala wiiki bbiri.
translated: Nga 29 March kyategeezeddwa nti okutandika nga 1 April abapya bonna abajja emitala w’amayanja bagenda kuteekebwa mu kalantiini okumala wiiki bbiri.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Nga 1 Ogwokuna, ebitongole by’amawulire byategeeza nti South Korea yali asabye obuyambi bw’ebikozesebwa mu kukebera akawuka okuva mu mawanga 121.
translated: Okusinziira ku mawulire nga 1 April, South Korea efunye okusaba okuyambibwa mu kukebera akawuka okuva mu mawanga 121 ag’enjawulo.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Iran yalangirira omulwadde waayo owa SARS-CoV-2 eyasooka okukakasibwa nga 19 Ogwokubiri mu Qom, era ekitongole ky’Ebyobulamu (Ministry of Health and Medical Education) kyategeeza nti abantu babiri baafa ku lunaku olwo.
translated: Iran yafuna abalwadde ba SARS-CoV-2 abaasooka okuzuulibwa nga 19 February mu kibuga Qom, okusinziira ku minisitule y’ebyobulamu n’ebyenjigiriza by’abasawo, abantu babiri gye baafa oluvannyuma lw’olunaku olwo.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Eby’okukola ebyasooka okulangirirwa gavumenti mwalimu okusazaamu ebivvulu n’emikolo gy’ebyobuwangwa, emikolo gy’ebyemizannyo, n’okusaba kw’Olwokutaano, n’okuggalawo kwa yunivaasite, amatendekero aga waggulu, n’amasomero.
translated: Ebintu gavumenti bye yasooka okulangirira mwalimu okusazaamu ebivvulu n’emikolo emirala egy’ebyobuwangwa, emizannyo, n’okusaba ku Lwokutaano, n’okuggala amatendekero, amatendekero aga waggulu n’amasomero.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Iran yassaawo obutabalika (trillion) bwa rials butaano okulwanyisa akawuka.
translated: Iran yawaddeyo obuwumbi bwa rial butaano okulwanyisa akawuka kano.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Nga 26 Ogwokubiri 2020, Pulezidenti Hassan Rouhani yagamba nti tewaaliwo nteekateeka za kuteeka kalantiini ku bitundu ebyali bikoseddwa nti era abantu kinnoomu be balina okuteekebwa mu kalantiini.
translated: Pulezidenti Hassan Rouhani yategeeza nga 26 February 2020 nti tewali nteekateeka yonna ya kussa kalantiini mu bitundu ebikoseddwa ekirwadde kino, era abantu ssekinnoomu bokka be bagenda okuteekebwa mu kalantiini.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Enteekateeka z’okukendeeza ku ntambula wakati w’ebibuga eby’enjawulo zaalangirirwa mu Gwokusatu wadde ng’ebidduka bingi ebyentambula z’ebikujjuko by’Omwaka omupya ogwa Persia (Persian New Year Nowruz) byo byagenda mu maaso.
translated: Enteekateeka z’okussa ekkomo ku ntambula wakati w’ebibuga zalangirirwa mu March, wadde ng’entambula ey’amaanyi wakati w’ebibuga nga twetegekera omwaka omuggya ogw’e Buperusi Nowruz yagenda mu maaso.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Ebifo by’okusabiramu ebya Shia mu Qom byasigala nga biggule eri abalamazi okutuusa nga 16 Ogwokusatu 2020. Iran yafuuka entabiro y’okusaasaanya akawuka ng’eddirira China mu Gwokubiri.
translated: Amasabo g’Abashiya mu kibuga Qom gaasigala nga gaggule eri abalamazi okutuusa nga 16 March 2020. Iran yafuuka ekifo ekikulu eky’okusaasaanya akawuka kano oluvannyuma lwa China mu mwezi gwa February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Wakati mu kulumiriza nti waaliwo okubikkirira ekizibu ky’obulwadde mu Iran, amawanga agasukka mu kkumi gaali galondodde abalwadde baabwe nga baaliko mu Iran olwa 28 Ogwokubiri we lwatuukira, kino nga kiraga nti obunene bw’ekirwadde bwali bwa maanyi okusukka ku balwadde 388 gavumenti ya Iran be yali egamba nti be bali mu ggwanga eryo olunaku olwo we lwatuukira.
translated: Wakati mu bigambo ebigambibwa nti waliwo okubikka ku bunene bw’ekirwadde kino mu Iran, amawanga agasukka mu kkumi gaali galondodde abalwadde baago okudda mu Iran nga 28 February, ekiraga nti obunene bw’obulwadde buno buyinza okuba obw’amaanyi okusinga ku balwadde 388 abaaloopebwa Omuirani gavumenti ku lunaku olwo.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Paliyamenti ya Iran yayimirizibwa, nga bammemba 23 ku 290 baali bagambibwa okuba nga bakebeddwa ne basangibwa nga balina akawuka nga 3 Ogwokusatu.
translated: Palamenti ya Iran yaggalwawo, nga ku bammemba baayo 290 baategeezeddwa nti baali bazuuliddwa nga balina akawuka kano nga 3 March.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Nga 12 Ogwokubiri, ekitongole kya Human Rights Watch kyakubiriza aboobuyinza mu makomera ga Iran okuta abamenyi b’amateeka ku ddembe ly’obuntu awatali kakwakkulizo wamu n’okuta abasibe bonna abasaanira okuteebwa okumala ekiseera ekigere.
translated: Nga 12 March, ekitongole kya Human Rights Watch kyasaba abakulira amakomera mu Iran okuyimbula awatali bukwakkulizo abalwanirizi b’eddembe ly’obuntu abaali basibiddwa olw’okuwakanya mu mirembe, era n’okuyimbula abasibe bonna abalina ebisaanyizo okumala akaseera.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Kigambibwa nti waliwo obulabe bw’akawuka bwa maanyi okusaasaanira mu bifo ebirimu abantu abangi gamba ng’amakomera, ate nga tebiriimu bujjanjabi bumatiza.
translated: Yategeezezza nti waliwo obulabe obw’amaanyi obw’akawuka kano okusaasaana mu bitongole ebiggaddwa nga ebifo ebikuumirwamu abantu, nga nabyo tebirina bujjanjabi bumala.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Nga 15 Ogwokusatu, gavumenti ya Iran yategeeza nti abantu 100 baafa mu lunaku lumu, nga guno gwe muwendo ogwasinga obunene mu ggwanga lino okuva obulwadde lwe bwabalukawo.
translated: Nga 15 March, gavumenti ya Iran yategeeza nti abantu 100 be baafa mu lunaku lumu, nga kino kye kisinga okufa mu ggwanga lino bukya kirwadde kino kitandika.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: Olwa 17 Ogwokusatu we lwatuukira abakulembeze waakiri 12 ku abo abaali bakulembeddeko Iran n’abo abali mu bukulembeze baali bafudde olw’ekirwadde ekyo.
translated: Bannabyabufuzi n’abakungu ba gavumenti mu Iran abatudde oba abaaliko 12 baali bafudde obulwadde buno we bwazibidde nga 17 March.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Olwa 23 Ogwokusatu we lwatuukira, Iran yali efuna abalwadde 50 abapya buli ssaawa n’omuntu omu ng’afa buli luvannyuma lwa ddakiika kkumi olwa coronavirus.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 23 March, Iran yali efuna abalwadde 50 buli ssaawa ate omuntu omu omupya afa buli ddakiika kkumi olw’ekirwadde kya corona.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Okusinziira ku mukungu wa WHO, omuwendo gw’abalwadde mu Iran guyinza okuba nga gukubisa emirundi etaano mu ogwo ogwogerwa.
translated: Okusinziira ku mukungu w’ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu mu kitongole ky’ebyobulamu, mu Iran wayinza okuba ng’abalina abalwadde basukka emirundi etaano okusinga ku abo abategeezebwa.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Kigambibwa era nti obukwakkulizo America bwe yateeka ku Iran buyinza okuba nga bukosa obusobozi bw’eggwanga eryo okulwanyisa obulwadde.
translated: Era kiteesebwako nti envumbo za Amerika ku Iran ziyinza okuba nga zikosa obusobozi bw’eggwanga lino mu by’ensimbi okusobola okwanukula akawuka kano.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: Ekitongole ky’Amawanga Amagatte Ekirwanirira Eddembe ly’obuntu (UN High Commissioner for Human Rights) kisabye nnati z’ebyenfuna ezaateekebwa ku mawanga okuddirizibwa naddala ago agasinze okukosebwa ekirwadde kino, omwo nga mwe muli ne Iran.
translated: Omukungu w’ekibiina ky’amawanga amagatte avunaanyizibwa ku ddembe ly’obuntu asabye envumbo z’ebyenfuna zikendeezebwe ku mawanga agasinga okukosebwa ssenyiga omuli ne Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: Okubalukawo kw’obulwadde kwakakasibwa okusaasaanira mu Italy nga 31 Janwali, abalambuzi Abachina babiri bwe baakeberebwa ne bazuulibwa nga balina SARS-CoV-2 mu Roma.
translated: Ekirwadde kino kyakakasibwa nti kyasaasaana mu Italy nga 31 January, abalambuzi babiri aba China bwe baakeberebwa ne bazuulibwamu obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2 mu kibuga Rooma.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Omuwendo gw’abalwadde gwatandika okulinnyira ku mbiro ekyaleetera gavumenti ya Italy okuyimiriza ennyonyi zonna ezigenda n’eziva e China era ne balangirira n’akaseera aka kazigizigi.
translated: Emisango gyatandika okulinnya nnyo, ekyaviirako gavumenti ya Yitale okuyimiriza ennyonyi zonna ezigenda n’okudda e China n’okulangirira embeera ey’akabenje.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Ekika ky’akawuka akatakwatagana na COVID-19 kaakengebwa oluvannyuma, nga katandikira ku balwadde 16 abaakakasibwa mu Lombardy nga 21 Ogwokubiri. Nga 22 Ogwokubiri, Akakiiko ka Baminista kaalangirira etteeka eppya okulwanyisa obulwadde, omwo nga mwe muli okuteeka abantu abasukka mu 50,000 abava mu Munisipaali ezisukka mu kalantiini mu bukiikakkono bwa Italy.
translated: Oluvannyuma ekibinja ky’abalwadde ba COVID-19 ekitali kikwatagana kyazuulibwa, nga kitandikira ku balwadde 16 abakakasiddwa mu Lombardy nga 21 February.Nga 22 February, olukiiko lwa baminisita lwalangirira ekiragiro-etteeka eppya okuziyiza ekirwadde kino, omuli n’okuteeka abantu abasoba mu 50,000 mu kalantiini okuva ku 11 munisipaali ez’enjawulo mu bukiikakkono bwa Yitale.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: Ssaabaminista Giuseppe Conte yagamba nti, "Mu bifo ebibaluseemu obulwadde, okuyingira n’okubifuluma tekujja kukkirizibwa.
translated: Ssaabaminisita Giuseppe Conte agamba nti, "Mu bitundu omuli ekirwadde kino, okuyingira n'okufuluma tekujja kuweebwayo."

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Okuyimiriza emirimu egikolebwa n’emikolo gy’ebyemizannyo kumaze okukolebwa mu bifo ebyo. "Nga 4 Ogwokusatu, gavumenti ya Italy yalangirira okuggalirawo ddala amasomero ne yunivaasite mu ggwanga lyonna nga mu kiseera ekyo Italy yali ewezezza abafu 100.
translated: Okuyimiriza emirimu n'emizannyo byalagirwa dda mu bitundu ebyo."Nga 4 March, gavumenti ya Yitale yalagira amasomero gonna ne yunivasite mu ggwanga lyonna okuggalwawo mu bujjuvu nga Italy etuuse ku bantu 100 abafudde.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Emikolo gy’ebyemizannyo gyonna emikulu, omuli n’emizannyo gy’omupiira egy’eddaala A (Serie A football matches), gyalina kuzannyirwa munda mu bizimbe okutuusa nga 1 Ogwokuna, naye nga 9 Ogwokusatu, emizannyo gyonna gyayimirizibwa okumala waakiri omwezi gumu.
translated: Emizannyo gyonna emikulu omuli n’emipiira gya Serie A gyali gya kubeera mabega wa nzigi eziggaddwa okutuusa nga April, kyokka nga 9 March, emizannyo gyonna gyayimirizibwa ddala okumala waakiri omwezi gumu.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Nga 11 Ogwokusatu, Ssaabaminista Conte yalangirira okuyimiriza kumpi buli mulimu gwa busuubuzi okuggyako ssemaduuka n’amatundiro g’eddagala. Nga 6 Ogwokusatu, Ettendekero lya College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) lyafulumya ebiragiro ebikwata ku bigobererwa mu kunoonyereza okulimu enseetuka ekulembeza okufa ku balwadde (triage protocols) ebiyinza okukozesebwa mu kunoonyereza.
translated: Nga 11 March, Ssaabaminisita Conte yalagira kumpi emirimu gyonna egy’obusuubuzi giyimirizibwe okuggyako supamaketi n’amaduuka g’eddagala.Nga 6 March, ekitongole kya Yitale ekikola ku by’okusannyalala, okukendeeza ku bulumi, okuzuukusa n’okulabirira abalwadde abayi (SIAARTI) kyafulumya ebiteeso ebikwata ku mpisa z’abasawo ebikwata ku nkola z’okusunsulamu eziyinza okukozesebwa.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Nga 19 Ogwokusatu, Italy yayisa China mu muwendo gw’abafa ekirwadde kya coronavirus mu nsi yonna bwe baategeeza nti baalina abatu 3,405 abaafa nawookeera w’ekirwadde.
translated: Nga 19 March, Italy yasinga China ng’eggwanga erisinga okufa mu nsi yonna olw’obulwadde bwa coronavirus oluvannyuma lw’okufa abantu 3,405 olw’ekirwadde kya ssenyiga omukambwe.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Nga 22 Ogwokusatu, kyategeezebwa nti Russia yali eweerezza ennyonyi z’amagye mwenda mu Italy.
translated: Nga 22 March, kyategeezebwa nti Russia yali esindise ennyonyi z’amagye mwenda n’ebikozesebwa mu by’obujjanjabi e Yitale.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Nga 5 Ogwokuna we lwatuukira, waaliwo abalwadde abakakasiddwa 128,948, abafu 15,887, n’abawonye 21,815 mu Italy, era ng’abasinga obungi ku abo baali mu kitundu ky’e Lombardy.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 5 April, abantu 128,948 abazuuliddwa, 15,887 abaafa, n’abawona 21,815 mu Yitale, ng’abasinga ku balwadde abo baali mu kitundu kya Lombardy.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Amawulire ga CNN gaalaga nti olw’okuba Italy erina abakadde bangi okwo nga kw’ogasse n’obutasobola kukebera bantu bonna balina kawuka, kyandiba nga kyongereza ku muwendo gw’abafa omungi.
translated: Alipoota ya CNN yalaze nti okugatta awamu abakadde abangi mu Yitale n’obutasobola kukebera bonna abalina akawuka kano okutuusa kati kiyinza okuba nga kye kivuddeko omuwendo gw’abafa omungi.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Engeri Bungereza gye yasooka okukwatamu obulwadde buno yafaanana okuba nga y’esinga okuba ey’emirembe mu nsi zonna ezaali zikoseddwa, era okutuusa nga 18 Ogwokusatu 2020, gavumenti ya Bungereza yali tennateekawo kiragiro kyonna ku bantu kwewa mabanga oba kalantiini ow’abantu bonna mu ggwanga eryo.
translated: Engeri Bungereza gye yakwatamu akawuka kano yasooka kweyoleka ng’emu ku mawanga agasinga okuwummuza mu mawanga agakoseddwa, era okutuusa nga 18 March 2020, gavumenti ya Bungereza teyassaawo ngeri yonna ya kugabanya bantu oba okussa mu kalantiini mu bungi ku bannansi baayo.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: N’ekyava mu ekyo, gavumenti yanenyezebwa olw’okwesuulirayo ogwa nnaggamba mu buzibu obwali bwolekedde abantu. Nga 16 Ogwokusatu, Ssaabaminista Boris Johnson yalangirira ng’awa abantu amagezi okwewala okutambula okutali kwa nsonga n’okukwatagana n’abantu abalala, n’agamba nti we kisobokera bakolere ewaka era beewale n’ebifo ng’amabaala, ebifo ebiriirwamu n’ebifo ebisanyukirwamu.
translated: N’ekyavaamu, gavumenti yafuna okunenya olw’okulowoozebwa nti teyali ya sipiidi na maanyi mu kwanukula okweraliikirira kw’abantu.Nga 16 March, Ssaabaminisita Boris Johnson yakola ekirangiriro ng’awabula ku ntambula zonna ezitali za mugaso n’okukwatagana n’abantu, n’awa amagezi ku bantu kola ng’oli waka we kisoboka era weewale ebifo nga ebbaala, eby’okulya, ne katemba.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Nga 20 Ogwokusatu, gavumenti yalangirira nti ebifo ebisanyukirwamu byonna ng’amabaala ne ggimu byali bya kuggalwa amangu ddala nga bwe kisoboka, era n’asuubiza okusasula okutuuka ku bitundu 80% eby’ensako y’abakozi okukoma ku £2,500 buli mwezi okwewala ebbula ly’emirimu mu kizibu kino. Nga 23 Ogwokusatu, Ssaabaminisita yalangirira enkola z’okwewa amabanga enkakali, n’awera enkuŋŋaana ez’abantu abasukka mu babiri n’okuwera okutambula n’ebikolerwa ebweru w’ennyumba nga birina kukolebwa nga ddala byetaagisa.
translated: Nga 20 March, gavumenti yalangirira nti ebifo byonna eby’okwesanyusaamu nga amabaala ne jjiimu byali bigenda kuggalwawo mu bwangu, era n’esuubiza okusasula ebitundu 80% ku musaala gw’abakozi okutuuka ku kkomo lya pawundi 2,500 buli mwezi okutangira ebbula ly’emirimu mu buzibu buno .Nga 23 March, Ssaabaminisita yalangirira enkola enkakali ey’okuggya abantu ewala mu bantu, n’awera okukuŋŋaana kw’abantu abasoba mu babiri n’okukomya entambula n’okukola ebweru okutuuka ku ekyo ekitunuuliddwa nti kyetaagisa nnyo.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Ng’oggyeeko ebyokukola ebyasooka okuteekebwawo, obukwakkulizo buno poliisi ye yali erondoola okulaba nga bussibwa mu nkola nga baweesa abantu engassi n’okusattulula enkuŋŋaana zonna.
translated: Okwawukanako n’ebikolwa eby’emabega, obukwakkulizo buno bwali bussibwa mu nkola poliisi ng’eyita mu kuwa engassi n’okusaasaanya abantu abakuŋŋaana.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Bizinensi ezisinga zaalagirwa okuggalawo okuggyako ezo ezitwalibwa “ng’ez’enkizo” omwo nga mwe muli ssemaduuka, amatundiro g’eddagala, bbanka, amaduuka g’ebizimbisibwa, amasundiro g’amafuta ne galagi.
translated: Bizinensi ezisinga zaalagiddwa okuggalwa, okuggyako bizinensi ezitunuuliddwa "ez'omugaso", omuli supamaketi, amaduuka g'eddagala, bbanka, amaduuka g'ebintu ebikozesebwa mu kukola ebintu, amasundiro g'amafuta, ne galagi.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Nga 20 Janwali, omulwadde wa COVID-19 eyasooka okukakasibwa mu Pacific Northwest state of Washington yali musajja eyadda mu ggwanga ng’ava mu Wuhan nga 15 Janwali.
translated: Nga 20 January, omulwadde wa COVID-19 eyasooka okumanyibwa yazuulibwa mu ssaza ly’e Washington mu Pacific Northwest mu musajja eyali akomyewo okuva e Wuhan nga 15 January.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: Akakiiko ka America akalwanyisa Coronavirus akayitibwa White House Coronavirus Task Force kaateekebwawo nga 29 Janwali.
translated: Ekitongole ekivunaanyizibwa ku bulwadde bwa Coronavirus ekya White House Coronavirus Task Force kyatandikibwawo nga 29 January.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Nga 31 Janwali, obukulembeze bwa Trump bwalangirira kazigizigi w’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga era ne bateekawo obukwakkulizo ku batambuze abava mu China.
translated: Nga 31 January, gavumenti ya Trump yalangirira embeera ey’amangu mu by’obulamu, era n’eteeka obukwakkulizo ku kuyingira kw’abatambuze okuva e China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Nga 28 Janwali 2020, Center for Disease Control—ekitongole ekikulu mu byobulamu mu America—kyalangirira nti kyali kikoze ebikozesebwa ebyakyo okukebera obulwadde.
translated: Nga 28 January 2020, ekitongole ekivunaanyizibwa ku kulwanyisa endwadde ekya Center for Disease Control —ekitongole ekikulembedde mu by’obulamu mu gavumenti ya Amerika —kyalangirira nti baakola ekitabo kyabwe eky’okukebera.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Wadde nga kino baakikola, America yatandika kasoobo ng’ekebera, era nga kino kyalemesa okumanya obunene bw’ekizibu ky’obulwadde.
translated: Wadde nga yakola ekyo, Amerika yatandika mpola mu kukebera, ekyazibikira obunene obutuufu obwali bubaluseewo ekirwadde kino mu kiseera ekyo.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Okukebera kwajjamu omugozobano gw’okukozesa ebikebera obulwadde ebikyamu mu Gwokubiri, gavumenti obutakkiriza bikebera bulwadde bitali byayo kukozesebwa (ebikozesebwa abanoonyereza, amakampuni n’amalwaliro) okutuusa ku nkomerero y’Ogwokubiri, n’okukugira abantu nga balina kutuukiriza bisaanyizo bya kukeberebwa okutuusa mu Gwokusatu (oluvannyuma ekiragiro ky’omusawo kye kibaddenga kyetaagisa).
translated: Okukebera kwayonooneka olw’ebikozesebwa mu kukebera ebitali bituufu ebyakolebwa gavumenti eya wakati mu February, obutaba na lukusa lwa gavumenti eya wakati ku bikozesebwa mu kukebera ebitali bya gavumenti (abasomesa, amakampuni n’amalwaliro) okutuusa ku nkomerero ya February, n’emisingi egy’okukugira abantu okutuukiriza ebisaanyizo by’okuweebwa a okukeberebwa okutuusa ku ntandikwa ya March (oluvannyuma lw’ekyo kyali kyetaagisa okuweebwa ekiragiro ky’omusawo).

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Nga 27 Ogwokubiri, Olupapula lw’Amawulire The Washington Post lwategeezeza nti abantu abatawera 4,000 be baali bakebeddwa mu America.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 27 February, The Washington Post yategeeza nti abantu abatakka wansi wa 4,000 be baali bakebereddwa mu Amerika.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Nga 13 Ogwokusatu, The Atlantic lwategeeza nti abantu abatawera 14,000 be baali bakebeddwa.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 13 March, The Atlantic yategeeza nti abantu abatakka wansi wa 14,000 baali bakebereddwa.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Nga 22 Ogwokusatu, Associated Press kyawandiika nti: "Abantu bangi abeeyolekerako obubonero nga balina n’olukusa lw’omusawo balindira essaawa nnyingi oba ennaku eziwera okukeberwa.” Oluvannyuma lw’omuntu eyasooka okufa mu Washington state nga 29 Ogwokubiri, Governor Jay Inslee yalangirira ekiseera ekya kazigizigi, era nga kino ebitundu ebirala nabyo kye byakola.
translated: Nga 22 March, Associated Press yategeeza nti: "Abantu bangi abalina obubonero n'ekiragiro ky'omusawo balinze essaawa oba ennaku okukeberebwa."Oluvannyuma lw'okufa okwasooka mu Amerika okuloopebwa mu ssaza ly'e Washington nga 29 February, Gavana Jay Inslee bwe yalangirira embeera ey’amangu, ekikolwa ekyagobererwa mu bbanga ttono amawanga amalala.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: Amasomero mu kitundu ky’e Seattle gaasazaamu ebibiina nga 3 Ogwokusatu era amakkati g’Ogwokusatu we gaatukira, amasomero okwetooloola mu ggwanga gaatandika okuggalawo. Nga 6 Ogwokusatu 2020, ekibiina ky’abanoonyereza ku ndwadde mu Imperial College London kyawa America amagezi ku kizibu kye yali eyolekedde bulwadde obwo.
translated: Amasomero mu bitundu by’e Seattle gaasazaamu emisomo nga 3 March, era mu makkati ga March, amasomero okwetoloola eggwanga gaali gaggalwawo.Nga 6 March 2020, Amerika yawabulwa ku biteeberezebwa ku ngeri akawuka ka coronavirus akapya gye kayinza okukwatamu eggwanga okuva mu kibiina wa bakugu mu by’endwadde mu Imperial College London.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Ku lunaku lwe lumu Pulezidenti Trump yassa omukono ku Tteeka ly’Okuwa Obuyambi obw’amangu (Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act) mwe baaweerayo obuwumbi bwa doola 8.3 mu gavumenti z’ebitundu okulwanyisa nawookeera.
translated: Ku lunaku lwe lumu Pulezidenti Trump yassa omukono ku tteeka eriyitibwa Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, eryawa obuwumbi bwa ddoola munaana n’obukadde 300 ez’ensimbi ez’amangu ebitongole bya gavumenti eya wakati okusobola okwanukula ekirwadde kino.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Ebitongole byateekawo obukwakkulizo ku bakozi, byasazaamu enkuŋŋaana, era baakubiriza abakozi okukolera ewaka.
translated: Ebitongole byassaawo obukwakkulizo ku ntambula y’abakozi, ne bisazaamu enkuŋŋaana, era ne bikubiriza abakozi okukola nga bali waka.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Emikolo gy’emizannyo n’enzannya ezaali zitegekebwa byasazibwamu. Nga 11 Ogwokusatu, Trump yalangirira ebiragiro ku ntambula mu bitundu bya Bulaaya ebisinga, ng’oggyeeko Bungereza, okumala ennaku 30, okutandika ne 13 Ogwokusatu.
translated: Emizannyo ne sizoni byasazibwamu.Nga 11 March, Trump yalangirira obukwakkulizo ku ntambula mu bitundu bya Bulaaya ebisinga obungi, nga tobaliddeemu Bungereza, okumala ennaku 30, okutandika nga 13 March.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Ku lunaku olwaddirira yagaziya ebiragiro n’ayongerako Bungereza ne Ireland.
translated: Enkeera, yagaziya ku bukwakkulizo obwo n’azingiramu Bungereza ne Ireland.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Nga 13 Ogwokusatu, yalangirira akaseera aka kazigizigi mu ggwanga lyonna ekyaleetera okukozesa ssente za gavumenti ez’ebitundu okukozesebwa ku bulwadde obuliwo.
translated: Nga 13 March, yalangirira embeera ey’amangu mu ggwanga lyonna, eyafuula ssente za gavumenti eya wakati okusobola okukola ku buzibu buno.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Okutandika ne 15 Ogwokusatu, bizinensi nnyingi zaggalawo oba zaakendeeza ku budde bw’okukoleramu wonna mu America nga bagezaako okukekkereza okusaasaanya akawuka.
translated: Okutandika nga 15 March, bizinensi nnyingi zaggalawo oba okukendeeza ku ssaawa mu Amerika yonna okugezaako okukendeeza ku kusaasaana kw’akawuka kano.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Nga 17 Ogwokusatu, obulwadde bwali bumaze okukakasibwa wonna mu masaza 50 ne mu District of Columbia. Nga 23 Ogwokusatu, kyategeezebwa nti Ekibuga New York kyalina abalwadde 10,700 aba coronavirus, era ng’omuwendo guno gusinga ogwo ogw’abalwadde abaali mu South Korea.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 17 March, ssenyiga ono yali akakasiddwa mu masaza gonna 50 ne mu Disitulikiti y’e Columbia.Nga 23 March, kyategeezebwa nti ekibuga New York kyalimu abantu 10,700 abakwatibwa ekirwadde kya coronavirus, nga kino kisinga omuwendo gw’abalwadde bonna mu South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Nga 25 Ogwokusatu, gavana yagamba nti okwewa amabanga kwafaanana okuba nga kuvaamu ebirungi kubanga okwekubisaamu kw’abalwadde kulabika nga kwali kukendedde okuva ku nnaku 2.0 okudda ku nnaku 4.7.
translated: Nga 25 March, Gavana yategeeza nti social distancing yalabika ng’ekola, kubanga okubalirira kw’emisango okukubisaamu emirundi ebiri kwakendeera okuva ku nnaku 2.0 okutuuka ku nnaku 4.7.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: 28 Ogwokusatu we lwatuukira, waaliwo abalwadde abakakasiddwa 32,308 mu Kibuga New York, n’abantu 672 baali bafudde olw’akawuka. Nga 26 Ogwokusatu, America yali egambibwa okubeera n’abalwadde abakakasiddwa bangi okusinga ewalala wonna mu nsi, omwo nga mwe muli ne China ne Italy. Nga 8 Ogwokuna we lwatuukira, abalwadde 400,335 baali bakakasiddwa mu America n’abantu 12,841 nga bafudde.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 28 March, abantu 32,308 abakakasiddwa mu kibuga New York, era abantu 672 be baali bafudde akawuka kano.Nga 26 March, Amerika yategeezebwa nti yalina abalwadde ba coronavirus bangi okusinga amawanga amalala gonna mu nsi yonna, omuli ne China ne Italy.We bwazibidde nga 8 April, abantu 400,335 be baakazuulibwa mu Amerika, ate abantu 12,841 be baakafa.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Amawulire ga Per media nga 30 Ogwokusatu gaategeeza nti Pulezidenti wa U.S. Trump yasalawo okwongezaayo ebbanga ly’ebiragiro by’okwewa amabanga okutuusa nga 30 Ogwokuna.
translated: Nga emikutu gy’amawulire bwe gyategeezezza nga 30 March, Pulezidenti wa Amerika Trump asazeewo okwongezaayo enkola y’okukwata abantu ewala okutuusa nga 30 April.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Ku lunaku lwe lumu, eddwaliro lya USNS Comfort, erikolera ku lyato eririko ebitanda nga 1000 lyatuuka mu New York.
translated: Ku lunaku lwe lumu, emmeeri y’eddwaliro eya USNS Comfort ng’erina ebitanda nga 1000, yakola ennanga mu New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Nga 3 Ogwokuna, America yalina abantu abafudde 884 olwa coronavirus mu ssaawa 24 zokka.
translated: Nga 3 April, Amerika yafuna likodi y’abantu 884 abaafa olw’ekirwadde kya corona mu bbanga lya ssaawa 24.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: Mu New York abalwadde baali basusse 100,000 olwa 3 Ogwokuna we lwatuukira. White House yakolokotebwa olw’okunyoomereza ekizibu n’okufuga obubaka obufuluma mu bantu nga balagira abeebyobulamu ne bannassaayansi okuweereza obubaka bwonna n’ebiwandiiko ebifulumizibwa mu wofiisi y’Omumyuka wa Pulezidenti Mike Pence.
translated: Mu ssaza ly’e New York abalwadde basukka mu 100,000 nga 3 April.Ekitongole kya White House kibadde kivumirira olw’okunyooma okutiisibwatiisibwa n’okufuga obubaka buno nga balagira abakulira ebyobulamu ne bannassaayansi okukwasaganya ebigambo n’ebitabo ebifulumizibwa mu lujjudde ebikwata ku kawuka kano ne ofiisi ya... Omumyuka wa Pulezidenti Mike Pence.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Okutwaliza awamu engeri Trump gy’akuttemu ekizubu kino etunuuliddwa nnyo ng’etambulidde ku kyekubiira.
translated: Okutwalira awamu okukkiriza Trump enzirukanya y’obuzibu buno kubadde kwa njawulo ku nsonga z’ebibiina.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Abakulembeze abamu mu U.S. n’aboogera ku byamawulire baakolokota America olw’okwesigama ennyo mu kuggya ebweru ebintu eby’amanaanyi ebyetaagisa, omwo nga mwe muli n’eddagala ebiva mu China.
translated: Abamu ku bakungu ba Amerika n’abakomentinga bavumiridde Amerika okwesigama ku kuyingiza ebintu ebikulu omuli n’ebikozesebwa mu by’obujjanjabi ebikulu okuva e China.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Okwekenneenya entambula z’omu bbanga kwakozesebwa okwoleka engeri obulwadde gye busaasaanamu era ne kufulumizibwa mu The Journal of Travel Medicine wakati wa Janwali 2020.
translated: Okwekenenya enkola y’entambula y’ennyonyi kwakozesebwa okukola maapu n’okulagula enkola y’okusaasaana era kwafulumizibwa mu lupapula lwa The Journal of Travel Medicine mu makkati ga January 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Okusinziira ku bubaka obwafuluma mu 2018 nga buva mu Kibiina ky’Ensi yonna ku ntambula z’omu bbanga (International Air Transport Association), Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, ne Taipei byalina abasaabaze abasinga obungi nga bava mu Wuhan.
translated: Okusinziira ku mawulire agava mu kibiina ky’ensi yonna ekivunaanyizibwa ku by’entambula y’ennyonyi mu 2018, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, ne Taipei ze zaasinga okutambula okuva e Wuhan.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: Dubai, Sydney, ne Melbourne nabyo byayogerwako ng’ebifo ebyettanirwa nnyo abantu abava mu Wuhan.
translated: Dubai, Sydney, ne Melbourne nazo zaategeezeddwa nti ebifo abantu abava e Wuhan gye basinga okwettanira.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Bali kyayogerwako ng’ekisinga obutaba na busobozi mu bibuga ebituukirwamu ku ebyo 20 ebisinga okwettanirwa ng’otunuulidde okwetegeka, so ng’ate ebibuga mu Australia byayogerwako ng’ebirina obusobozi. Australia yafulumya enteekateeka yaayo ey’okulwanyisa Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) nga 7 Ogwokubiri.
translated: Bali yategeezeddwa nti etasobola mu bibuga 20 ebisinga okwettanirwa abantu okugenda mu bifo eby’okwetegekera, ate ebibuga mu Australia byatwalibwa ng’ebisinga okusobola.Australia yafulumya enteekateeka yaayo ey’okudduukirira mu bwangu ku kawuka ka Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) nga 7 February.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Kigambibwa nti bingi byali birina okuzuulibwa ku COVID-19, era nti Australia yali erina okutunuulira ennyo ensalo zaayo n’empuliziganya mu kulwanyisa nawookeera.
translated: Kyategeezezza nti bingi ebikyalina okuzuulibwa ku COVID-19, era nti Australia egenda kussa essira ku kufuga ensalo n’okuwuliziganya mu kwanukula ssenyiga omukambwe.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: Nga 21 Ogwokusatu, akaseera ak’obwerende kaalangirirwa mu Australia.
translated: Nga 21 March, embeera ey’amangu ey’obukuumi bw’abantu yalangirirwa mu Australia.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Olw’okuba nti enkola ya kalantiini ku ntambula y’olukale yakoze bulungi mu Wuhan ne Hubei, amawanga mangi gateeseteese okuggya abantu baago n’abakungu mu kitundu ekyo, era nga kino bakikola nga bakozesa ennyonyi empangise okuva mu ggwanga eryo erinona abantu baalyo nga bakkirizibwa aboobuyinza mu China.
translated: Olw’entambula ey’olukale okuteekebwa mu kalantiini ennungi mu kibuga Wuhan ne Hubei, amawanga agawerako gategese okusengula bannansi baago n’abakozi b’abakungu mu kitundu kino okusinga nga bayita mu nnyonyi ezipangisiddwa ez’eggwanga lino, ng’abakulira China bawadde olukusa.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: Canada, America, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, ne Thailand ge mawanga agaasooka okutegeka okuddukira abantu baago.
translated: Canada, Amerika, Japan, Buyindi, Sri Lanka, Australia, Bufalansa, Argentina, Girimaani, ne Thailand ze zimu ku zaasooka okuteekateeka okusengula bannansi baabwe.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: Pakistan yagamba nti tejja kuggya mutuuze waayo yenna mu China.
translated: Pakistan etegeezezza nga bwetagenda kusengula bannansi yenna okuva mu China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: Nga 7 Ogwokubiri, Brazil yaddukira abantu baayo 34 oba ab’omu maka agamu okwo nga kw’otadde n’aba Poland bana n’omutuuze wa India.
translated: Nga 7 February, Brazil yasengula Bannabrazil oba ab’omu maka gaabwe 34 ng’oggyeeko Abapolandi bana, Omuchina, ne munnansi Omuyindi.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Abatuuze b’omu Poland, China, ne India baaviirmu mu Poland, ennyonyi ya Brazil we yamiriramukko nga tennaba kweyongerayo kugenda Brazil.
translated: Bannansi ba Poland, China ne Buyindi baavudde ku nnyonyi mu Poland, ennyonyi ya Brazil gye yayimiridde nga tennagoberera kkubo lye yagenda e Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Bannansi ba Brazil abaagenda mu Wuhan baateekebwa mu kalantiini mu nkambi y’amagye okumpi ne Brasília.
translated: Bannansi ba Brazil abagenze e Wuhan basibiddwa mu kalantiini mu nkambi y’amagye okumpi ne Brasília.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Ku lunaku lwe lumu, Bannakanada 215 (176 okuva mu nnyonyi eyasooka, ne 39 okuva mu nnyonyi eyookubiri eyapangisibwa gavumenti ya America) baddukirwa okuva mu Wuhan ne babatwala e CFB Trenton bateekebwe mu kalantiini okumala wiiki bbiri.
translated: Ku lunaku lwe lumu, Bannacanada 215 (176 okuva mu nnyonyi eyasooka, ate 39 okuva mu nnyonyi eyookubiri eyapangisibwa gavumenti ya Amerika) baasengulwa okuva e Wuhan ne batwalibwa mu CFB Trenton okubeera mu kalantiini okumala wiiki bbiri.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Nga 11 Ogwokubiri, ennyonyi endala ng’erimu Abakanada 185 okuva mu Wuhan yatuuka e CFB Trenton.
translated: Nga 11 February, ennyonyi endala ey’Abacanada 185 okuva e Wuhan yatuuka ku CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: Aboobuyinza mu Australia baddukira bannansi baabwe 277 nga 3 ne 4 Ogwokubiri ne babatwala ku Christmas Island Detention Centre, kye baali bataddewo ng’ekifo kya kalantiini era nga baali balina okubeera eyo okumala ennaku 14.
translated: Ab’obuyinza mu Australia baasengula bannansi 277 nga 3 ne 4 February ne batwalibwa mu kifo ekikuumirwamu abantu ku kizinga kya Christmas, ekyali kizzeemu okukozesebwa nga kalantiini, gye baamala ennaku 14.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Ennyonyi ya New Zealand eyaddukira abantu baayo yatuuka mu in Auckland nga 5 Ogwokubiri; abasaabaze baayo (nga mulimu n’abamu okuva mu Australia ne Pacific) baateekebwa mu kalantiini mu Whangaparoa, mu bukiikakkono bwa Auckland.
translated: Ennyonyi ya New Zealand eyasengula abantu yatuuka mu kibuga Auckland nga 5 February; abasaabaze baayo (nga mw’otwalidde n’abamu okuva mu Australia ne Pacific) baateekebwa mu kalantiini mu nkambi y’amagye g’oku mazzi e Whangaparoa, mu bukiikakkono bwa Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Nga 15 Ogwokubiri, America yalangirira nti ejja kuddukira Abamerica nga batambulira ku lyato, Diamond Princess.
translated: Nga 15 February, Amerika yalangirira nti egenda kusengula Abamerika abaali ku mmeeri eyitibwa Diamond Princess.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Nga 21 Ogwokubiri, ennyonyi eyaliko abasaabaze ba Canada 129 abaali baddukiddwa okuva mu Diamond Princess baatuuka mu Trenton, Ontario.
translated: Nga 21 February, ennyonyi eyali etisse abasaabaze 129 okuva mu Diamond Princess yatuuka mu kibuga Trenton mu Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: Ku ntandika y’Ogwokusatu, gavumenti ya Indian yatandika okuddukira abantu baayo mu Iran. Nga 14 Ogwokusatu gavumenti ya South Africa, yapangisa ennyonyi ya South African Airways okuddukira abatuuze baayo 112.
translated: Ku ntandikwa ya March, gavumenti ya Buyindi yatandika okusengula bannansi baayo okuva mu Iran.Nga 14 March ennyonyi ya South African Airways eyapangisibwa Gavumenti ya South Africa yazzaayo bannansi ba South Afrika 112.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Okusunsula kw’ekisawo kwakolebwa ng’ennyonyi tennanasimbula era bannansi ba South Africa abaalabikirako obubonero bwa coronavirus baalekebwa emabega olw’okukendeeza ku bulabe.
translated: Okukeberebwa kw’abasawo kwakoleddwa nga tebannasimbula, era Bannayuganda bana ababadde balaga obubonero bwa coronavirus balekeddwa emabega okukendeeza ku bulabe.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Bannansi ba South Africa abataalina bulwadde be bazzibwayo ku butaka.
translated: Bannayuganda bokka abazuuliddwa nga tebalina kirwadde kino be bakomezeddwawo.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Ebyava mu kukebera byalaga nti bannansi ba South Africa bonna baali bulungi, omwo nga mwe muli abakozi bw’oku nnyonyi, abavuzi b’ennyonyi, abakozi b’omu wooteeri, abapoliisi n’abajaasi abeetaba mu kaweefube w’obuyambi, era nga bonna mu ngeri y’okwerinda, baasigala beetegerezebwa era nga bali mu kalantiini okumala ennaku 14 ku The Ranch Resort.
translated: Ebyavudde mu kukebera byagobye Bannayuganda bonna omuli abakozi b’ennyonyi, abavuzi b’ennyonyi, abakozi ba wooteeri, poliisi n’abajaasi abeenyigira mu mulimu gw’okuyamba abantu nga, ng’okwegendereza, bonna baasigadde nga batunuuliddwa era nga bali mu kalantiini okumala ennaku 14 ku The Ranch Resort .

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Nga 20 Ogwokusatu, America yatandika okuggya abajaasi baayo mu Iraq mu biwagu olw’obulwadde buno.
translated: Nga 20 March, Amerika yatandika okuggya amagye gaayo ekitundu mu Iraq olw’ekirwadde kya ssenyiga omukambwe.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Nga 5 Ogwokubiri, Minisitule ya China ey’ensonga z’ebweru yagamba nti amawanga 21 (omuli Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, ne Iran) gaali gabaweerezza obuyambi.
translated: Nga 5 February, minisitule ya China ey’ensonga z’ebweru yategeeza nti amawanga 21 (nga kuliko Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Misiri, ne Iran) gaali gasindikidde China obuyambi.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Abayizi abasibuka mu China nga basomera mu yunivaasite z’omu America beegatta wamu ne baweereza obuyambi mu bitundu by’omu China ebyakosebwa ennyo obulwadde, era nga waliwo ekibiina ekiri mu Chicago ekyaweereza obukookolo obw’ekika kya N95 obuwera 50,000 mu malwaliro g’omu Hubei nga on 30 Janwali. Ekitongole ekigabi ky’obuyambi (The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief) wamu ne FedEx, baaweereza obukookolo 200,000 wamu n’ebintu ebirala eby’okwesabika omuli giraavu ne gawuni ne bigendera ku nnyonyi ey’obuyambi obw’amangu mu Wuhan Union Hospital nga 30 Janwali.
translated: Abamu ku bayizi Abachina mu yunivasite z’omu Amerika beegasse okuyambako okusindika obuyambi mu bitundu bya China ebirimu akawuka, ng’ekibiina eky’awamu mu kitundu ekinene ekya Chicago kigambibwa nti kyasobodde okusindika masiki za N95 emitwalo 50 mu malwaliro mu ssaza ly’e Hubei nga 30 January.Ekibiina ekiyamba abantu Direct Relief, ng’ekwataganye ne FedEx, yasindika masiki 200,000 mu maaso wamu n’ebikozesebwa ebirala eby’okwekuuma omuli ggalavu ne gomesi, nga bayita mu nnyonyi ey’amangu okutwalibwa mu ddwaaliro lya Wuhan Union Hospital nga 30 January terunnatuuka.
