sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Awo nga 24 Janwali 2020 mu Canada, International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) ku University of Saskatchewan kyalangirira entandikwa y’omulimu gw’okuzuula eddagala erigema, nga bateebereza okutandika okugezesa mu bantu mu 2021.
translated: Nga 24 January 2020 mu Canada, ekitongole ky’ensi yonna ekigema (VIDO-InterVac) mu yunivasite y’e Saskatchewan kyalangirira okutandika okukola ku ddagala erigema, nga kigenderera okutandika okukebera abantu mu 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Pulojekiti y’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema kwalangirirwa ku Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention nga 26 Janwali 2020, ne University of Hong Kong nga 28 Janwali.
translated: Pulojekiti z’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema zalangirirwa mu kitongole kya China ekikola ku kulwanyisa endwadde nga 26 January 2020, ne mu yunivasite y’e Hong Kong nga 28 January.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Awo nga 29 Janwali 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, nga bakulemberwa Hanneke Schuitemaker, baalangirira nti baali batandise omulimu gw’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.
translated: Nga 29 January 2020, kkampuni ya Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, nga ekulemberwa Hanneke Schuitemaker, yalangirira nti yatandise okukola ku kukola eddagala erigema.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen ekolera wamu ne Vaxart okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema erimiribwa nga bakozea biotechnology.
translated: Janssen ekola wamu eddagala erigema eriweebwa mu kamwa ne munne mu by’obulamu, Vaxart.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Nga 18 Ogwokusatu 2020, Emergent BioSolutions kyalangirira okukola eddagala nga kikolera wamu ne Vaxart okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.
translated: Nga 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions yalangirira enkolagana mu by’amakolero ne Vaxart okukola eddagala lino.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Nga 8 Ogwokubiri 2020, eggezeserezo lya OncoGen mu Romania lyafulumya olupapula ku nkola y’eddagala erigema nga likozesa tekinologiya y’omu n’oyo ow’eryo erijjanjaba kookolo (cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy).
translated: Nga 8 February 2020, laboratory ya OncoGen mu Romania yafulumya olupapula ku dizayini y’eddagala erigema nga lirina tekinologiya afaananako n’oyo akozesebwa mu kugema kookolo neoantigen.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Nga 25 Ogwokusatu ssenkulu w’okunoonyereza mu kitongole ky’okunoonyereza yalangirira nti baali bamaliriza okwekaliriza eddagala erigema era nga bagenda kutandika okugezesa.
translated: Nga 25 March akulira ekitongole kino eky’okunoonyereza yalangirira nti bamalirizza okukola eddagala erigema era nga batandise okukebera.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Nga 27 Ogwokubiri 2020, kampuni ya Generex entono, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, yalangirira etandise pulojeki y’okutondawo Ii-Key peptide vaccine okulwanyisa COVID-19.
translated: Nga 27 February 2020, kampuni ya Generex eya NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, yalangirira nti batandise pulojekiti y’okugema okukola eddagala erigema COVID-19 erya Ii-Key peptide.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Baali baagala okukola eddagala erigema eriyinza okugezesebwa mu bantu "mu nnaku 90."
translated: Baagala okukola eddagala erigema eriyinza okukeberebwa mu bantu "mu nnaku 90."

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Nga 5 Ogwokusatu 2020, Washington University mu St. Louis yalangirira pulojekiti yaayo ey’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.
translated: Nga 5 March 2020, Washington University e St. Louis yalangirira pulojekiti zaayo ez’okukola eddagala erigema.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Nga 5 Ogwokusatu 2020, United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command e Fort Detrick ne Walter Reed Army Institute of Research mu Silver Spring, byonna nga biri mu Maryland ey’obugwanjuba, byalangirira nti bikola ku ddagala erigema.
translated: Nga 5 March 2020, ekitongole ky’amagye ga Amerika ekya Medical Research and Materiel Command e Fort Detrick n’ekitongole kya Walter Reed Army Institute of Research e Silver Spring, byombi mu maserengeta ga Maryland, baalangirira nti bakola ku ddagala erigema.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Awo nga 10 Ogwokusatu 2020, Emergent Biosolutions kyalangirira nti kyali kikoze omukago ne Novavax Inc.
translated: Nga 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions yalangiridde nti yakwataganye ne Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: mu kukulaakulanya n’okufulumya eddagala erigema.
translated: mu kukola n’okukola eddagala erigema.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Aboomukago era baalangirira enteekateeka z’okugeza ng’okunoonyereza kw’ekisawo tekunnaba n’Okunoonyereza kw’Omutendera I okutandika mu Gwomusanvu 2020.
translated: Abakolagana bano bongedde okulangirira enteekateeka z’okukeberebwa nga tebannaba kugezesebwa n’okugezesebwa mu bujjanjabi mu mutendera gwa Phase I we gunaatuukira mu July 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Nga 12 Ogwokusatu 2020, Ministule ya Indida ey’obulamu yalangirira bakola ne isolates 11, era nti ne bwe baba nga banguye nnyo kijja kutwala waakiri omwaka gumu n’ekitundu oba emyaka ebiri okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema.
translated: Nga 12 March 2020, minisitule y’ebyobulamu mu Buyindi yalangirira nti bakolagana n’abaana 11 abazuuliddwa, era nti ne ku luguudo olw’amangu kyanditwalidde waakiri emyaka nga gumu n’ekitundu okutuuka ku ebiri okukola eddagala erigema.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Nga 12 Ogwokusatu 2020, Medicago, kampuni eya biotechnology Quebec City, Quebec, yagamba nti ekulaakulanya coronavirus-like particle ng’esasulirwako ssente ntono okuva mu Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
translated: Nga 12 March 2020, kkampuni ya Medicago ekola ku by’obutonde mu kibuga Quebec mu Quebec, yategeeza nti waliwo akatundu akalinga akawuka ka coronavirus nga kayambibwako ekitundu okuva mu kitongole kya Canada ekikola ku kunoonyereza ku by’obulamu.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: Eddagala eriruubirirwa okugenda liri mu kugezesa kw’omu ggezeserezo mu kunoonyereza, ng’okuzesa mu bantu kutegekeddwa mu Gwomusanvu oba mu Gwomunaana 2020.
translated: Omuntu agenda okugema ali mu kunoonyereza mu laboratory, ng’okukeberebwa abantu kutegekeddwa mu July oba August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Mu nnaku ezaasooka mu wiiki eyo, The Guardian lwalangirira nti Pulezidenti wa Amerika Donald Trump yali awadde CureVac "'ssente eziwera' okukola okunoonyereza okw’enjawulo ku ddagala erigema Covid-19", ekintu kino gavumenti ya Bugirimaanyi yakiwakanya.
translated: Ku ntandikwa ya wiiki eyo, The Guardian yategeeza nti Pulezidenti wa Amerika Donald Trump yali awadde CureVac "'ensimbi ennyingi' okusobola okufuna eddagala erigema Covid-19 bokka", gavumenti ya Girimaani kye yeekalakaasa.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Nga 17 Ogwokusatu 2020, kampuni ya America enkozi y’eddagala Pfizer yalangirira omukago ne kampuni ya Bugirimaanni BioNTech okukolera awamu okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema eryesigamiziddwa ku mRNA.
translated: Nga 17 March 2020, kkampuni y’Amerika ekola eddagala eya Pfizer yalangirira enkolagana ne kkampuni ya Girimaani eya BioNTech okukola awamu eddagala erigema erikozesa mRNA.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: eddagala erigema eryesigamiziddwa ku mRNA eriruubirirwa BNT162, era nga kati liri mu kugezesa ng’okwekisawo tekunnaba era okugeza kusuubira okutandika mu Gwokuna 2020.
translated: MRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, mu kiseera kino eri mu kukeberebwa nga tekunnabaawo ng’okugezesebwa mu malwaliro kusuubirwa okutandika mu April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: Mu Italy nhs 17 Ogwokusatu 2020, Takis Biotech, kampuni ya Italian eya biotech yalangirira nti ejja kubeera n’okunooyereza okusooka ng’okwekisawo tekunnaba mu Gwokuna 2020 era eddagala lyabwe erigema eriruubirirwa liyinza okutandika okugezesebwa mu bantu mu Gwomwenda.
translated: Mu Italy nga 17 March 2020, kkampuni ya Takis Biotech eya Yitale ekola ku by’obutonde yalangiridde nti bagenda kuba n’ebyava mu kukeberebwa nga tebannaba kugema mu April wa 2020 era omuntu waabwe asembayo okugema ayinza okutandika okukeberebwa abantu mu ggwanika.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: Mu Bufransa nga 19 March 2020, Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) kyalangirira nti kyali kitadde obukadde US$4.9 mukago gw’okunoonyereza ku ddagala erigema COVID-19 omuli Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), ne University of Pittsburgh, ne kiteeka omugatte gwa CEPI's mu kunoonyereza ku ddagala erigema COVID-19 ku bukadde US$29.
translated: Mu Bufalansa nga 19 March 2020, ekibiina ekigatta abayiiya okwetegekera ssennyiga omukambwe ekya Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) kyalangirira okussa ssente obukadde bwa doola za Amerika buna n’obukadde 900 mu kibiina ekinoonyereza ku kugema ekirwadde kya COVID-19 nga kyetabiddwamu aba Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), ne University of Pittsburgh, nga baleeta Omugatte gwa CEPI okussa ssente mu kukola eddagala erigema COVID-19 gutuuse ku bukadde bwa doola za Amerika 29.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: Awalala CEPI w’atadde ssente z’okukulaakulanya eddagala erigema COVID-19 mwe muli Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, University of Hong Kong, University of Oxford, ne University of Queensland.
translated: Abalala CEPI be bakolagana nabo okussa ssente mu kukola eddagala erigema COVID-19 kuliko Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, Yunivasite y’e Hong Kong, Yunivasite y’e Oxford, ne Yunivasite y’e Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: Nga 20 Ogwookusatu 2020, abakungu b’ebyobulamu mu Russia baalangirira nti bannassaayansi batandise okugezesa ensolo nga bakozesa eddagala erigema eriruubirirwa lya mirundi etaanu.
translated: Nga 20 March 2020, ab’ebyobulamu mu Russia baalangirira nti bannassaayansi batandise okugezesa ebisolo ku bantu mukaaga ab’enjawulo abagenda okugema.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Abanoonyereza mu Imperial College London baalangirira nti nga 20 Ogwokusatu 2020 nti bali mu kaweefube ku kukulaakulanya vaccine ekolera ku self-amplifying RNA okugema COVID-19.
translated: Abanoonyereza ku Imperial College London baalangirira nga 20 March 2020 nga bwebakola eddagala erigema COVID-19 erya RNA eryeyongera amaanyi.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: Eddagala erigema eriruubirirwa lyakulaakulanyhizibwa mu nnaku 14 nga bafunye ebirabirwako okuva mu China.
translated: Ekirungo kino eky’okugema kyakolebwa mu nnaku 14 nga bamaze okufuna omutendera guno okuva e China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu nga guggwaako, gavumenti ya Canada yalangigira nti etaddewo miliyoni C$275 okusakirira okunoonyereza kwa pulojekiti 96 ku kunoonyereza ku COVID-19, omwo nga mwe muli eddagala eriruubirirwa okugema ery’enjawulo mu makampuni ne yunivaasite, gamba nga Medicago ne University of Saskatchewan.
translated: Ku nkomerero ya March, gavumenti ya Canada yalangirira ensimbi obukadde bwa doola za Canada 275 ez’okukola pulojekiti 96 ez’okunoonyereza ku ngeri y’obusawo okulwanyisa ekirwadde kya COVID-19, nga muno mwe muli n’abagenda okugema abangi mu kkampuni ne yunivasite za Canada, gamba ng’enteekateeka za Medicago ne University of Saskatchewan.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Mu kiseera kye kimu, gavumenti ya Canada yalangirira miliyoni C$192 nga za kukola ddagala erigema COVID-19, n’ekigendererwa ky’okuteekawo “etterekero ly’eddagala erigema” ery’enjawulo erisobola okukozesebwa singa wabalukawo akawuka ka coronavirus akalala.
translated: Mu kiseera kye kimu, gavumenti ya Canada yalangiridde obukadde bwa doola za Canada 192 naddala okukola eddagala erigema ekirwadde kya COVID-19, ng'erina enteekateeka z'okutandikawo "bbanka y'okugema" ey'eggwanga ey'okugema okupya okuwerako okuyinza okukozesebwa singa wabaawo ekirwadde kya coronavirus ekirala.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: Nga 2 Ogwokuna 2020, abanoonyereza ku Yunivaasite ya Pittsburgh School of Medicine baafulumya alipoota ku kugezesa PittCoVacc, eddagala erisobola okugema COVID-19 mu mmese, nga bagamba nti "MNA yafulumya ekitundu ky’eddagala erigema erya SARS-CoV-2 S1 okuva mu butaffaali obulwanyisa endwadde obw’amaanyi [obuli mu mmese] obwalabika okutandikira ku wiiki 2 oluvannyuma lw’okugema.”
translated: Nga 2 April 2020, abanoonyereza mu University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine baategeeza ku kukebera PittCoVacc, eddagala eriyinza okugema COVID-19 mu mbeba, nga bagamba nti "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [ mu mbeba] ezaali zeeyoleka okutandika ne wiiki 2 oluvannyuma lw’okugema."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: Mu Canada nga 16 Ogwokuna 2020, Yunivaasite ya Waterloo School of Pharmacy yalangirira eddagala erigema ery’esigamiziddwa ku DNA; baagamba nti liyinza okukozesebwa nga lifuuyirwa mu nnyindo.
translated: Mu Canada nga 16 April 2020, essomero ly’eddagala erya University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy lyalangirira enteekateeka y’okugema okukozesebwa DNA ng’ekiyinza okufuuyira ennyindo.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Nga beeyambisa bacteriophages, DNA ejja kuzimbibwa nga yeefaananyiriza obuwuka obuli mu mubiri gw’omuntu okuzaala obuntu obulinga obuwuka naye nga si bwa bulabe, obuyinza okusisimula obutaffaali bw’omubiri obulwanyisa endwadde okusobola okuzaala abasirikale b’omubiri okulwanyisa akawuka ka SARS-CoV-2 virus.
translated: Nga bakozesa bacteriophages, DNA egenda kukolebwa okukoppa munda mu bacteria y’omuntu okukola obutundutundu obutali bwa bulabe obulinga akawuka, obuyinza okusitula abaserikale b’omubiri okukola obutoffaali obuziyiza akawuka ka SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu 2020, gavumenti ya US, amakolero, ne yunivaasite ssatu baasonda ebikozesebwa okufuna kompyuta kalaso okuva mu IBM, gattako cloud ebintu bya kompyuta ebya cloud okuva mu Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, ne Google.
translated: Mu March 2020, gavumenti ya Amerika, amakolero, ne yunivasite ssatu zaakuŋŋaanya eby’obugagga okusobola okufuna kompyuta ennene okuva mu IBM, nga zigatta wamu n’ebikozesebwa mu kompyuta ez’ebire okuva mu Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, ne Google.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Eddagala erimu erigema lilina ebirivaamu eby’enjawulo, era ebimanyiddwa nga ebivaamu ebitamanyiddwa bulungi.
translated: Eddagala erimu erigema lirina ebikolwa eby’enjawulo, era ebiyitibwa ebikolwa ebitali bitongole.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Ekyo kitegeeza lisobola okuba n’ebirungi ebisinga ku kutangira obutangizi endwadde.
translated: Ekyo kitegeeza nti basobola okuba n’emigaso egisukka ku bulwadde bwe baziyiza.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Okugezesa okulala okwembagirawo mu Australia kwagala okuwandiisa abajjanjabi 4,170.
translated: Okugezesebwa okulala okukoleddwa mu ngeri ey’ekifuulannenge mu Australia kunoonya okuwandiisa abakozi b’ebyobulamu 4,170.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: Kisoboka nti eddagala erigema erikolebwa kati teriireme kubaamu bulabe oba terijja kukola.
translated: Kisoboka okugema mu nkulaakulana tekujja kuba kwa bukuumi oba kukola bulungi.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwasooka okukolebwa okwekenneenya obutuufu bw’eddagala erigema erikozesa ebisolo ebirondemu ebirimu COVID-19, okugeza emmese za ACE2-engattirire, ebisolo ebirala eby’omu ggezeserezo, n’ebisolo ebirala, bulaga obwetaavu bw’enkola ez’okutangira biosafety-level 3 ey’okukola ku buwuka obulamu, n’okukolagana ku ddaala ly’ensi yonna okulaba nti ebikolebwa tebiriimu bulabe.
translated: Okunoonyereza okwasooka okwekenneenya obulungi bw’okugema nga tukozesa ebikozesebwa mu bisolo ebikwata ku COVID-19, gamba ng’ebibe ebikyusiddwa ACE2, ebisolo ebirala ebya laboratory, n’ebisolo ebitali bantu, kulaga obwetaavu bw’ebipimo by’okuziyiza ebiramu ku ddaala lya 3 ery’obukuumi bw’ebiramu okukwata akawuka obulamu, n’okukwasaganya ensi yonna okulaba ng’enkola z’obukuumi zituukagana n’omutindo.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS zigezeseddwa ku bisolo ebitali bantu.
translated: Eddagala erigema SARS ne MERS ligezeseddwa mu bikolwa by’ebisolo ebitali bya bantu.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: Omwaka 2020 we gutuukidde, nga tewali ddagala liwonya oba kugema SARS erisangiddwa nga teririna buzibu ate nga likola bulungi mu bantu.
translated: We bwazibidde mu mwaka gwa 2020, tewali ddagala liwonya oba likuuma ddagala lya SARS eriraze nti teririna bulabe ate nga likola bulungi mu bantu.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: Okusinziira ku mpapula z’okunoonyereza ezafulumizibwa mu 2005 ne 2006, okuyiiya n’okukulaakulanya eddagala eppya erigema n’okujjanjaba ebirwadde bya SARS kyali kya nkizo eri gavumenti n’ebitongole by’eby’obulamu okwetoloola ensi yonna. Naye era tewali ddagala ligema likakasiddwa kugema MERS.
translated: Okusinziira ku mpapula z’okunoonyereza ezaafulumizibwa mu 2005 ne 2006, okuzuula n’okukola eddagala erigema n’eddagala eripya erijjanjaba SARS kyali kikulu nnyo gavumenti n’ebitongole by’ebyobulamu okwetoloola ensi yonna.Era tewali ddagala ligema MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: MERS bwe yatandika okulabika ennyo, kyalowoozebwa nti okunoonyereza okuliwo ku SARS kuyinza okuwa amagezi ag’omugaso ageesigamizibwako okukola eddagala erigema n’okujjanjaba obulwadde bwa MERS-CoV.
translated: MERS bwe yafuuka eya bulijjo, kyalowoozebwa nti okunoonyereza okwaliwo ku SARS kuyinza okuwa ekifaananyi eky’omugaso eky’okukola eddagala erigema n’eddagala eriziyiza obulwadde bwa MERS-CoV.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: We twatuukira mu Gwokusatu 2020, waaliwo eddagala erigema (eryesigamiziddwa ku DNA) lya mulundi gumu lyokka eryali limaze okuyita ku mutendera I ogw’okugezesebwa okw’ekisawo mu bantu, n’eddala lya mirundi esatu eryali likyakolebwako, nga lyonna wamu  limanyiddwa nga viral-vectored vaccines, nga bbiri za adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), ate emu MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
translated: We bwazibidde mu March 2020, waaliwo eddagala limu ( eryesigamiziddwa ku DNA) erya MERS eryamaliriza okugezesebwa mu bujjanjabi erya phase I mu bantu, n’endala ssatu ezigenda mu maaso, nga zonna zigema ezikozesebwa akawuka, bbiri ezigema akawuka ka adenoviral (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac ), n’ekimu ekya MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Waliwo olugambo oluyitiŋŋana ku mikutu emikwanirawala mbu akawuka akalwaza COVID-19 kaali kamaanyibwa dda era nti eddagala erikagema lyakolebwa dda.
translated: Ebiwandiiko ku mikutu gya yintaneeti bitumbula endowooza y’olukwe nga bagamba nti akawuka akali emabega wa COVID-19 kaali kamanyiddwa era nga n’eddagala erigema lyaliwo dda.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: Obuvumbuzi obwogerwako emikutu emikwanirawala egy’enjawulo bujuliza obuvumbuzi obuliwo ku nkulaakulanya y’eddagala erijjanjaba n’erigema obulwdde obulala obuleetebwa akawuka ka coronavirus gamba nga SARS coronavirus.
translated: Patents ezijuliziddwa ebiwandiiko eby’enjawulo ku mikutu gya yintaneeti zijuliza patent eziriwo ez’ensengeka z’obuzaale n’okugema ebika bya coronavirus ebirala nga SARS coronavirus.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Obukwadde bwa b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) bulwadde obusiigibwa obuleetebwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
translated: b'Obulwadde bwa Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) bulwadde obusiigibwa obuva ku bulwadde bwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Mu bubonero obusinga okulabika mulimu omusujja, okukolola, n’okubaka omukka.
translated: Obubonero obutera okulabika mulimu omusujja, okusesema n’okussa obubi.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Obubonero obulala mulimu kimenyoomenyo, obulumi mu binywa, embiro, amabwa mu mimiro, okulemererwa okuwunyiriza, n’okulumizibwa mu lubuto.
translated: Obubonero obulala buyinza okuli okukoowa, okulumwa ebinywa, ekiddukano, okulumwa emimiro, obutawunya, n’okulumwa olubuto.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Ebbanga okuva lwe bukwata omuntu okutuuka ku kiseera w’alabikirako obubonero litera kubeera awo mu nnaku ttaanu naye nga ziyinza okukyuka ne ziba wakati w’ennaku bbiri n’ekkumi na nnya.
translated: Obudde okuva ku kukwatibwa okutuuka ku kutandika kw’obubonero butera kuba bwa nnaku ttaano naye buyinza okuva ku nnaku bbiri okutuuka ku kkumi n’ennya.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Weewaawo abalwadde abasinga beeyolekerako obubonero obutali bwa maanyi abamu bafuniramu ddala lubyamira n’ebitundu by’omubiriebimu ne biremererwa.
translated: Wadde ng’emisango egisinga givaamu obubonero obutono, abamu bagenda mu maaso ne bafuna ekifuba ekiva ku kawuka n’okulemererwa kw’ebitundu by’omubiri ebingi.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: Olwa 17 Ogwokuna 2020 we lwatuukira, abalwadde abasukka mu bukadde 2.24 be bategeerekese mu mawanga n’ebitundu 210 era nga mu bo 153,000 bafudde.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 17 April 2020, abantu abasoba mu bukadde 2.24 be baakakwatibwa mu mawanga n’ebitundu 210, ekivuddeko abantu abasoba mu 153,000 okufa.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Abantu abasukka 568,000 bawonye. Okusinga ennyo akawuka kasaasaanira mu bantu abasembereganye ennyo, naddala nga buyitira mu luzzizzi olujja omuntu ng’akolodde, ng’akubye omwasi, oba mu kwogera.
translated: Abantu abasoba mu 568,000 be bawonye.Akawuka kano okusinga kasaasaana wakati w’abantu nga bakwatagana nnyo, emirundi mingi nga bayita mu butondo obutono obuva mu kusesema, okusesema oba okwogera.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Weewaawo oluzzizzi lufuluma omuntu ng’assizza omukka, lutera okugwa ku ttaka oba ku bintu, so tebukwata bantu beesudde bbanga ddene.
translated: Wadde ng’amatondo gano gakolebwa nga ossa, gatera okugwa wansi oba ku bintu okusinga okusiigibwa mu bbanga eddene.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Abantu era basobola okukatibwa obulwadde nga bakutte ku kifo ekiriko obuwuka ate olwo ne beekwata mu maaso, mu nnyindo, oba ku mimwa.
translated: Abantu bayinza n’okukwatibwa obulwadde buno nga bakwata ku kifo ekirimu obucaafu n’oluvannyuma ne bakwata ku maaso, ennyindo oba akamwa.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: Akawuka kasobola okubeera ku kintu okumala essaawa 72.
translated: Akawuka kano kasobola okuwangaala ku bintu ebiri kungulu okutuuka ku ssaawa 72.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: Kasinga kusiigibwa mu nnaku ezisooka essatu oluvannyuma lw’okulabika kw’obubonero, wadde ng’okusiigibwa kusoboka okubaawo ng’obubonero tebunneeyoleka ne ku mitendera gy’obulwadde egy’oluvannyuma. Akakodyo akasinga okukozesebwa okubukera ke ka real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) nga baggya oluzzizzi mu mussizo.
translated: Kisinga kusiigibwa mu nnaku ssatu ezisooka oluvannyuma lw’obubonero okutandika, wadde ng’okusaasaana kuyinza okusoboka nga obubonero tebunnalabika ne mu mitendera egy’oluvannyuma egy’obulwadde.Enkola eya bulijjo ey’okuzuula obulwadde buno eri mu kiseera ekituufu eky’okudda emabega (reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction) (rRT-PCR). ) okuva mu ddagala eriyitibwa nasopharyngeal swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: Kisembebwa okukozesa obukookolo ku abo abateebereza nti balina akawuka wamu n’abo ababalabirira.
translated: Okukozesa masiki kirungi eri abo abateebereza nti balina akawuka kano n’abalabirira.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Ebisembebwa mu kukozesa obukookolo mu bantu bonna, ate ng’aboobuyinza abamu babugaana, abamu basemba okubukozesa ate abalala nga bataddewo ekiragiro okubukozesa.
translated: Ebiteeso abantu bonna bye bateesa ku kukozesa masiki byawukana, ng’abamu ku boobuyinza bagamba nti tebalina kubikozesa, abamu ne bateesa ku kuzikozesa ate abalala nga kyetaagisa okuzikozesa.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Mu kiseera kino, tewali ddagala ligema oba erikkakkanya ku COVID-19.
translated: Mu kiseera kino, tewali ddagala lya kugema oba ddagala eriziyiza akawuka ka COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: Okusaasaana kw’obulwadde munda mu mawanga kulabiddwa mu mawanga mangi ag’enjawulo mu bitundu bya WHO omukaaga.
translated: Okusaasaana kw’obulwadde buno mu bitundu kubadde kuwandiikiddwa mu mawanga agasinga mu bitundu byonna omukaaga eby’ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu eky’ensi yonna.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Abo abakwatiddwa obulwadde bayinza obuteeyolekerako bubonero oba obutafuna bubonero bwekwanya ku ssenyiga nga omusujja, okukolola, ekimenyoomenyo, n’okukaluubirirwa okussa.
translated: Abakwatibwa akawuka kano bayinza obutaba na bubonero oba okufuna obubonero obulinga obwa ssennyiga ng’omusujja, okusesema, obukoowu, n’okussa obubi.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Mu bubonero obw’amangu mulimu okukaluubirirwa mu kussa, okulumizibwa mu kifuba okutatadde oba okunyigirizibwa, okutabukatabuka, okukalemererwa okutambula n’okumyukirira mu maaso oba mu ku mimwa; kyamagezi okufuna obujjanjabi obw’amangu obubonero obwo bwe bugaana okugenda.
translated: Obubonero obw’amangu mulimu okukaluubirirwa okussa, okulumwa oba okunyigirizibwa mu kifuba obutasalako, okutabulwa, okukaluubirirwa okuzuukuka, n’okufuuka bbululu mu maaso oba emimwa; kirungi okugenda mu malwaliro mu bwangu singa obubonero buno bubaawo.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Obubonero obutatera kulabika mulimu, upper obubonero bw’omussizo ogwawaggulu gamba ng’okukuba emyasi, eminyira egikulukuta oba amabwa mu nnyindo.
translated: Tekitera kubaawo, obubonero bw’okussa okwa waggulu ng’okusesema, okukulukuta kw’ennyindo oba okulumwa emimiro buyinza okulabibwa.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Obubonero obwekwanya n’omuyungiro gw’olubuto (Gastrointestinal symptoms) gamba nga such as okusinduukirirwa emmeeme, okusesema n’embiro bulabiddwa mu bigero eby’enjawulo.
translated: Obubonero bw’omu lubuto ng’okuziyira, okusiiyibwa n’ekiddukano bulabibwa mu bitundu eby’enjawulo.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Mu kusooka, abalwadde abamu mu China basooka kuwulira kuzitoowererwa mu kifuba n’entunnunsi okukubira okumukumu.
translated: Emisango egimu mu China mu kusooka gyalabika ng’ekifuba kinywezeddwa n’okukuba omukka gwokka.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: Mu bantu abamu, obulwadde busobola okweyongera okukula ne buvaamu lubyamira, ebitundu by’eomubiri ebiwera okulemererwa okukola, n’okufa.
translated: Mu bamu, obulwadde buno buyinza okukula ne bufuuka ekifuba, ebitundu by’omubiri ebingi okulemererwa, n’okufa.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Kino kiyitibwa ekiseera ky’okuzaalukana.
translated: Kino kiyitibwa ekiseera ky’okufumbiza.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: Ekiseera ky’okuzaalukana ekya COVID-19 kiri awo wakati w’ennaku ttaanu n’omukaaga naye nga kisobola okusingawo ne kiba wakati w’ennaku bbiri ne 14.
translated: Ekiseera ky’okufumbiza ekirwadde kya COVID-19 kitera kuba kya nnaku ttaano ku mukaaga kyokka kiyinza okuva ku nnaku bbiri okutuuka ku 14.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: Abantu ebitundu 97.5% abafuna obubonero, babufuna mu nnaku 11.5 nga bamaze okukwatibwa obulwadde. Alipoota ziraga nti si buli akwatibwa obulwadde nti yeeyolekerako obubonero.
translated: Abantu 97.5% abafuna obubonero bajja kukikola mu nnaku 11.5 nga bafunye obulwadde.Alipoota ziraga nti si bonna abalina obulwadde buno nti bafuna obubonero.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: Omulimu gw’abo abatalabikirako bubonero mu kusaasaanya obulwadde tegunnaba kumanyika mu bujjuvu; wabula, obubaka obusookerwao bulaga nti basobola okusaasaanya obulwadde.
translated: Omulimu gw’abasitula bano abatalina bubonero mu kusaasaana tegunnamanyika mu bujjuvu; wabula obujulizi obusookerwako bulaga nti ziyinza okuyamba obulwadde buno okusaasaana.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: Ekitungu ky’abantu abalwadde abateeyolekerako bubonero tegumanyiddwa mu kiseera kino era bakyanoonyerezebwako, era ng’Ekitongole kya Korea ekiyitibwa Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) kyategeeza nti abalwadde abakakasiddwa ebitundu 20% baali tebeeyolekerako bubonero mu kiseera we baabeerera mu ddwaliro.
translated: Ekitundu ky’abantu abakwatibwa obulwadde buno abatalaga bubonero mu kiseera kino tekimanyiddwa era nga kinoonyezebwa, ng’ekitongole kya Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) kyategeezezza nti ebitundu 20% ku bantu bonna abakakasiddwa baasigala nga tebalina bubonero mu kiseera we baamala mu ddwaaliro.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: Ekitongole kya China ekya National Health Commission kyatandika okubala abalwadde abateeyolekerako bubonero mu balwadde ba buli lunaku nga 1 Ogwokuna; ku balwadde 166 ab’olunaku olwo, abalwadde 130 (78%) tebeeyolekerako bubonero mu kiseera we baabakeberera.
translated: Akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu China kaatandika okussaamu abalwadde abatalina bubonero mu balwadde baako aba buli lunaku nga 1 April; ku 166 ezaakwatibwa ku lunaku olwo, 130 (78%) tebaalina bubonero mu kiseera we baakeberebwa.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: Ebikolondolwa n’amalusu bisobola okubeeramu obuwuka obuwerera ddala.
translated: Amalusu n’amalusu byombi bisobola okutwala akawuka akanene.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Okwogerera waggulu kuleetera omuntu okuvaamu oluzzizzi okusinga okwogera okwabulijjo.
translated: Okwogera mu ddoboozi ery’omwanguka kifulumya amatondo mangi okusinga okwogera okwa bulijjo.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Okunoonyereza mu Singapore kwazuula nti omuntu bw’akolola nga tabisse ku mimwa kumuleetera okuvaamu oluzzizzi olusammukira mu bbanga lya mmita 4.5 (fuuti 15).
translated: Okunoonyereza okwakoleddwa mu Singapore kwazudde nti okusesema nga tobikkiddwa kiyinza okuvaako amatondo okutambula okutuuka ku mmita 4.5 (fuuti 15).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Wadde ng’akutwaliza awamu akawuka tekasaasaanira mu mpewo, ekitongole kya National Academy of Science kigamba nti okusaasaana kw’omu mpewo okuyitibwa (bioaerosol transmission) kuyinza okusoboka era obuntu obukwata empewo obwateekebwa ebweru w’amanyumba g’abantu bwavaako sampolo eziraga nti zaalimu RNA.
translated: Wadde okutwalira awamu akawuka kano tekayita mu mpewo, ekitongole kya National Academy of Science kitegeezezza nti okutambuza omukka gwa bioaerosol kuyinza okusoboka era ebikung’aanya empewo ebyassibwa mu kkubo ebweru w’ebisenge by’abantu byavaamu sampuli eziraga nti zirina RNA y’akawuka.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Emitendera gy’eddagala egimu gamba nga intubation ne cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) giyinza okubaamu obuntu obuva mu missizo obusaasaanyizibwa mu pewo bwe butyo ne buvaamu endwadde ezisaasaanyirizibwa mu mpewo.
translated: Enkola ezimu ez’obujjanjabi nga okussa mu mpewo n’okuzuukusa omutima n’amawuggwe (CPR) ziyinza okuvaako ebifulumizibwa mu kussa okufuuka omukka era bwe kityo ne kivaamu okusaasaana mu mpewo.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: Weewaawo waliwo okutya nti obulwadde buyinza okusaasaana nga buyitira mu bubi, obulabe bwa kino bulowoozebwa okuba obutono. Akawuka kasinga kukwata ng’abalwadde beeyolekerako obubonero; wadde ng’okusiiga kusoboa ng’obubonero tebuneeyoleka, obulabe bwa kino butono.
translated: Wadde waliwo okweraliikirira nti eyinza okusaasaana ng’eyita mu musulo, akabi kano kirowoozebwa nti katono.Akawuka kasinga kusiigibwa ng’abantu balina obubonero; wadde ng’okusaasaana kuyinza okusoboka ng’obubonero tebunnavaayo, akabi katono.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Ekitongol kya Bulaaya ekirwanyisa endwadde ekiyitibwa European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) kigamba nti wadde nga tekitangala bulungi ku bwangu endwadde kw’esaasaanira, okutwaliza awamu, omuntu omu asiiga abantu babiri oba basatu abalala. Akawuka kamala ebbanga eriri wakati w’essaawa n’ennaku nga kali kungulu ku bintu.
translated: Ekitongole kya European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) kigamba nti wadde tekinnategeerekeka bulungi ngeri obulwadde buno gye busaasaana amangu, okutwalira awamu omuntu omu asiiga abalala babiri ku basatu.Akawuka kawangaala okumala essaawa okutuuka ku nnaku ku bintu ebiri kungulu.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: Okusinga ennyo, akawuka kalabiddwa nga kasobola okukengebwa nga kamaze olunaku lumu ku kabada, n’ennaku ssatu ku pulasitiika (polypropylene) ne ku bintu ebitatalagga (AISI 304), ate n’okumala essaawa nnya ku bintu ebirimu kkopa aweza ebitundu 99%.
translated: Okusingira ddala, akawuka kano kazuulibwa nga kazuulibwa okumala olunaku lumu ku bbaasa, okumala ennaku ssatu ku buveera (polypropylene) n’ekyuma ekitali kizimbulukuse (AISI 304), n’okumala essaawa nnya ku kikomo 99%.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Wabula, ebbanga lino lyawuka okusinziira ku luzzi oluli mu bbanga n’ebbugumu.
translated: Kyokka kino kyawukana okusinziira ku bunnyogovu n’ebbugumu.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: Ssabbuuni n’ebirungo ebirongoosa (detergent) nabyo bikola bulungi bwe bikozesebwa obulungi; ebintu ebirimu ssabbuuni bitta olususu lw’akawuka olukakuuma, bikamalamu amaanyi era bikaggyako olukuta lwonna n’okubugoba ku bintu ebirala.
translated: Sabbuuni n’eky’okunaaba nabyo bikola bulungi singa bikozesebwa mu butuufu; ebintu ebikolebwa mu ssabbuuni bwonoona amasavu agakuuma akawuka kano, ne kagaziyiza, wamu n’okukasumulula okuva ku lususu n’ebintu ebirala.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Ebintu ebirala ebiyiika nga benzalkonium chloride ne chlorhexidine gluconate (ekirungo ekitta obuwuka ekikozesebwa mu kulongoosa abantu), tebikola bulungi. Mu kunoonyereza okwakolebwa mu Hong Kong, sampolo z’amalusu zaggyibwa ku bantu mu kigero ky’ennaku nga bbiri nga bamaze okuweebwa ebitanda.
translated: Ebizigo ebirala, nga benzalkonium chloride ne chlorhexidine gluconate (eddagala eritta obuwuka erilongoosebwa), tebikola nnyo.Mu kunoonyereza okwakolebwa e Hong Kong, sampuli z’amalusu zakwatibwa wakati wa nnaku bbiri oluvannyuma lw’okutandika okuweebwa ekitanda mu ddwaaliro.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: Ku balwadde abantu ku mukaaga, sampolo eyasooka yalaga nti erimu obuwuka bungi ate omulwadde owoomukaaga yalabika ng’alina obuwuka bungi ku lunaku olwokubiri lwe yakeberwa.
translated: Mu balwadde bataano ku mukaaga, sampuli esooka yalaga akawuka akasinga obungi, ate omulwadde ow’omukaaga yalaga akawuka akasinga obungi ku lunaku olwokubiri lwe yakeberebwa.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Akawka ka Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) kawuka ka akakosa omussizo akayitibwa novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, akaasooka okulabibwa mu bantu basatu abaalina lubyamira nga yeekwanya ku bulwadde obw’amaanyi obukosa omussizo obwalabibwa mu balwadde mu Wuhan.
translated: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) ye novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, eyasooka okwawulwa ku bantu basatu abalina ekifuba ekikwatagana n’ekibinja ky’abalwadde b’endwadde z’okussa ez’amaanyi mu kibuga Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: Obubonero bwonna obwa novel SARS-CoV-2 virus bujjawo mu buwuka bwonna obwekwanya ne coronaviruses mu kikula.
translated: Ebintu byonna ebikwata ku kawuka ka SARS-CoV-2 akapya bibaawo mu coronavirus ezikwatagana mu butonde.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Akawuka ako bwe kabeera ebweru w’omubiri gw’omuntu gaka nga kakwataganye ssabbuuni, ssabbuuni abalusa olwovuyovu lw’akawuka olukabeera ebweru. SARS-CoV-2 kakwatagana bulungi n’akawuka ka SARS-CoV akaasooka.
translated: Ebweru w’omubiri gw’omuntu, akawuka kattibwa ssabbuuni ow’omu maka, n’akutuka ekiwujjo kyako eky’obukuumi.SARS-CoV-2 ekwatagana nnyo ne SARS-CoV eyasooka.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: Amawuggwe ge gasinga okukosebwa COVID-19 kubanga akawuka kayingira mu butaffaali nga kayitira mu enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), akasinga okulabikira mu type II alveolar cells mu mawuggwe.
translated: Amawuggwe bye bitundu ebisinga okukosebwa COVID-19 kubanga akawuka kano kayingira mu butoffaali obukyaza nga kayita mu enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), esinga okubeera mu butoffaali bw’amawuggwe obw’ekika kya II alveolar cells.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: Akawuka kakozesa olususu olw’enjawulo olwa glycoprotein oluyitibwa "eriggwa" (peplomer) okweyunga ku ACE2 ne kayingir amu kataffaali kwe keekwata.
translated: Akawuka kakozesa glycoprotein ey’enjawulo ey’okungulu eyitibwa "spike" (peplomer) okuyungibwa ku ACE2 ne kayingira mu katoffaali akakyaza.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: Okukosebwa kw’omutima okw’amaanyi kwasangibwa mu balwadde ebitundu 12% abaaweebwa ebitanda mu Wuhan, China, era kalabika nnyo mu ndwadde ez’amaanyi.
translated: Obuvune bw’omutima obw’amaanyi bwasangibwa mu bantu 12% abalina obulwadde buno abaweebwa ebitanda mu ddwaaliro e Wuhan mu China, era businga kubeera mu bulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: Ekigero ky’obubonero obwekwanya ku mutima n’emisiwa (cardiovascular symptoms) kiri waggulu, nga kiva ku systemic inflammatory response n’obuzibu mu muyungiro gw’obusibage mu kiseera ky’okweyongera kw’obulwadde, naye acute myocardial injury buyinza nabwo okuba nga bwekwanya ku ACE2 receptors mu mutima.
translated: Emiwendo gy’obubonero bw’emisuwa gy’omutima giri waggulu, olw’okuddamu kw’okuzimba kw’enkola n’obuzibu bw’abaserikale b’omubiri mu kiseera ky’okukula kw’obulwadde, naye obuvune obw’amaanyi mu misuwa gy’omutima nakyo kiyinza okuba nga kyekuusa ku bikwata ACE2 mu mutima.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: ACE2 receptors zirabikira nnyo mu mutima era zeetaba mu nkola y’omutima.
translated: Ebikwata ACE2 byeyoleka nnyo mu mutima era byenyigira mu nkola y’omutima.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: ekizibu ky’okwekwata kw’omusaayi (31%) n’okuzibikira kw’emisiwa (venous thromboembolism) (25%) bisangiddwa mu balwadde ba COVID-19 abeetaaga abujjanjabi obw’enjawulo abalina era nga buyinza okuba nga bwekwanya ku nteebereza enkyamu. Okukebera emirambo gy’abantu abafudde COVID-19 kuzudde diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), n’obusibage bw’obutaffaali omuli omusaayi ogwekutt mu mawuggwe.
translated: Obulwadde bwa thrombosis (31%) ne venous thromboembolism (25%) buzuuliddwa mu balwadde ba ICU abalina obulwadde bwa COVID-19 era nga buyinza okuba nga bwekuusa ku kuteebereza obubi.Okulongoosa abantu abaafa COVID-19 kuzudde nti diffuse alveolar damage ( DAD), n’ebizimba ebirimu lymphocyte ebiyingira mu mawuggwe.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: Newankubadde nga SARS-COV-2 atambulira ku kusikirizibwa kwa ACE2-omuli epithelial cells ez’omussizo, abalwadde ba COVID-19 abayi balina obubonero bwa systemic hyperinflammation.
translated: Newankubadde SARS-COV-2 erina tropism eri ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, abalwadde abalina COVID-19 ow’amaanyi balina obubonero bw’okuzimba ennyo mu nkola.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Okusinga ennyo, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells zaalagibwa okuba nga zikwatagana ne inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes ne severe lung pathology mu balwadde ba COVID-19.
translated: Okusingira ddala, obutoffaali bwa T obufulumya GM-CSF obuleeta endwadde bwalagibwa okukwatagana n’okuwandiika monocytes ezifulumya IL-6 ezizimba n’obulwadde bw’amawuggwe obw’amaanyi mu balwadde ba COVID-19.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: Obukulungwa obwekwafu (Lymphocytic infiltrates) bulabiddwako mu kukebera emirambo egifudde.
translated: Lymphocytic infiltrates nazo zibadde zitegeezeddwa mu kwekebejja omulambo.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: WHO kifulumiza enseetuka y’okunoonyereza ku bulwadde buno nnyingi.
translated: Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu kifulumizza ebiragiro ebiwerako eby’okukebera obulwadde buno.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Okukbera okwa bulijjo kwe kwa real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
translated: Enkola eya bulijjo ey’okugezesa ye real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: Okukebera kuno kutera kukolebwa ku sampolo eziggyibwa mu mussizo era nga zifunibwa ne swab ey’omu mussizo; wabula swab ey’omu nnyindo oba ekikolondolwa nabyo bisobola okukozesebwa.
translated: Okukebera kuno kutera kukolebwa ku sampuli z’okussa ezifunibwa mu nnyindo; wabula n’ekyuma ekikuba ennyindo oba ekikuta ky’amalusu nakyo kiyinza okukozesebwa.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: Ebivaamu bitera okufunibwa mu bbanga eriri wakati w’essaaawa entonotono n’ennaku bbiri.
translated: Okutwalira awamu ebivaamu bifunibwa mu ssaawa ntono okutuuka ku nnaku bbiri.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: Okukebera omusaayo nakwo kusobola okukozesebwa naye sampolo ezo zirina okubeera bbiri nga ziggyibwa ku muntu mu bbanga lya wiiki bbiri ezeesudde era ebivaamu tebitera kugasa mu kaseera ak’amangu.
translated: Okukebera omusaayi kuyinza okukozesebwa, naye bino byetaagisa omusaayi bibiri okuggyibwa nga baawukanye wiiki bbiri era ebivaamu tebirina mugaso mutono mu bwangu.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: Bannassaayansi b’e China baalengera obulwadde bwa coronavirus era ne bafulumya ebikwata ku bulwadde obwo (genetic sequence) olwo amagezeserezo mu nsi yonna ne gaba nga gasobola, kinnalimu okukola ku nteekateeka y’okukebera obulwadde bw’akawuka ako (polymerase chain reaction) (PCR).
translated: Bannasayansi aba China basobodde okwawula ekika kya coronavirus ne bafulumya ensengeka y’obuzaale olwo laboratory okwetoloola ensi yonna zisobole okwetongola okukola ebigezo bya polymerase chain reaction (PCR) okuzuula obulwadde buno.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: Nga 4 Ogwokuna 2020, okukebera abasirikale b’omubiri (okusobola okukenga obulwadde obuli mu mubiri n’oba ng’omuntu yabadde alwadde emabegako) kwali mu nkulaakulanya, naye nga kwali tekunnaba kukozesebwa wonna.
translated: We bwazibidde nga 4 April 2020, okukebera obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde (okuyinza okuzuula yinfekisoni ezikola n’okumanya oba omuntu yali yakwatibwa obulwadde buno emabega) kwali mu nkulaakulana, naye nga tezinnaba kukozesebwa nnyo.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: Obumanyirivu bw’okukebera mu China bulaze nti obutuufu bw’okukbera wakati w’ebitundu 60 okutuuka ku 70% byokka.
translated: Obumanyirivu bw’Abachina mu kukebera bulaga nti obutuufu buli ku bitundu 60 ku 70% byokka.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: Ekitongole kya FDA mu Amerika kyayisa okukebera okw’amangu okukolebwa ku mulwadde (first point-of-care test) okukozesebwa nga 21 Ogwokusatu 2020 ku nkomerero y’omwezi ogwo. Ebigobererwa mu kukebera ebyafulumizibwa eddwaliro Zhongnan Hospital mu Wuhan University byalimu okuteesa obukodyo obw’okukenga obulwadde nga bwesigamiziddwa ku bubonero n’obulabe obw’engeri y’okunoonyereza ku bulwadde(features and epidemiological risk).
translated: Ekitongole kya FDA mu Amerika kyakkiriza okukebera okusooka nga 21 March 2020 okukozesebwa ku nkomerero y’omwezi ogwo.Ebiragiro ebikwata ku kuzuula obulwadde ebyafulumizibwa eddwaliro lya Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University byawa amagezi ku ngeri y’okuzuula yinfekisoni okusinziira ku bubonero bw’obulwadde n’akabi akali mu ndwadde.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
translated: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities nga zirina ensaasaanya ey’okumpi, asymmetric ne posterior zitera okubeera mu kukwatibwa amangu.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: Bino biyinza okubaawo ng’obulwadde bugenda bukula Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), ne consolidation.
translated: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), n’okunyweza biyinza okulabika ng’obulwadde bwe bugenda mu maaso.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: Obubaka butono obuliwo ku bizimbulukusa (microscopic lesions) ne pathophysiology of COVID-19 butono ddala.
translated: Ebiwandiiko bitono ebikwata ku biwundu ebitonotono n’enkola y’obulwadde bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: Ebizuuliddwa ebikulu mu kukebera abantu abafudde bye bino:
translated: Ebikulu ebizuuliddwa mu bulwadde mu kwekebejja omulambo bye bino:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation ne pulmonary oedema
translated: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, okunyweza amawuggwe n’okuzimba amawuggwe

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: Ebika bina ebikambwe ebya lubyamira asaasanyizibwa akawuka bye bisobola okwekkenneenyezebwa:
translated: Ebika bina eby’obuzibu bw’ekifuba ekiva ku kawuka bisobola okulabibwa:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: lubyamira atali wa maanyi: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration ne multinucleated giant cell formation
translated: ekifuba ekitono: okuzimba amawuggwe, okulinnya kw’obutoffaali bw’ekifuba, obutoffaali obunene obw’ekifuba obutali bwa bulijjo, okuzimba mu bitundu by’omubiri (interstitial inflammation) n’okuyingira kw’obutoffaali obuyitibwa lymphocytic n’okutondebwa kw’obutoffaali obunene obw’obusimu obungi

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: lubyamira omukambwe: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) ne diffuse alveolar exudates.
translated: ekifuba eky’amaanyi: okwonooneka kw’emisuwa okusaasaana (DAD) nga kuliko amazzi agafuluma mu nnyindo agasaasaana.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD y’aleeta obuzibu obw’amaanyi mu kussa “acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS)” ne hypoxemia ow’amaanyi.
translated: DAD y’evaako obulwadde bw’okusannyalala okw’amaanyi (ARDS) n’okukendeeza ku musaayi ogw’amaanyi.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: okuwonya lubyamira: oba enteekateeka y’ebiva mu bibuno by’ebijijo ne pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
translated: okuwonya ekifuba: okutegeka ebifuluma mu bitundu by’omubiri ebiyitibwa alveolar cavities ne pulmonary interstitial fibrosis

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: Omusaayi: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
translated: Omusaayi: okusaasaana kw’omusaayi mu misuwa (DIC); enkola ya leukoerythroblastic

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: Ebikolebwa okukendeeza ku mikisa gy’okusiigibwa mulimu okubeera ewaka, okwewala ebifo ebirimu abantu abanti, okunaaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni n’amazzi emirundi egiwera okumala waakiri sekonda 20, okweyisa mu ngeri ennyonjo ku by’engeri y’okussa n’okwewaka okukwata mu maaso, ennyindo oba mu kamwa nga tonnanaaba mu ngalo.
translated: Ebiyinza okutangira okukendeeza ku mikisa gy’okukwatibwa obulwadde mulimu okusigala awaka, okwewala ebifo omujjudde abantu, okunaaba mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni emirundi mingi n’okumala sikonda ezitakka wansi wa 20, okwettanira obuyonjo obulungi mu by’okussa n’okwewala okukwata ku maaso, ennyindo oba akamwa ng’okozesa emikono gy’otonaaba.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: Ekitongole kya CDC kisemba okubikka ku mimwa n’ennyindo n’akagoye buli lw’obeera ng’okolola oba okukuba emyasi era kisemba okufunya omukono n’oyasimula oba okukolola bw’oba nga tolina kagoye.
translated: Ekitongole kya CDC kiwa amagezi okubikka akamwa n’ennyindo n’akawuka ng’osesema oba okusesema era kiwa amagezi okukozesa munda mu nkokola singa tewabaawo kikuta.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: Okuyonja engalo obulungi engalo ng’omaze okukolola oba okukuba emyasi kisembebwa.
translated: Obuyonjo obulungi mu ngalo oluvannyuma lw’okusesema oba okusesema kwonna bukubirizibwa.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: Ekitongole kya CDC kisemba okukozesa akagoye akabikka ku maaso ng’omuntu ali mu lujjudde, ekigendererwa ekimu mu kino kwe kwewala okusiiga obulwadde naddala ku balwadde abaneeyolekerako bubonero. Obukodyo bw’okwewa amabanga bugenderera okukendeeza ku kukwatagana kw’abantu abalina obulwadde n’ebibinja by’abantu ebinene ng’amasomero gaggalwa n’ebifo ebikolerwamu, okukugira okutambula n’okusazaamu enkuŋŋaana z’abantu abanti.
translated: CDC ewadde amagezi okukozesa ebibikka ffeesi mu lugoye mu bifo eby’olukale, ekitundu ku kukomya okusaasaana kw’abantu abatalina bubonero.Enkola z’okubeera ewala mu bantu zigenderera okukendeeza ku kukwatagana kw’abantu abalina obulwadde buno n’ebibinja ebinene nga baggalawo amasomero n’ebifo we bakolera, okukugira entambula n’okusazaamu enkung’aana ennene ez’olukale.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: Ebigobererwa by’okwewa amabanga era bizingiramu n’okuba nti abantu beesuula waakiti fuuti 6 (1.8 m).
translated: Ebiragiro ebikwata ku mabanga era birimu abantu okubeera nga baawukanye waakiri ffuuti 6 (mita 1.8).

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: Tewali ddagala limanyiddwa nga liziyiza COVID-19. Ekiseera eky’amangu eddagala erigema we lisuubirirwa okulabika, kiri mu mwaka gwa 2021, akakodyo ak’okulwanyisa COVID-19 kwe kugezaako okukendeeza okutumbiira kw’obulwadde, ekiyitibwa "okuseeteeza akoole".
translated: Tewali ddagala limanyiddwa nti likola bulungi mu kutangira COVID-19.Ng'okugema bwe kutasuubirwa okutuusa mu 2021 nga bukyali, ekitundu ekikulu mu kuddukanya COVID-19 kwe kugezaako okukendeeza ku ntikko y'ekirwadde kino, ekimanyiddwa nga "flattening the curve".

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Ekitongole kya CDC era kyasemba abantu kinnoomu okunaaba engalo ne ssabbuuni n’amazzi okumala waakiri sekonda 20, naddala nga bavudde mu kaabuyonjo oba ng’engalo zirabikira ddala nti ziddugala, nga tebannaba kulya ne nga bamaze okunyiza, okukolola oba okwasimulaalso.
translated: CDC era egamba nti abantu ssekinnoomu banaaba nnyo mu ngalo ne ssabbuuni n’amazzi okumala waakiri sekondi 20 naddala nga bamaze okugenda mu kaabuyonjo oba ng’emikono girabika nga gicaafu, nga tebannalya n’oluvannyuma lw’okufuuwa ennyindo, okusesema oba okusesema.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: Ekitongole era kisemba okukozesa sanitizer alimu omwenge oguwera waakiri ebitundu 60%, naye ng’ekyo bakikola nga waakiri sabbuuni n’amazzi tebiriiwo. Mu bitundu ebitaliimu sanitizer zitundibwa, ekitongole kya WHO kiwa amagezi ga mirundi ebiri ku ngeri gye ziyinza okukolebwa.
translated: Eyongera okuteesa okukozesa eddagala erirongoosa mu ngalo eririmu omwenge nga lirimu omwenge ogutakka wansi wa 60%, naye nga ssabbuuni n’amazzi tebifunibwa mangu.Ku bitundu eby’okuyonja mu ngalo eby’ettunzi gye bitafunibwa mangu, ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu eky’ensi yonna kiwa enkola bbiri ezikolebwa mu kitundu.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: Mu kukola batyo, enkola y’eddagala eritta obuwuka liva mu mwenge (ethanol) oba isopropanol.
translated: Mu nkola zino, omulimu gw’okulwanyisa obuwuka guva mu ethanol oba isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: Hydrogen peroxide akozesebwa okuyambako okumalawo bacterial spores mu mwenge; si "kirungo ekikola okutta obuwuka mu ngalo (hand antisepsis)".
translated: Hydrogen peroxide akozesebwa okuyamba okumalawo obuwuka bwa bacteria mu mwenge; "si kintu ekikola ku ddagala eriziyiza obuwuka obuleeta endwadde z'omu ngalo".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: Glycerol ateekebwamu okuvaamu oluzzizzi (humectant.
translated: Glycerol ayongerwako ng’ekirungo ekifuuwa amazzi.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: Abantu bakolebwamu na bujjanjabi obubawanirira, obuyinza okuzingiramu, amazzi, okuteekebwako omukka (oxygen), n’okuwanirira ebitundu by’omubiri ebiba bikoseddwa.
translated: Abantu baddukanyizibwa n‟obujjanjabi obuyamba, ekiyinza okuli okujjanjaba amazzi, okuwagira omukka gwa oxygen, n‟okuwagira ebitundu ebirala ebikulu ebikoseddwa.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: Ekitongole kya CDC kisemba nti abo abateebereza nti balina akawuka, bambale akakookolo akangungu.
translated: Ekitongole kya CDC kiwa amagezi abo abateebereza nti balina akawuka kano okwambala masiki ya ffeesi ennyangu.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: Okuteekebwako omukka (Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, ECMO) kukozeseddwa okukola ku kizibu ky’okulemererwa okussa naye ng’emiganyulo gy’enkola eno gikyatunuulirwa.
translated: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) ekozesebwa okukola ku nsonga y’okulemererwa okussa, naye emigaso gyayo gikyalowoozebwako.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: Obuyonjo obw’omuntu kinnoomu n’okwefaako mu byobulamu n’okulya emmere erimu ebiriisa ey’enjawulo bisembebwa okwongera ku busibage bw’omuntu.
translated: Obuyonjo bw’omuntu n’obulamu obulungi n’endya ennungi bibadde bisemba okutumbula abaserikale b’omubiri.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Obujjanjabi obuwanirizi buyinza okuyamba abo abalina obubonero obutali bwa maanyi ng’obulwadde bwakabakwata. WHO ne Chinese National Health Commission bafulumizza ebisembebwa okujjanjaba abantu abaweereddwa ebitanda nga balina COVID-19.
translated: Obujjanjabi obuwagira buyinza okuba obw’omugaso mu abo abalina obubonero obutono nga batandika okukwatibwa.Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu ekya WHO n’akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga lya China bafulumizza amagezi ku ngeri y’okulabirira abantu abali mu malwaliro nga balina COVID-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Abasawo abalabirira abalwadde abayi (Intensivists) n’abasawo abajjanjaba emissizo (pulmonologists) mu Amerika bawandiise ebyokukola ebisembebwa okuva mu bitongole eby’enjawulo ne babiteeka mu kiwandiiko ekyobwereere, IBCC.
translated: Abakugu mu by’obujjanjabi obw’amaanyi n’amawuggwe mu Amerika bakung’aanyizza ebiteeso by’obujjanjabi okuva mu bitongole eby’enjawulo ne babifuula ekintu eky’obwereere, IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Mu Gwokuna 2020, tewali bujjanjabi bwa COVID-19 bwatuukiddwako.
translated: We bwazibidde April 2020, tewali bujjanjabi bwa COVID-19 obwenjawulo.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Mu kujjanjaba obubonero, abakugu abamu basemba okukozesa paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen ng’eddagala erisookerwako.
translated: Ku bubonero, abakugu abamu mu by’obujjanjabi bagamba nti paracetamol (acetaminophen) okusinga ibuprofen okukozesebwa mu layini esooka.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: Okwegendereza kulina okubaawo okendeeza ku bulabe bw’okusiiga akawuka, nadddala mu malwaliro nga waliwo ebikolebwa ku mulwadde ebiyinza okuleeta oluzzizzi gamba ng’okuteekebwamu akaseke (intubation) oba ekyuma ekiyamba mu kussa ekikwatibwa mu ngalo (hand ventilation).
translated: Okwegendereza kulina okukolebwa okukendeeza ku bulabe bw’okusiiga akawuka naddala mu bifo eby’ebyobulamu nga bakola emitendera egisobola okuvaamu omukka oguyitibwa aerosols, gamba ng’okussa mu ttanka oba okussa empewo mu ngalo.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: Eri abasawo abajjanjaba abalwadde abalina COVID-19, ekitongole kya CDC kisemba okuteeka omuntu mu kisenge ekirimu obulungi empewo (AIIR) okwo nga kw’otadde okukozesa okwegendereza okwa bulijjo, okwegendereza kw’okukwatagana n’abantu n’okwegendereza okukwata ku mpewo. CDC kinokola ebigobererwa mu kukozesa ebyokwesabika (PPE) mu kiseera kya nawookeera.
translated: Ku bakugu mu by’obulamu abalabirira abantu abalina ekirwadde kya COVID-19, CDC egamba nti omuntu oyo ateeke mu kisenge kya Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) nga kwotadde n’okukozesa enkola eza bulijjo, okwegendereza okukwatagana n’okwegendereza mu mpewo.Ekitongole kya CDC kilambika ebiragiro ku nkozesa y’ebintu eby’okwekuuma ebyuma (PPE) mu kiseera kya ssennyiga omukambwe.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: Ebyokwesabika ebisembebwa bye bino: egganduula, akassizibwamu, akakookolo, ekibikka amaaso, ne giravu z’ekisawo. Bwe biba nga weebiri, ebissizibwamu (mu kifo ky’obukookolo) bye bisingako.
translated: Ggiya esengekeddwa ye: gomesi ya PPE, ekyuma ekissa oba ffeesi, okukuuma amaaso, ne ggalavu z’obujjanjabi.Bwe zibaawo, ebyuma ebissa (mu kifo kya ffeesi) bye bisinga okwettanirwa.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Obussizibwamu obwa N95 busembebwa okukozesebwa mu bifo eby’amakolero naye FDA kyawa obuyinza okukozesa obukookolo mu kaseera k’amangu (EUA).
translated: Ebyuma ebissa ebya N95 bikkiriziddwa okukozesebwa mu makolero kyokka ekitongole kya FDA kikkirizza masiki zino okukozesebwa wansi w’ekiragiro ekimanyiddwa nga Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: Bikolebwa okukuuuma omuntu eri obutundutundu obutambulira mu mpewo gamba ng’enfuufu, nae obukuumi obwenkomeredde eri obuwuka tebwekakasika mu nkozesa etali ntuufu.
translated: Zikoleddwa okukuuma obutundutundu obubeera mu mpewo ng’enfuufu naye obulungi ku kirungo ekiramu ekigere tekikakasibwa ku nkozesa ezitali za kabonero.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Obukookolo bwe buba nga tebuliiwo, ekitongole kya CDC kisemba nti bwe waba nga tewali kyakukozesa, obukookolo obukolebwa ewaka busobola okukozesebwa.
translated: Masiki bwe zitabaawo, CDC ekuwa amagezi okukozesa engabo za ffeesi oba ng’ekisembayo, masiki ezikoleddwa awaka.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: Abalwadde ba COVID-19 abasinga tebaba bayi nnyo kutuuka ku ssa lya kubateekako mukka naye nga waliwo ekigero ky’abantu abagwetaaga.
translated: Abalwadde ba COVID-19 abasinga tebalina maanyi kimala nga kyetaagisa okuyingiza empewo mu makanika oba ebirala, naye ebitundu ku kikumi ku balwadde babiri...

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: Ekika ky’obuwanirizi bw’omussizo obwetaagisa ku bantu abalina obuzibu obwekwanya n’obwa COVID-19 mu kussa bwetegerezebwa naddala ku bantu abali mu malwaliro, era waliwo obubaka obulaga nti okuteekebwamu akapiira kuyinza okwewalibwa ne bakozesa high flow nasal cannula oba bi-level positive airway pressure.
translated: Ekika ky’obuyambi bw’okussa eri abantu ssekinnoomu abalina okulemererwa kw’okussa okwekuusa ku COVID-19 kunoonyerezebwako nnyo eri abantu abali mu ddwaaliro, nga waliwo obukakafu obulaga nti okussa mu nnyindo kuyinza okwewalibwa n’omusuwa gw’ennyindo ogukulukuta ennyo oba puleesa y’empewo ennungi ey’emitendera ebiri.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Tekimanyiddwa oba ng’ekimu ku bino kivaamu ebirungi bye bimu eri abalwadde abali obubi.
translated: Oba ekimu ku bino ebibiri kivaamu omugaso gwe gumu eri abantu abali mu mbeera embi tekimanyiddwa.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Abasawo abamu basinga kwagala kukozesa nkola ya invasive mechanical ventilation bw’eba nga weeri kubanga akakodyo kano kakendeeza ku nsaasaanya y’obutundutundu bw’ogeraageranya ne high flow nasal cannula. Abalwadde ababeera obubi basinga kulabikira mu bantu abakuluko (abo abasussa emyaka 60 ate naddala abo abasussa emyaka 80).
translated: Abasawo abamu basinga kwagala kusigala n’empewo ey’ebyuma ebiyingira mu mubiri nga waliwo kubanga enkola eno ekoma ku kusaasaana kw’obutundutundu bwa aerosol bw’ogeraageranya n’omusuwa gw’ennyindo ogukulukuta ennyo.Emisango egy’amaanyi gisinga kubeera mu bantu abakulu abakadde (abo abasukka mu myaka 60, n’okusingira ddala abo abasukka mu myaka 80) . .

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Amawanga mangi agaakula edda tegalina bitanda by’abalwadde bimala bw’ogeraageranya n’omuwendo gw’abantu be balina, kino kikendeeza ku busobozi bw’amalwaliro okukola ku balwadde singa wabaawo embeera y’okutumbiira kw’abalwadde ba COVID-19 ate nga bonna beetaaga okuweebwa ebitanda.
translated: Amawanga mangi agaakulaakulana tegalina bitanda bya malwaliro bimala buli muntu, ekikoma ku busobozi bw’enkola y’ebyobulamu okukwata omuwendo gw’abalwadde ba COVID-19 okweyongera okw’amangu okw’amaanyi ennyo ne kyetaagisa okuweebwa ebitanda mu malwaliro.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
