targetString: Okunoonyereza okumu mu China kwazuula nti ebitundu 5% bassibwa ku bujjanjabi obwenjawulo mu malwaliro, ebitundu 2.3% baali beetaaga ebyuma ebissizibwamu ate ebitundu 1.4% baafa.
translated: Okunoonyereza okumu mu China kwazuula nti 5% baaweebwa ekitanda mu bifo eby’abalwadde abayi, 2.3% beetaaga obuyambi bw’ebyuma okuyingiza empewo, ate 1.4% ne bafa.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: Mu China, abantu nga 30% abalwadde ba COVID-19 nga bali mu malwaliro balwa ddaaki ne bassibwa ku bujjanjabi obw’enjawulo (ICU.
translated: Mu China, abantu nga 30% abali mu ddwaliro nga balina COVID-19 okukkakkana nga baweereddwa ebitanda mu ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: Ekyuma ekissizibwamu (Mechanical ventilation) kyongera okuzibuwala kubanga obuwladde bwa acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) bujja ne COVID-19 era okufuna omukka nakwo kweyongera okuzibuwala.
translated: Okuyingiza empewo mu byuma kweyongera okuzibuwalirwa ng’obulwadde bw’okusannyalala (ARDS) bweyongera mu COVID-19 era n’okuyingiza omukka gwa oxygen bweyongera okukaluba.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Ebyuma ebissizzibwamu (Ventilators) ebisobola okukola ku kunyiriza ne PEEP owa waggulu (high PEEP) yeetaagibwa okuleeta omukka gwa oxygen ogumala ate nga waliwo n’okukendeeza ku bulabe obwekwanya ku kyuma ekissizzibwamu (risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax).
translated: Ebyuma ebifulumya empewo ebisobola emitendera gy’okufuga puleesa ne PEEP eya waggulu byetaagibwa okusobola okutumbula omukka gwa oxygen ate nga bikendeeza ku bulabe bw’obuvune bw’amawuggwe obuva ku byuma ebissa n’okuzimba ekifuba.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: PEEP eya waggulu (High PEEP) eyinza okuba nga teri ku byuma ebissizibwamu ebikadde.
translated: PEEP enkulu eyinza obutabaawo ku byuma eby’okussa ebikadde.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: Okunoonyereza ku bujjanjabi obusoboka kwatandika mu Janwali 2020, era eddagala lingi erirwanyisa obuwuka (antiviral drugs) ligezesebwa mu kiseera kino.
translated: Okunoonyereza ku bujjanjabi obuyinza okubaawo kwatandika mu January 2020, era eddagala eriweweeza ku siriimu eriwerako liri mu kugezesebwa mu malwaliro.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: Remdesivir lye lirabika okubaamu essuubi.
translated: Remdesivir erabika y’esinga okusuubiza.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Weewaawo ng’eddagala eppya liyinza okulwawo okukolebwa okutuuka eyo mu 2021, eddagala eddala erigezesebwa lyakakasibwa dda okukozesebwa ku bulwadde obulala era kati okugezesa kwalyo kuli ku mitendera gya waggulu.
translated: Wadde eddagala eppya liyinza okutwala okutuusa mu 2021 okukolebwa, eddagala eriwerako erikeberebwa lyakkirizibwa dda okukozesebwa mu ngeri endala oba lyali dda mu kukeberebwa okw’omulembe.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Eddagala erirwanyisa obuwuka (Antiviral medication) liyinza okugezesebwa ku bantu abalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi.
translated: Eddagala eritta akawuka liyinza okugezesebwa mu bantu abalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO kyasemba bannakyewa okwetaba mu kugezesa enkola y’eddagala ennungi n’okulaba oba nga teririimu bulabe. Ekitongole kya FDA kiwadde olukusa olw’ekiseera ku convalescent plasma ng’obujjanjabi obw’ekiseera mu mbeera obulamu bw’omuntu obulamu bw’omuntu we bubeerera mu katyabaga.
translated: Ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu ekya WHO kyawa amagezi bannakyewa okwetaba mu kugezesa obulungi n’obukuumi bw’obujjanjabi obuyinza okubaawo.Ekitongole kya FDA kiwadde olukusa olw’ekiseera okuwona plasma ng’obujjanjabi obw’okugezesa mu mbeera ng’obulamu bw’omuntu buli mu kabi ak’amaanyi oba mu bwangu.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: Terinnaba kunoonyerezebwako kwandiyinzizza kulaba oba nga teririimu bulabe n’okumanya oba nga lijjanjaba obulwadde obwo.
translated: Tekinnaba kugenda mu kunoonyereza kwa bujjanjabi okwetaagisa okulaga nti tekirina bulabe era kikola bulungi ku bulwadde buno.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: Mu Gwokubiri 2020, China yatongolza app y’essimu z’omu ngalo okuyambako mu kulondoola okubalukawo kw’obulwadde.
translated: Mu February wa 2020, China yatongoza app ku ssimu okukola ku bulwadde buno.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: Abakozesa basabibwa okuteekamu amannya gaabwe ne nnamba ya ID.
translated: Abakozesa basabibwa okuyingiza amannya gaabwe n’ennamba y’endagamuntu.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: App esobola okukenga 'okusembereganat' ng’ekozesa obubaka bw’okulondoola, noolwekyo eyambako okukenga obulabe bw’obulwadde obuyinza okujja.
translated: App eno esobola okuzuula ‘close contact’ ng’ekozesa data y’okulondoola n’olwekyo ya bulabe bw’okukwatibwa.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Buli mukozesa asobola okukebera embeera y’abakozesa abalala basatu.
translated: Buli mukozesa asobola n’okukebera embeera y’abakozesa abalala basatu.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Bwe wabaawo obulabe obuyinza okugwawo obukengeddwa, app tekoma ku kukusemba kweteeka mu kalantiini, naye etemya ne ku boobuyinza abeebyobulamu mu kitundu. Big data analytics ku bubaka bw’essimu z’omu ngalo, tekinologiya akenga amaaso, okulondoola amasimu ag’omu ngalo ne artificial intelligence bikozesebwa okulondoola abantu abakwatiddwa obulwadde n’abantu be baakwataganyeeko nabo mu South Korea, Taiwan ne Singapore.
translated: Singa wazuulibwa akabi akayinza okubaawo, app eno tekoma ku kuteesa ku kweteeka mu kalantiini, era erabula abakungu b’ebyobulamu mu kitundu.Okwekenenya amawulire amanene ku data y’essimu, tekinologiya w’okutegeera ffeesi, okulondoola amasimu n’obugezi obukozesebwa okulondoola abantu abalina akawuka n’abantu be... yatuukiridde mu South Korea, Taiwan ne Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu 2020, gavumenti ya Yisirayiri yasobozesa ebitongole okulondoola obubaka bw’oku masimu g’omu ngalo ag’abantu abateeberezebwa okubeera ne coronavirus.
translated: Mu March wa 2020, gavumenti ya Yisirayiri yasobozesa ebitongole by’ebyokwerinda okulondoola ebikwata ku masimu g’abantu abateeberezebwa okuba n’akawuka ka corona.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: Kino kyakolebwa olw’okunyweza eky’abantu okweteeka mu kalantiini n’okukuuma abo abayinza okukwatagana n’abo abalina obulwadde.
translated: Enkola eno yakoleddwa okussa mu nkola kalantiini n’okukuuma abayinza okukwatagana ne bannansi abalina obulwadde buno.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu 2020, Deutsche Telekom yagabana obubaka obukwata ku bifo abantu we baba bali n’ekitongole kya gavumenti ekya, Robert Koch Institute, kikole okunoonyereza n’okutangira okusaasaanya obulwadde.
translated: Era mu March 2020, Deutsche Telekom yagabana ebikwata ku ssimu ezikuŋŋaanyiziddwa n’ekitongole kya gavumenti eya wakati mu Girimaani, Robert Koch Institute, okusobola okunoonyereza n’okutangira okusaasaana kw’akawuka kano.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: Russia yakola tekinologiya akenga amaaso nga bagenderera okulaba abo abadduka mu kalantiini.
translated: Russia yataddemu tekinologiya ow’okutegeera ffeesi okuzuula abamenya kalantiini.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: Omukungu w’Ekitongole kya Italy eky’Ebyobulamu, Giulio Gallera yagamba nti yategeezebwa ab’amasimu g’omu ngalo nti " abantu ebitundu 40% bakyeyongera okutambulatambula".
translated: Kaminsona w'ebyobulamu mu kitundu kya Yitale, Giulio Gallera yagambye nti ategeezeddwa abaddukanya amasimu nti "abantu 40% bakyagenda mu maaso n'okutambula mu ngeri yonna".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: Gavumenti ya Bugirimaanyi yakola okunoonyereza kwa ssaawa 48 ku wiikend (hackathon) n’abeetabi abasukka mu 42.000.
translated: Gavumenti ya Girimaani yakoze emisinde gya hackathon egyamaze essaawa 48 ku wiikendi nga abantu abasoba mu 42.000 beetabye mu mpaka zino.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Mu ngeri y’emu Pulezidenti wa Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, yakubira ensi yonna omulanga okuyiiya engeri ez’enjawulo ez’okulwanyisa coronavirus.
translated: Era ne pulezidenti wa Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, yakola omulanga gw’ensi yonna ogw’okugonjoola ebizibu ebiyiiya okulwanyisa okusaasaana kwa coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Abantu kinnoomu bayinza okwekyawa olwa Kalantiini, okukugirwa okutambula, okukosebwa okuva ku bujjanjabi oba okutya okubulwadde bwennyinis.
translated: Abantu ssekinnoomu bayinza okufuna okunyigirizibwa okuva mu kalantiini, obukwakkulizo ku ntambula, ebizibu ebiva mu bujjanjabi oba okutya obulwadde bwennyini.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC yagamba nti Rory O'Connor yayogera ebigambo bino, "Okweyongera okweggya ku bantu, ekiwuubaalo, okucamuukiririra, okunyigirizibwa n’okweveera kw’ebyenfuna, bintu ebitaataaganya ebirowoozo n’embeera y’obulamu bw’abantu."
translated: BBC yajuliza Rory O'Connor n'agamba nti, "Okwongera okwekutula ku bantu, okubeera obw'omu, okweraliikirira ku by'obulamu, situleesi n'okusereba kw'ebyenfuna kibuyaga atuukiridde okukosa obulamu bw'abantu obw'omutwe n'obulamu obulungi."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: Obulwadde buyinza okujja nga si bwa maanyi ne bwoleka obubonero butono oba ne butalaga, nga bufaananako n’obwo obulala obutera okukwata omussizo ogwa waggulu gamba ssenyiga owa bulijjo.
translated: Obulwadde buno buyinza okutwala ekkubo eritali lya maanyi nga tebulina bubonero butono oba nga tebulina, nga bufaananako endwadde endala eza bulijjo ez’okussa waggulu nga omusujja gw’ensiri.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Obulwadde obutali bwa maanyi butera okugendera mu bbanga lya wiiki nga bbiri, ate obwo obw’amaanyi oba obulwadde obw’amaanyi buyinza okutwala ebbanga eriri wakati wa wiiki ssatu ne wiiki mukaaga okuwona.
translated: Abalwadde abatono batera okuwona mu wiiki bbiri, ate abalina endwadde ez’amaanyi oba ez’amaanyi bayinza okutwala wiiki ssatu ku mukaaga okuwona.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Abakyala abazito bayinzaokubeera mu bulabe bwa maani okukwatibwa COVID-19 okusinziira ku buwuka obulala nga SARS ne MERS, naye obubaka obukwata ku COVID-19 ku nsonga eno tebunnaba kufunika. Mu bantu abantu, COVID-19 ayinza okukosa amawuggwe olwo ne bafuna lubyamira.
translated: Abakyala ab’embuto bayinza okuba mu bulabe obw’amaanyi obw’okukwatibwa ekirwadde kya COVID-19 eky’amaanyi okusinziira ku bikwata ku virus endala ezifaanagana, nga SARS ne MERS, naye data ku COVID-19 teziriiwo.Mu bantu abamu, COVID-19 eyinza okukosa amawuggwe ekivaako ekifuba.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: Eri abo abakoseddwa ennyo, COVID-19 ayinza okukulira ku mbiro n’afuukamu obulwadde obw’amaanyi obukosa omussizo (acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) ne kivaamu okulemererwa okussa, septic shock oba ebitundu by’omubiri ebiwera okulemererwa okukola emirimu gyabyo.
translated: Mu abo abasinga okukosebwa ennyo, COVID-19 eyinza okukula amangu n’efuuka acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) ekivaako okulemererwa okussa, septic shock oba okulemererwa kw’ebitundu by’omubiri ebingi.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Obulwadde obwekwanya ku COVID-19 mulimu okulemererwa kw’ebitundu by’omubiri okukola (sepsis), okwekwata kw’omusaayi (abnormal clotting) n’okukosebwa ku mutima, ensigo n’ekibumba.
translated: Ebizibu ebiva mu COVID-19 mulimu sepsis, okuzimba omusaayi mu ngeri etaali ya bulijjo n’okwonooneka kw’omutima, ensigo n’ekibumba.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: Okwekwata kw’omusaayi, naddala okweyongera kw’omusaayi okulwawo okwekwata (increase in prothrombin time), byonna ebyo birabiddwa mu balwadde ebitundu 6% abaweereddwa ebitanda mu ddwaliro olw’obulwadde bwa COVID-19, so ng’ate obuzibu bw’ensigo bulabiddwa mu balwadde abawera 4% mu kibinja ebyo.
translated: Obutabeera bulungi mu kuzimba, naddala okweyongera mu budde bwa prothrombin, bubadde bunnyonnyolwa mu bitundu 6% ku abo abaweebwa ebitanda mu ddwaaliro nga balina COVID-19, ate nga enkola y’ekibumba etali ya bulijjo elabibwa mu bitundu 4% ku kibinja kino.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Abantu nga 20-30% abalina COVID-19 bazimba (elevated liver enzymes, transaminases).
translated: Abantu nga 20-30% abeeyanjula ne COVID-19 balaga nti enziyiza z’ekibumba (transaminases) ziri waggulu.

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: Okusinziira ku alipoota y’emu eyo ekigero ky’obudde okuva obubonero lwe butandise n’okufa kyali ennaku kkumi ng’ennaku kkumi bazimala bali ku bitanda mu malwaliro.
translated: Okusinziira ku lipoota y’emu, ekiseera wakati w’okutandika obubonero n’okufa kyali kya nnaku kkumi, ng’ennaku ttaano baamala mu ddwaaliro.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: Wabula, abalwadde abateekebwa ku bujjanjabi obw’enjawulo (ICU) bwalina ekigero ky’obudde wakati w’ennaku musanvu ng’omulwadde ali mu ddwaliro n’okufa.
translated: Wabula abalwadde abaatwalibwa mu ICU baalina obudde bwa nnaku musanvu wakati w’okuweebwa ekitanda n’okufa.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: Mu kunoonyereza ku balwadde abaasooka, ekigero ky’obudde omuntu w’alagira obubonero n’okufa kyali wakati w’ennaku 14 n’ekirala wakati w’ennaku 6 n’ennaku 41.
translated: Mu kunoonyereza okwakolebwa ku balwadde abasooka, obudde obw’omu makkati okuva ku kwolesa obubonero obusooka okutuuka ku kufa bwali bwa nnaku 14, nga mu bujjuvu bwa nnaku mukaaga okutuuka ku 41.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: Mu kunoonyereza kwa National Health Commission (NHC) mu China, omuwendo gw’abasajja abaali bafa baali awo ku bitundu 2.8% ate abasajja baali ku bitundu 1.7%.
translated: Mu kunoonyereza okwakoleddwa akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga (NHC) mu China, abasajja baafa ebitundu 2.8% ate abakazi baafa ebitundu 1.7%.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: Okukebera okwesigamiziddwa ku byafaayo (Histopathological examinations) ku sampolo z’abafu kulaga okukosebwa kwa diffuse alveolar damage wamu ne cellular fibromyxoid exudates mu mawuggwe gombi.
translated: Okukebera obulwadde bw’ebitundu by’omubiri (histopathological examinations) ku sampuli z’amawuggwe oluvannyuma lw’okufa kulaga okwonooneka kw’amawuggwe okusaasaana n’obutoffaali bwa fibromyxoid exudates mu mawuggwe gombi.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: Enkyukakyuka za Viral cytopathic zaalabibwa mu pneumocytes.
translated: Enkyukakyuka mu cytopathic y’akawuka zaalabiddwa mu pneumocytes.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Ekifaananyi ky’amawuggwe kyafaanana okuba n’obulwadde bwa acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
translated: Ekifaananyi ky’amawuggwe kyali kiringa obulwadde bw’okusannyalala okw’amaanyi (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: Mu baafa ebitundu 11.8% ebyategeezebwa Ekitongole kya National Health Commission ekya China, okukosebwa kw’omutima kwalabibwa nga kulimu ebigero by’okulemererwa kw’omutima (troponin or cardiac arrest).
translated: Mu bitundu 11.8% eby’okufa okwaloopebwa akakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu ggwanga erya China, omutima okwonooneka kwalabiddwa olw’omuwendo gwa troponin ogw’amaanyi oba omutima okusiba.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: Okusinziira ku bubaka bw’omu Gwokusatu okuva mu United States, ebitundu 89% ku abo abaaweebwa ebitanda mu malwaliro baalina obulwadde obullala. Obujjanjabi obuli mu kitundu n’embeera y’ebyenfuna nabyo bisobola okwongeza ku muwendo gw’abalwadde abafa.
translated: Okusinziira ku biwandiiko bya March okuva mu Amerika, 89% ku abo abaali mu malwaliro baalina embeera ezaaliwo edda.Okubeerawo kw’ebikozesebwa mu by’obujjanjabi n’embeera z’abantu mu kitundu nakyo kiyinza okukosa okufa.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: Okuteebereza kw’omuwendo gw’abafa kukyukakyuka kubanga mu bitundu ebyo mulimu enjawulo, naye era n’olw’obukalubo bw’enseetuka.
translated: Okubalirira kw’abafa okuva mu mbeera eno kwawukana olw’enjawulo ezo ez’ebitundu, naye era olw’obuzibu bw’enkola.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: Okubalira wansi abo abatali balwadde nnyo kisobola okuleetera omuwendo gw’abafa okubalirwa waggulu.
translated: Okubala obutono ku balwadde abatono kiyinza okuvaako omuwendo gw’abafa okusukkiridde okubalirirwa.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: Wabula, olw’okuba nti abafa baba abo abafunye obulwadde ge buvuddeko, kisobola okutegeeza nti omuwendo gw’abafa gubalirwa wansi.
translated: Wabula eky’okuba nti okufa kuva ku misango egyakwatibwa mu biseera eby’emabega kiyinza okutegeeza nti omuwendo gw’abafa mu kiseera kino gutunuulirwa wansi.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: Abanywa sigala baalina mikisa egibalirwa ku bitundu 1.4 okufuna obubonero obw’amaanyi obwa COVID-19 wamu ng’emirundi 2.4 okwetaaga obujjanjabi obw’amangu oba okufa bw’ogeraageranya n’abo abatanywa. Waliwo okutya okulagiddwa ku abo abalina obulwadde obulala.
translated: Abanywa sigala baali basinga okubeera n’obubonero obw’amaanyi obwa COVID-19 emirundi 1.4 n’emikisa nga 2.4 egy’okwetaaga obujjanjabi obw’amaanyi oba okufa bw’ogeraageranya n’abatanywa ssigala.Obweraliikirivu bubaddewo ku biyinza okuddirira obulwadde buno okumala ebbanga eddene.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: Aboobuyinza mu Ddwaliro lya Hong Kong baazuula okukka mu busobozi bw’ekibumba nga kuli wakati w’ebitundu 20% ku 30% mu bantu abamu abaawona obulwadde ate sikaani ezaakolebwa ku mawuggwe nga ziraga nti gaakosebwa.
translated: Ekitongole ekivunaanyizibwa ku ddwaaliro e Hong Kong kyazudde nti obusobozi bw’amawuggwe mu bantu abamu abawona obulwadde buno bwakendeera ebitundu 20% ku 30%, era okukebera amawuggwe kwalaga nti ebitundu by’omubiri byonooneddwa.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
translated: Kino era kiyinza okuvaako obulwadde bw’okulabirira abalwadde abayi oluvannyuma lw’okuwona.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu 2020, kyali tekimanyiddwa oba ng’obulwadde obulala omuntu bw’asangibwa nabo bumuwa obusibage obulungi eri abalwadde abaawoona obulwadde obwo.
translated: We bwazibidde mu March 2020, tekinnategeerekeka oba obulwadde obwayita buwa obusimu obuziyiza endwadde obulungi era obw’ekiseera ekiwanvu mu bantu abawona obulwadde buno.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: Obusibage bulabika, okusinziira ku neeyisa ya coronavirus endala, naye ate abalwadde abawonye COVID-19 oluvannyuma bwe bazzeemu okukeberwa, bazuuliddwa nga balina coronavirus.
translated: Obutafaali obuziyiza endwadde butunuulirwa nga bwe buyinza okubaawo, okusinziira ku nneeyisa y’ekirwadde kya coronavirus emirala, kyokka emisango mwe bazze okuwona ekirwadde kya COVID-19 ne bazuulibwa nga bazuuliddwa nga balina coronavirus oluvannyuma bazze baloopebwa.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Abalwadde abo balowoozebwa nti bafuna ekirwadde ekirala so si kuddamu kufuna bulwadde obwo.
translated: Emisango gino giteeberezebwa okuba nga gigenda kweyongera olw’obulwadde obuwangaala okusinga okuddamu okukwatibwa.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Akawuka ako kalowoozebwa okubeera ak’obutonde era nga kava mu nsolo nga kaabuuka bubuusi ne kajja mu bantu (spillover infection).
translated: Akawuka kano kalowoozebwa okuba ka butonde era nga kasibuka mu nsolo, nga kayita mu bulwadde obuyitiridde.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Ensibuko yennyini temanyiddwa, naye Deesemba 2019 we yatuukira ensaasaana y’obulwadde obwo yali yeemalidde ku kutambulira mu bantu.
translated: Ensibuko yennyini temanyiddwa, naye mu December wa 2019 okusaasaana kw’obulwadde kumpi kwali kuvudde ku kusiigibwa okuva mu bantu okudda mu bantu.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okwakolebwa ku balwadde 41 aba COVID-19 abaasooka okukakasibwa, okwafulumizibwa mu Janwali 2020 mu The Lancet, kwalaga nti obubonero obwasooka okulabika bwaliwo nga 1 Deesemba 2019.
translated: Okunoonyereza okwakolebwa ku balwadde 41 abaasooka okuzuulibwa COVID-19, okwafulumizibwa mu January 2020 mu lupapula lwa The Lancet, kwalaga nti olunaku obubonero bwe bwasooka okutandika nga 1 December 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: Ebiwandiiko ebyafuluma mu butongole okuva mu WHO byategeeza nti obubonero obwasooka okulabika bwaliwo nga 8 Deesemba 2019.
translated: Ebitabo ebitongole okuva mu kitongole ky’ebyobulamu ekya WHO byategeeza nti obubonero buno bwasooka kutandika nga 8 December 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
translated: Ebipimo ebiwerako bitera okukozesebwa okupima obungi bw’abafa.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Emiwendo gino gyawukana okuva mu kitundu ekimu okudda mu kirala era nga kino kiva ku bungi bw’okukebera, omutindo gw’obujjanjabi, obujjanjabi obuliwo, ekiseera okuva obulwadde we bwatuukirayo n’ensonga endala ez’abantu nga emyaka, ekikula n’embeera y’obulamu bwabwe okutwaliza awamu.
translated: Ennamba zino zaawukana okusinziira ku bitundu n’okumala ekiseera era zikwatibwako obungi bw’okukeberebwa, omutindo gw’enkola y’ebyobulamu, engeri y’obujjanjabi, obudde bukya bulwadde buno bwasooka n’engeri y’abantu ng’emyaka, ekikula n’obulamu okutwalira awamu.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: 2019 nga guggwaako, WHO kyateekawo koodi ey’amangu ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 ku baafa obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2 nga bakakasiddwa mu ggezeserezo ne U07.2 abaafa nga kiva mu kukebera ne balaba nga bafudde COVID-19 awatali kukeberebwa mu ggezeserezo kukakasa nti ddala bulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2. Ekigero ky’omuwendo gw’abafa n’abalwadde kiraga omuwendo gw’aba mu kiseera ekigere.
translated: Ku nkomerero ya 2019, WHO yawa koodi z’obulwadde obw’amangu obwa ICD-10 U07.1 ku bafa olw’obulwadde bwa SARS-CoV-2 obwakakasiddwa mu laabu ne U07.2 eri abafa olw’obulwadde bwa COVID-19 obuzuuliddwa mu bujjanjabi oba mu by’obulwadde nga tebalina SARS-CoV-2 eyakakasibwa mu laabu. 2 yinfekisoni.Omugerageranyo gw’abafa ku balwadde gulaga omuwendo gw’abafudde nga gugabanyizibwamu omuwendo gw’abalwadde abazuuliddwa mu kiseera ekigere.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Okusinziira ku bibalo bya John Hopkins University, ekigero ky’okufa n’obulwadde mu nsi yonna kiri ebitundu 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) olwa 17 Ogwokuna 2020 we gwatuukira.
translated: Okusinziira ku bibalo bya Johns Hopkins University, omugerageranyo gw’abafa ku balwadde mu nsi yonna guli 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) okutuuka nga 17 April 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Omuwendo ogwo gukyuka okusinziira ku kitundu. Obukodyo obulala mulimu ekigero ky’abalwadde abafa (CFR), omuwendo ogulaga omuwendo ku kikumi ogw’abo abakebeddwa ne bafa olw’endwadde, n’abakwatibwa obulwadde (IFR), omuwendo ogulaga abantu abalwadde (abakebeddwa ate era ne baddamu ne bakeberwa) ne bafa olw’obulwadde obumu.
translated: Omuwendo gwawukana okusinziira ku bitundu.Ebirala ebipimo mulimu omuwendo gw’abafa mu balwadde (CFR), ogulaga ebitundu ku kikumi eby’abantu abazuuliddwa abafa obulwadde, n’omuwendo gw’abafa olw’obulwadde (IFR), ogulaga ebitundu ku kikumi eby’abantu abakwatibwa (abazuuliddwa n’abatazuuliddwa ) abafa obulwadde.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Ebibalo bino tebigendera ku ssaawa era bigoberera abantu ab’engeri emu okuva lwe bafunye obulwadde okutuuka ku nkomerero yaabwe (nga bawonye oba nga bafudde).
translated: Ebibalo bino tebirina budde era bigoberera omuwendo gw’abantu abamu okuva ku bulwadde okuyita mu kugonjoola ensonga.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: Weewaawo abantu bonna abalwala tebafuna basirikale balwanyisa ndwadde, omuntu okubeera n’abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde kiyinza okutuwa obubaka ku muwendo gw’abantu abakwatiddwa abalwadde.
translated: Wadde nga si bantu bonna abakwatibwa obulwadde buno nti bafuna obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde, okubeerawo kw’obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde kuyinza okuwa amawulire ku bantu bameka abakwatibwa.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: Mu Italy obulwadde gye bwasinga okwegiriisiza, ekyalo ekitonotono ekiyitibwa Castiglione d'Adda, abantu 4600, 80 (1.7%) baafa.
translated: Mu kifo ekikulu eky’obulwadde buno mu Yitale, Castiglione d’Adda, akabuga akatono akalimu abantu 4600, 80 (1.7%) baafa dda.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: Mu Gangelt, obulwadde bwasaasaanira mu bikujjuko ebyakazibwako Carnival festival, era omwo mwe bwava ne bukwata abavubuka, abantu batonotono ne bafa ear si buli muntu eyafa obulwadde bwa COVID-19 nti yategeerebwa nti bwe bumusse.
translated: E Gangelt, obulwadde buno bwasaasaanyizibwa ebikujjuko bya Carnival, ne busaasaana mu bavubuka, ekyaviirako okufa okutono ennyo, era si bonna abafa COVID-19 bayinza okuba nga baabalibwa mu butongole nga bwe batyo.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: Era, amalwaliro g’omu Bugirimaanyi tegazitoowereddwa balwadde.
translated: Ekirala, enkola y’ebyobulamu mu Girimaani tennazitoowererwa.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: Mu Netherlands, abantu nga 3% balina abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde, nga bwe kyalabibwa mu bagaba omusaayi.
translated: Mu Budaaki, ebitundu nga 3% biyinza okuba n’obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde, nga bwe kyakeberebwa okuva mu bagaba omusaayi.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 69 (ebitundu by’abantu 0.004%) bakakasiddwa nga bafudde COVID-19.
translated: 69 (0.004% ku bantu) bakakasiddwa nti bafudde COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: Okukosebwa okuva ku nawookeera wamu n’ekigero ky’abantu abafudde bya njawulo ku basajja ne ku bakazi.
translated: Ebikosa ssennyiga omukambwe n’omuwendo gw’abafa kwayo bya njawulo ku basajja n’abakazi.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: Okusinga ennyo, abasinze okufa basajja okusinziira ku kunoonyereza okukoleddwa mu China ne Italy.
translated: Okufa kusinga mu basajja mu kunoonyereza okwakoleddwa mu China ne Yitale.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: Obulabe obusinga okuba mu basajja, buli mu abo abali mu myaka egya 50s, ate ng’ebbanga eriri wakati wak’abasajja n’abakazi liri ku myaka 90.
translated: Obulabe obusinga eri abasajja buli mu myaka gya 50, ng’ekituli wakati w’abasajja n’abakazi kiggalawo ku 90 zokka.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: Mu China, ekigero ky’abafa kyali 2.8 ku kikumi mu basajja, ne 1.7 ku kikumu mu bakazi.
translated: Mu China, omuwendo gw’abafudde gwali 2.8 ku buli 100 mu basajja ate 1.7 ku buli 100 mu bakazi.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: Ensonga yennyini ereetawo enjawulo eno mu kikula temanyiddwa naye ng’endagabutonde n’enneeyisa byandibaamu omuzinzi.
translated: Ensonga entuufu eziviirako enjawulo eno ey’ekikula tezimanyiddwa, naye ensonga z’obuzaale n’enneeyisa ziyinza okuba ensonga.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: Enjawulo mu busibage eyeesigamiziddwa ku kigula, abakyala obutanywa nnyo sigala ate n’abasajja okubeeramu obulwadde obw’enjawulo gamba nga entunnunsi ku myaka emimpi okusinga bwe kiri mu bakazi kyandiba nga kyaleetera omuwendo gw’abasajja abafa okubeera waggulu.
translated: Enjawulo mu busimu obuziyiza endwadde okusinziira ku kikula ky’omuntu, okunywa sigala okutono mu bakyala n’abasajja abafuna embeera ezikwatagana nga puleesa ku myaka emito okusinga abakyala kyandibadde kivaako okufa kw’abasajja okungi.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: E Bulaaya, ebitundu 57% eby’abalwadde baali basajja era ebitundu 72% ku abo abaafa COVID-19 baali basajja.
translated: Mu Bulaaya, 57% ku bantu abakwatibwa obulwadde buno baali basajja ate 72% ku abo abaafa COVID-19 baali basajja.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: Ogwokuna 2020 we gwatuukira, gagumenti ya Amerika yali terondoola bubaka bukwata ku kikula mu balwadde ba COVID-19.
translated: We bwazibidde mu April 2020, gavumenti ya Amerika terondoola bikwata ku bantu abakwatibwa COVID-19 ebikwatagana n’ekikula ky’abantu.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kulaze nti obulwadde bw’obuwuka nga Ebola, HIV, yegu (influenza) ne SARS bukosa abasajja n’abakazi mu ngeri ya njawulo.
translated: Okunoonyereza kulaga nti endwadde z’akawuka nga Ebola, siriimu, ssennyiga ne SARS zikwata abasajja n’abakazi mu ngeri ya njawulo.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: Abajjanjabi abasinga obungi naddala bannansi, bakazi, kitegeeza nti balina emikisa mingi okusiigibwa akawuka ako.
translated: Ebitundu ebisinga ku bakozi b’ebyobulamu naddala ba nurse bakyala, era balina emikisa mingi egy’okukwatibwa akawuka kano.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: WHO Kyalangirira nga 11 Ogwokubiri 2020 nti erinnya ly’obulwadde ettongole buyitibwe "COVID-19".
translated: Ekitongole ky'ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna kyalangirira nga 11 February 2020 nti erinnya ettongole ery'obulwadde buno lyakubeera "COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: Ssenkulu wa WHO, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus yannyonnyola nti CO kikiikirira corona, VI ku lwa virus, D ku lwa bulwadde, ne 19 ku lw’ekiseera ekirwadde lwe kyasooka okulabibwa: 31 Deesemba 2019.
translated: Akulira ekitongole ky’ebyobulamu eky’ensi yonna, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus yannyonnyodde nti CO kitegeeza corona, VI kitegeeza akawuka, D kitegeeza obulwadde, ate 19 kitegeeza ddi ekirwadde kino lwe kyasooka okuzuulibwa: 31 December 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Erinnya lyalondebwa okwewala okujuliza ku kifo kyonna (gamba nga China), ebika by’ensolo oba ekibinja ky’abantu, nga bagobererwa ebisembebwa mu nsi yonna okwewala okusosola. Akawuka akaleeta COVID-19 kayitibwa severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
translated: Erinnya lino lyali lirondeddwa okwewala okujuliza ekifo ekigere (okugeza China), ebika by’ebisolo oba ekibinja ky’abantu, nga kikwatagana n’ebiragiro by’ensi yonna ku kutuuma amannya nga bigendereddwamu okutangira okuvumwavumwa.Akawuka akaleeta COVID-19 katuumiddwa severe acute respiratory syndrome akawuka ka corona 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: WHO era kikozesa "akawuka COVID-19" ne "akawukaka akavunaanyizibwa ku COVID-19" mu kuwuliziganya kwabwe n’abantu.
translated: WHO kwongera okukozesa "akawuka ka COVID-19" ne "akawuka akavunaanyizibwa ku COVID-19" mu mpuliziganya y'abantu.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: Byo byombi, obulwadde n’akawuka bitera okwogerwako nga "coronavirus".
translated: Obulwadde buno n'akawuka byombi bitera okuyitibwa "coronavirus".

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: Mu kiseera we bwasooka okubalukirawo mu Wuhan, China, akawuka n’obulwadde byali biyitibwa "coronavirus" ne "Wuhan coronavirus".
translated: Mu kiseera kino ekyasooka okubutuka mu kibuga Wuhan ekya China, akawuka kano n'obulwadde byali bitera okuyitibwa "coronavirus" ne "Wuhan coronavirus".

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: Mu Janwali 2020, WHO kyasemba 2019-nCov ne 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease ng’amannya ag’ekiseera okuyitibwa akawuka n’obulwadde nga bagoberera okuluŋŋamizibwa okwa 2015 okugaana okukozesa ebifo kutuuma endwadde n’obuwuka.
translated: Mu January 2020, WHO yawa amagezi 2019-nCov ne 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease nga amannya ag’ekiseera eri akawuka n’endwadde okusinziira ku ndagiriro ya 2015 ku kukozesa ebifo mu mannya g’endwadde n’akawuka.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: Amannya amatongole COVID-19 ne SARS-CoV-2 gaafulumizibwa nga 11 Ogwokubiri 2020.
translated: Amannya amatongole aga COVID-19 ne SARS-CoV-2 gaafulumiziddwa nga 11 February 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: Olw’obusobozi obutono mu kukola ebintu ebiri ku mutindo, ab’amakolero abamu bafulumya ebikozesebwa mu byobulamu nga swab z’omu nnyindo n’ebitundu by’ebyuma ebiyamba mu kussa.
translated: Olw’obusobozi obutono mu nkola z’okugaba ebintu eza mutindo, abamu ku bakola dijitwali bakuba ebitabo ebikwata ku by’obulamu nga ebyuma ebikuba ennyindo n’ebitundu by’ebyuma ebissa.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: Mu kyokulabirako ekimu, eddwaliro ly’omu Italy bwe lyali lyetaaga valve y’oku kyuma ekiyamba mu kussa, abikola n’alwawo okugireeta mu budde bwe yeetaagirwamu, ekkolero ly’omu nsi eyo lyatandika okuyiiya amagezi era ne likola valve 100 ezaali zeetaagibwa mu kiro kimu.
translated: Mu kyokulabirako ekimu, eddwaaliro ly’e Yitale bwe lyali lyetaaga mu bwangu vvaalu y’ekyuma ekissa, era ng’omugabi teyasobola kutuusa mu kiseera ekyetaagisa, kkampuni emu eyatandikawo mu kitundu yakyusa yinginiya n’ekuba vvaalu 100 ezeetaagisa mu kiro kimu.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: Oluvannyuma lw’okubalukawo kwa COVID-19, okwasooka, ebiteeberezo ebirimu obwekobaanyi, amawulire amakyamu byatandika okuyitiŋŋana nga byogera ku nsibuko, obunene, enziyiza n’enzijanjaba y’oubulwadde obwo wamu n’ebirala ebikwata ku bulwadde obwo era ne bisaasaana wonna ku yintaneeti mu kaseera mpa wekaaga.
translated: Oluvannyuma lw’okusooka okubutuka kw’ekirwadde kya COVID-19, endowooza z’olukwe, amawulire amakyamu n’amawulire amakyamu byavaayo ku nsibuko, obunene, okuziyiza, okujjanjaba n’ebirala ebikwata ku bulwadde buno ne busaasaana mangu ku mikutu gya yintaneeti.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: Abantu balabika nga basobola okusiiga ensolo obulwadde buno.
translated: Abantu balabika nga basobola okusaasaanya akawuka kano mu bisolo ebirala ebimu.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kwalemererwa okuzuula obubaka obulaga okwekubisaamu kw’obuwuka mu mbizzi, mu mbaata, ne mu nkoko.
translated: Okunoonyereza kuno kwalemererwa okuzuula obujulizi obulaga nti akawuka kaddamu mu mbizzi, engege n’enkoko.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: Tewali ddagala oba ddagala ligema lyakakasiddwa ku bulwadde buno.
translated: Tewali ddagala oba ddagala erigema likkirizibwa kujjanjaba bulwadde buno.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: Okunoonyereza kw’ensi yonna ku ddagala erigema n’eddagala lya COVID-19 likolebwako ebitongole bya gavumenti ez’enjawulo, ebibiina by’abanoonyereza, n’abanoonyereza mu makolereo.
translated: Okunoonyereza mu nsi yonna ku kugema n’eddagala mu COVID-19 kugenda mu maaso n’ebibiina bya gavumenti, ebibiina by’abasomesa n’abanoonyereza mu makolero.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Mu Gwokusatu, WHO kyatandikawo enkola eya "OKUKOLERA AWAMU mu Kugezesa" okwekaliriza eddagala eririwo ery’emirundi eno balabe erisinga okukola obulungi.
translated: Mu March, ekitongole ky'ebyobulamu mu nsi yonna kyatandikawo "SOLIDARITY Trial" okwekenneenya ebiva mu bujjanjabi bw'ebirungo bina ebiriwo ebiziyiza akawuka nga bisinga okusuubiza okukola obulungi.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: Tewali ddagala ligema naye ebitongole eby’enjawulo biri ku kaweefube wa kugezaako kufuna eryo erinaayamba.
translated: Tewali ddagala ligema liriwo, naye ebitongole eby’enjawulo bikola nnyo okukola eddagala erigema.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: Okunoonyereza okw’emabegako ku SARS-CoV kukozesebwa kubanga SARS-CoV ne SARS-CoV-2 bwombi bukozesa ACE2 receptor okuyingira mu butaffaali bwy’omuntu.
translated: Omulimu ogwasooka ku SARS-CoV gukozesebwa kubanga SARS-CoV ne SARS-CoV-2 zombi zikozesa ACE2 receptor okuyingira mu butoffaali bw’omuntu.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: Waliwo engeri z’eddagala erigema za mirundi esatu erinoonyerezebwako.
translated: Waliwo enkola ssatu ez’okugema ezinoonyezebwa.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: Okusooka, abanoonyereza baluubirira okukola eddagala ly’akawuka eryawamu.
translated: Ekisooka, abanoonyereza baluubirira okuzimba eddagala erigema akawuka lyonna.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: Okukozesa akawuka akalinga ako, si nsonga oba kalamu oba kafu, kuluubirira okuleetawo obusibage obukolerawo mu mubiri gw’omuntu eri obulwadde obupya wamu ne COVID-19.
translated: Okukozesa akawuka nga kano, ka kabeere nga tekakola oba nga kafudde, kigenderera okuleeta okuddamu okw’amangu kw’abaserikale b’omubiri mu mubiri gw’omuntu ku bulwadde obupya obwa COVID-19.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: Engeri endala, eddagala erigema eriyitibwa ‘subunit vaccines’, engeri eno eruubirira kukola ddagala erigema erireetera obusibage bw’omubiri okukenga akawuka nga kalumbye omubiri.
translated: Enkola eyokubiri, subunit vaccines, egenderera okukola eddagala erigema abaserikale b’omubiri okutegeera ebitundu ebimu eby’akawuka.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: Ku SARS-CoV-2, okunoonyereza okwo kusonze ku S-spike protein eyamba akawuka okuyingirira ACE2 enzyme receptor.
translated: Mu nsonga ya SARS-CoV-2, okunoonyereza ng’okwo kwesigamye ku puloteyina ya S-spike eyamba akawuka okuyingira mu ACE2 enzyme receptor.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: Engeri ey’okusatu y’eyo eya nucleic acid vaccines (DNA oba RNA vaccines, akakodyo akapya ak’okutondawo eddagala erigema).
translated: Enkola eyokusatu y’eyo ey’okugema asidi wa nucleic (okugema DNA oba RNA, enkola empya ey’okukola okugema).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: Eddagala ly’okugema erigezesebwa okuva mu nkola zino zijja kwetaagisa okugezesa okulaba nga teririna bulabe n’okujjanjaba obulungi. Nga 16 Ogwokusatu 2020, okugezesa obujjanjabi okwasooka kwatandika n’abantu bana abeewaayo okugezeserezebwako mu Seattle.
translated: Eddagala erigema okugezesa okuva mu nkola yonna ku zino lyandibadde lirina okukeberebwa okulaba oba lirina obukuumi n’obulungi.Nga 16 March 2020, okugezesa eddagala erisooka mu malwaliro lyatandika n’abazirakisa bana mu Seattle.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: Eddagala erigema lirimu genetic code ezitalina bulabe ezakoppebwa okuva ku kawuka akalwaza obulwadde obwo. Okutumbula amaanyi g’abasirikale b’omubiri kimenyeddwa ng’ekisobola okusoomooza okukola eddagala erigema erya SARS-COV-2, naye kino kibuzaabuza.
translated: Eddagala lino lirimu obuzaale obutali bwa bulabe obukoppololwa okuva mu kawuka akaleeta obulwadde buno.Okulongoosa okusinziira ku buziyiza (antibody dependent enhancement) kuteesebwako ng’okusoomoozebwa okuyinza okubaawo mu kukola eddagala erigema SARS-COV-2, naye kino kirimu okusika omuguwa.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: We tutuukidde mu Gwokuna 2020, waliwo okugezesa kw’ekisawo okusoba mu 300 okukolebwa.
translated: Waliwo okugezesebwa kw’obujjanjabi okusoba mu 300 okugenda mu maaso okutuuka mu April 2020.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: Okugezesa kwa mirundi musanvu kwali kwekenneenya eddagala eryamala edda okukakasibwa okujjanjaba omusujja, nga mwe muli n’okunoonyereza kwa mirundi ena ku hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
translated: Okugezesebwa musanvu kwali kwekenneenya obujjanjabi obwakkirizibwa edda ku musujja, nga kuliko n’okunoonyereza kuna ku hydroxychloroquine oba chloroquine.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Eddagala erirwanyisa obuwuka erikozesebwa okujjanjaba obulwadde obulala lye likola ekitundu ekisinga obunene mu kunoonyereza kwa China, nga balina okugezesa okuli ku mutendera III kwa mirundi mwenda ku remdesivir okwetoloola amawanga agawerako nga baakufulumya alipoota ku nkomerero ya Apuli.
translated: Eddagala eriweweeza ku kawuka eriddamu okukozesebwa lye lisinga okunoonyereza kwa China, nga waliwo okugezesebwa okw’omutendera ogw’okusatu mwenda ku remdesivir okwetoloola amawanga agawerako nga kulina okufulumizibwa ku nkomerero ya April.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: Okwekeneenya okw’amaanyi okw’ekisawo okw’okukola eddagala erigema erya COVID-19 n’ebisobola okubeera eddagala byaliwo, mu Apuli 2020. Eddagala erirwanyisa obuwuka eririwo lingi liri mu kwekenneenyezebwa okulaba oba lisobola okujjanjaba COVID-19, nga mwe muli, remdesivir, chloroquine ne hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir ne lopinavir/ritonavir nga mugattiddwamu interferon beta.
translated: Okwekenenya okw’amaanyi mu nkulaakulana y’obujjanjabi eri eddagala erigema COVID-19 n’eddagala erigenda okwesimbawo kwaliwo, okuva mu April 2020. Eddagala eritta akawuka eriwerako eririwo lyekenneenyezebwa okujjanjaba COVID-19, omuli remdesivir, chloroquine ne hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir ne lopinavir/ ritonavir nga egattibwa wamu ne interferon beta.

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
targetString: Mu Gw’okusatu 2020, waaliwo obubaka obutannakakasibwa nti remdesivir, yandiba nga ajjanjaba.
translated: Waliwo obujulizi obukakafu obulaga nti eddagala lya remdesivir likola bulungi, okuva mu March 2020.

sourceString: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
targetString: Waalabikawo okussuukamu mu balwadde abajjanjabibwa ne compassionate-use remdesivir.
translated: Okulongoosa mu bujjanjabi kwalabiddwa mu balwadde abajjanjabwa n’eddagala lya remdesivir eryakozesebwa mu ngeri ey’okusaasira.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
targetString: Omutendera III ogw’okugezesa kw’ekisawo gukolebwao mu US, China ne Italy. Chloroquine, eyakozesebwanga okujjanjaba omusujja, yekkeneenyezebwa mu China mu Gwokubiri 2020, era nga waliwo ebisookerwako ebyazuulibwa.
translated: Phase III clinical trials zikolebwa mu Amerika, China ne Italy.Eddagala lya Chloroquine, eryali likozesebwa okujjanjaba omusujja, lyasomesebwa mu China mu February 2020, n’ebyavaamu ebisookerwako.

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
targetString: Wabula, waliwo okusaba okwekenneenya okw’abakugu ab’enjawulo ku binoonyerezebwako.
translated: Wabula waliwo okusaba okwekenneenya okunoonyereza kuno okuva mu bannaabwe.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
targetString: Ab’ebyobulamu mu Korea ne China bawagira okukozesa chloroquine.
translated: Abakulira ebyobulamu mu Korea ne China bawa amagezi okukozesa eddagala lya chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
targetString: Wabula, wadde nga Wuhan Institute of Virology, bawagira okumira doozi emu buli lunaku eweza gulaamu emu, balabula nti bw’okubisaamu mu doozi eyo kya bulabe nnyo era kiyinza okukutta.
translated: Wabula ekitongole kya Wuhan Institute of Virology, wadde nga kiwa amagezi okukozesa ddoozi ya gram emu buli lunaku, kiraga nti ddoozi eyo emirundi ebiri ya bulabe nnyo era eyinza okutta.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: Nga 28 Ogwokusatu 2020, FDA yayisa ekiragiro eky’amangu ngekkiriza okukozesa hydroxychloroquine ne chloroquine nga basinziira ku kuwabula kw’abasawo abajjanjaba abalwadde ba COVID-19. Olufulumya olwo 7 lw’ebigobererwa Abachina era lugattako interferon, ribavirin oba umifenovir mu kujjanjaba COVID-19.
translated: Nga 28 March 2020, ekitongole kya FDA kyafulumya olukusa olw’okukozesa eddagala lya hydroxychloroquine ne chloroquine mu bwangu nga abasawo abajjanjaba abantu abalina COVID-19 bwe baagala.Ebiragiro by’Abachina eby’omusanvu era mulimu eddagala lya interferon, ribavirin oba umifenovir okukozesebwa okulwanyisa COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: Ebyakazuulibwawo biraga nti doozi ennyingi eza ribavirin zeetaagisa okutangira SARS-CoV-2 mu vitro.
translated: Ebiwandiiko ebisookerwako biraga nti dose ennene eza ribavirin zeetaagisa okuziyiza SARS-CoV-2 mu vitro.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Nitazoxanide awagiddwa okwongera okunoonyerezebwako mu bintu ebiramu oluvannyuma lw’okwolesa obunafu mu kutangira SARS- CoV-2. Ebizuuliddwa biraga nti initial spike protein priming eya transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) ya mugaso nnyo okuyingiza SARS-CoV-2 nga yeegatta ne ACE2 receptor.
translated: Nitazoxanide ebadde esemba okwongera okunoonyereza mu vivo oluvannyuma lw’okulaga okuziyiza okutono okwa SARS-CoV-2.Okunoonyereza kulaga nti okusooka spike protein priming nga transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) kyetaagisa nnyo okuyingira SARS-CoV-2 nga bayita mu kukwatagana ne ekirungo ekikwata ACE2.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Okunoonyereza ku chloroquine ne hydroxychloroquine nga mulimu oba temuli azithromycin zirina obunafu bungi obulemesezza abasawo okukkiriza okukozesa obujjanjabi buno nga tebwongedde kunoonyerezebwako. Oseltamivir takugira SARS-CoV-2 mu vitro era omugaso tegumanyiddwa COVID-19.
translated: Okunoonyereza ku chloroquine ne hydroxychloroquine nga mulimu oba nga temuli azithromycin kulina obuzibu obunene obulemesezza abasawo okwettanira obujjanjabi buno awatali kwongera kunoonyereza.Oseltamivir taziyiza SARS-CoV-2 mu vitro era terina kifo kimanyiddwa mu kujjanjaba COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: Cytokine storm buyinza okuba obukosefu obw’amaanyi nga COVID-19 anyiinyitidde.
translated: Cytokine storm eyinza okuba ekizibu mu biseera eby’oluvannyuma ebya COVID-19 eby’amaanyi.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: Waliwo obukakafu nti hydroxychloroquine ayinza okubaamu ebirungo bya anti-cytokine storm properties. Tocilizumab ateereddwa mu bigobererwa aba China National Health Commission okujjanjaba oluvannyuma lw’okukola okunoonyereza okutonotono.
translated: Waliwo obukakafu obulaga nti hydroxychloroquine ayinza okuba n’obusobozi obuziyiza cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab ebadde eyingiziddwa mu ndagiriro z’obujjanjabi okuva mu kakiiko k’ebyobulamu mu China oluvannyuma lw’okunoonyereza okutono okuggwa.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: Eri ku mutendera 2 ogw’okugezesa okwetegekere ku mutendera gw’eggwanga mu Italy oluvannyuma lw’okulaga obubonero bw’obulwadde mu bantu abayi.
translated: Egenda mu maaso n’okukeberebwa okwa phase 2 non randomized test ku mutendera gw’eggwanga mu Italy oluvannyuma lw’okulaga ebirungi mu bantu abalina obulwadde obw’amaanyi.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: Kati ligattiddwamu serum ferritin blood test okuzuula cytokine storms, era nga ligenderera kutangira bintu nga bino, ebirowoozebwa okutta abalwadde abamu.
translated: Ng’ogasseeko okukebera omusaayi gwa serum ferritin okuzuula omuyaga gwa cytokine, kigendereddwamu okulwanyisa enkulaakulana ng’ezo, ezilowoozebwa nti ze zitta abantu abamu abakoseddwa.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: Interleukin-6 receptor antagonist yakakasibwa ekitongole kya FDA nga beesigama ku kunoonyereza okw’emabega okujjanjaba steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome ereetebwa ekintu ekirala, CAR T cell therapy, mu 2017.
translated: Ekirungo ekiziyiza interleukin-6 receptor antagonist kyakkirizibwa ekitongole kya FDA okusinziira ku kunoonyereza ku mbeera ezizze emabega okujjanjaba obulwadde bwa steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome obuleetebwa ensonga ey’enjawulo, CAR T cell therapy, mu 2017.

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: Okutuusa leero, tewali bukakafu bwa nkukunala nti tocilizumab ajjanjaba n’awonya CRS.
translated: N’okutuusa kati, tewali bujulizi bwa randomized, controlled obulaga nti tocilizumab bujjanjabi bulungi eri CRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: Okukyusa abasirikale b’omubiri abalongooseddwa n’okugattibwa nga bakoleddwa omuyungo gw’obusibage ogw’abo abawonye COVID-19 ne bateekebwa mu bantu ababeetaaga kyekennenyezebwa ng’enkola etangira obulwadde ng’omuntu tagemeddwa.
translated: Okukyusa obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde obulongooseddwa n’obungi obukolebwa abaserikale b’omubiri gw’abo abawonye ekirwadde kya COVID-19 eri abantu ababa beetaaga kunoonyerezebwako ng’enkola etali ya kugema ey’okugema obutasalako.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: Enkola eno yagezesebwa ku SARS naye nga ebyazuulibwa tebyali bya nkomeredde.
translated: Enkola eno yagezesebwa ku SARS nga ebivuddemu tebituukiridde.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Okunafuya obuwuka y’enkola ey’okujjanjaba nga ekozesa obuwuka bu kyesirikidde okulwanyisa SARS-CoV-2.
translated: Viral neutralization y’enkola esuubirwa okukola nga passive antibody therapy esobola okutabaganya okwekuuma SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: Enkola endala wabula, nga antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity ne/oba phagocytosis, zisoboka.
translated: Enkola endala wabula, nga obutwa mu butoffaali obusinziira ku buziyiza (antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity) ne/oba phagocytosis, ziyinza okusoboka.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: Enkola endala ey’okujjanjabisa abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde ba kyesirikidde, okugeza, okukozesa abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde abaweeseddwa abayitibwa monoclonal, bali mu kukolebwa.
translated: Ebika ebirala eby’obujjanjabi bw’obutafaali obuziyiza endwadde (passive antibody therapy), okugeza, nga tukozesa obutoffaali obuziyiza endwadde obuyitibwa monoclonal antibodies obukoleddwa, biri mu nkulaakulana.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: Okukola convalescent serum, omuli omusaayi okuva ku balwadde abawonye era mulimu abasirikale abalwanyisa endwadde ezireetebwa akawuka kano, kusobola okwongerwako okusobola okwongera ku kukukola eddagala.
translated: Okukola serum ewonye, erimu ekitundu ky’omusaayi eky’amazzi okuva mu balwadde abawonye era nga kirimu obutoffaali obuziyiza akawuka kano, kuyinza okwongerwako okusobola okuteekebwa mu nkola amangu.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: Endwadde za Coronavirus, ekibinja ky’obubonero obufaanagana
translated: Endwadde za Coronavirus, ekibinja ky’obulwadde obukwatagana ennyo

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: Li Wenliang, dokita mu Central Hospital e Wuhan, oluvannyuma yakwatibwa obulwadde bwa COVID-19 era n’ekyavaamu n’afa ng’amaze okumanyisa ku nsaasaana y’akawuka ako.
translated: Li Wenliang, omusawo mu ddwaaliro lya Central Hospital of Wuhan, oluvannyuma eyakwatibwa n’afa ekirwadde kya COVID-19 oluvannyuma lw’okumanyisa abantu ku kusaasaana kw’akawuka kano.
